verses.textEn: Adam, Seth, Enos,
verses.textLa: Adam, Seth, Enos,

verses.textEn: Cainan, Mahalalel, Jared,
verses.textLa: Cainan, Malaleel, Iared,

verses.textEn: Enoch, Methuselah, Lamech,
verses.textLa: Henoch, Mathusale, Lamech,

verses.textEn: Noah, Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
verses.textLa: Noe, Sem, Cham, et Iaptheth.

verses.textEn: The sons of Japheth: Gomer, and Magog, and Madai, and Javan, Tubal, Meshech, Tiras.
verses.textLa: Filii Iapheth: Gomer, et Magog, et Madai, et Iavan, Thubal, Mosoch, Thiras.

verses.textEn: And the sons of Gomer: Ashkenaz, and Riphath, and Togarmah.
verses.textLa: Porro filii Gomer: Ascenez, et Riphath, et Thogorma.

verses.textEn: And the sons of Javan: Elishah and Tarshish, Kittim and Rodanim.
verses.textLa: Filii autem Iavan: Elisa et Tharsis, Cethim et Dodanim.

verses.textEn: The sons of Ham: Cush, and Mizraim, and Put, and Canaan.
verses.textLa: Filii Cham: Chus, et Mesraim, et Phut, et Chanaan.

verses.textEn: And the sons of Cush: Seba, and Havilah, Sabtah, and Raamah, and Sabteca. And the sons of Raamah: Sheba and Dadan.
verses.textLa: Filii autem Chus: Saba, et Hevila, Sabatha, et Regma, et Sabathacha. Porro filii Regma: Saba, et Dadan.

verses.textEn: Then Cush conceived Nimrod, and he began to be powerful upon the earth.
verses.textLa: Chus autem genuit Nemrod: iste cœpit esse potens in terra.

verses.textEn: Truly, Mizraim conceived Ludim, and Anamim, and Lehabim, and Naphtuhim,
verses.textLa: Mesraim vero genuit Ludim, et Anamim, et Laabim, et Nephtuim,

verses.textEn: as well as Pathrusim and Casluhim: from these the Philistines and the Caphtorim went forth.
verses.textLa: Phetrusim quoque, et Casluim: de quibus egressi sunt Philisthiim, et Caphtorim.

verses.textEn: Truly, Canaan conceived Sidon, his firstborn, as well as the Hittite,
verses.textLa: Chanaan vero genuit Sidonem primogenitum suum, Hethæum quoque,

verses.textEn: and the Jebusite, and the Amorite, and the Girgashite,
verses.textLa: et Iebusæum, et Amorrhæum, et Gergesæum,

verses.textEn: and the Hivite, and the Arkite, and the Sinite,
verses.textLa: Hevæumque et Aracæum, et Sinæum.

verses.textEn: and also the Arvadian, and the Samarite, and the Hamathite.
verses.textLa: Aradium quoque, et Samaræum, et Hamathæum.

verses.textEn: The sons of Shem: Elam, and Asshur, and Arphaxad, and Lud, and Aram, and Uz, and Hul, and Gether, and Meshech.
verses.textLa: Filii Sem: Ælam, et Assur, et Arphaxad, et Lud, et Aram, et Hus, et Hul, et Gether, et Mosoch.

verses.textEn: Then Arphaxad conceived Shelah, who also himself conceived Eber.
verses.textLa: Arphaxad autem genuit Sale, qui et ipse genuit Heber.

verses.textEn: And to Eber were born two sons. The name of one was Peleg, because in his days the earth was divided. And the name of his brother was Joktan.
verses.textLa: Porro Heber nati sunt duo filii, nomen uni Phaleg, quia in diebus eius divisa est terra; et nomen fratris eius Iectan.

verses.textEn: Then Joktan conceived Almodad, and Sheleph, and Hazarmaveth, and Jerah,
verses.textLa: Iectan autem genuit Elmodad, et Saleph, et Asarmoth, et Iare,

verses.textEn: as well as Hadoram, and Uzal, and Diklah,
verses.textLa: Adoram quoque, et Huzal, et Decla,

verses.textEn: and then Obal, and Abimael, and Sheba, indeed
verses.textLa: Hebal etiam, et Abimael, et Saba, necnon

verses.textEn: also Ophir, and Havilah, and Jobab. All these are the sons of Joktan.
verses.textLa: et Ophir, et Hevila, et Iobab. Omnes isti filii Iectan:

verses.textEn: Shem, Arphaxad, Shelah,
verses.textLa: Sem, Arphaxad, Sale,

verses.textEn: Eber, Peleg, Reu,
verses.textLa: Heber, Phaleg, Ragau,

verses.textEn: Serug, Nahor, Terah,
verses.textLa: Serug, Nachor, Thare,

verses.textEn: Abram, the same is Abraham.
verses.textLa: Abram, iste est Abraham.

verses.textEn: And the sons of Abraham: Isaac and Ishmael.
verses.textLa: Filii autem Abraham, Isaac et Ismael.

verses.textEn: And these are their generations: the firstborn of Ishmael, Nebaioth, and then Kedar, and Adbeel, and Mibsam,
verses.textLa: Et hæ generationes eorum. Primogenitus Ismahelis, Nabaioth, et Cedar, et Adbeel, et Mabsam,

verses.textEn: and Mishma, and Dumah, Massa, Hadad, and Tema,
verses.textLa: et Masma, et Duma, Massa, Hadad, et Thema,

verses.textEn: Jetur, Naphish, Kedemah. These are the sons of Ishmael.
verses.textLa: Ietur, Naphis, Cedma. Hi sunt filii Ismahelis.

verses.textEn: And the sons of Keturah, the concubine of Abraham, whom she conceived: Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak, and Shuah. And the sons of Jokshan: Sheba and Dedan. And the sons of Dedan: Asshurim, and Letushim, and Leummim.
verses.textLa: Filii autem Ceturæ concubinæ Abraham, quos genuit: Zamran, Iecsan, Madan, Madian, Iesboc, et Sue. Porro filii Iecsan: Saba, et Dadan. Filii autem Dadan: Assurim, et Latussim, et Laomim.

verses.textEn: And the sons of Midian: Ephah, and Epher, and Hanoch, and Abida, and Eldaah. All these are the sons of Keturah.
verses.textLa: Filii autem Madian: Epha, et Epher, et Henoch, et Abida, et Eldaa. Omnes hi, filii Ceturæ.

verses.textEn: Now Abraham conceived Isaac, whose sons were Esau and Israel.
verses.textLa: Genuit autem Abraham Isaac: cuius fuerunt filii Esau, et Israel.

verses.textEn: The sons of Esau: Eliphaz, Reuel, Jeush, Jalam, and Korah.
verses.textLa: Filii Esau: Eliphaz, Rahuel, Iehus, Ihelom, et Core.

verses.textEn: The sons of Eliphaz: Teman, Omar, Zepho, Gatam, Kenez, and by Timna, Amalek.
verses.textLa: Filii Eliphaz: Theman, Omar, Sephi, Gathan, Cenez, et Thamna, Amalec.

verses.textEn: The sons of Reuel: Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, Mizzah.
verses.textLa: Filii Rahuel: Nahath, Zara, Samma, Meza.

verses.textEn: The sons of Seir: Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah, Dishon, Ezer, Dishan.
verses.textLa: Filii Seir: Lotan, Sobal, Sebeon, Ana, Dison, Eser, Disan.

verses.textEn: The sons of Lotan: Hori, Heman. Now the sister of Lotan was Timna.
verses.textLa: Filii Lotan: Hori, Homam. Soror autem Lotan fuit Thamna.

verses.textEn: The sons of Shobal: Alian, and Manahath, and Ebal, Shephi, and Onam. The sons of Zibeon: Aiah and Anah. The sons of Anah: Dishon.
verses.textLa: Filii Sobal: Alian, et Manahath, et Ebal, Sephi et Onam. Filii Sebeon: Aia et Ana. Filii Ana: Dison.

verses.textEn: The sons of Dishon: Hamran, and Esheban, and Ithran, and Cheran.
verses.textLa: Filii Dison: Hamram, et Eseban et Iethran, et Charan.

verses.textEn: The sons of Ezer: Bilhan, and Zaavan, and Akan. The sons of Dishan: Uz and Aran.
verses.textLa: Filii Eser: Balaan, et Zavan, et Iacan. Filii Disan: Hus et Aran.

verses.textEn: Now these are the kings who reigned in the land of Edom, before there was a king over the sons of Israel: Bela, the son of Beor; and the name of his city was Dinhabah.
verses.textLa: Isti sunt reges, qui imperaverunt in Terra Edom antequam esset rex super filios Israel: Bale filius Beor: et nomen civitatis eius, Denaba.

verses.textEn: Then Bela died, and Jobab, the son of Zerah, from Bozrah, reigned in his place.
verses.textLa: Mortuus est autem Bale, et regnavit pro eo Iobab filius Zare de Bosra.

verses.textEn: And when Jobab also had died, Husham, from the land of the Temanites, reigned in his place.
verses.textLa: Cumque et Iobab fuisset mortuus, regnavit pro eo Husam de Terra Themanorum.

verses.textEn: Then Husham also passed away, and Hadad, the son of Bedad, reigned in his place. And he struck the Midianites in the land of Moab. The name of his city was Avith.
verses.textLa: Obiit quoque et Husam, et regnavit pro eo Adad filius Badad, qui percussit Madian in Terra Moab: et nomen civitatis eius Avith.

verses.textEn: And when Hadad also had died, Samlah from Masrekah reigned in his place.
verses.textLa: Cumque et Adad fuisset mortuus, regnavit pro eo Semla de Masreca.

verses.textEn: Then Samlah also died, and Shaul from Rehoboth, which is situated beside a river, reigned in his place.
verses.textLa: Sed et Semla mortuus est, et regnavit pro eo Saul de Rohoboth, quæ iuxta amnem sita est.

verses.textEn: Shaul also having died, Baal-hanan, the son of Achbor, reigned in his place.
verses.textLa: Mortuo quoque Saul, regnavit pro eo Balanan filius Achobor.

verses.textEn: Then he too died, and Hadar reigned in his place. And the name of his city was Pau. And his wife was called Mehetabel, the daughter of Matred, the daughter of Mezahab.
verses.textLa: Sed et hic mortuus est, et regnavit pro eo Adad: cuius urbis nomen fuit Phau, et appellata est uxor eius Meetabel filia Matred filiæ Mezaab.

verses.textEn: And Hadar having died, there began to be commanders in Edom in place of kings: commander Thamna, commander Alvah, commander Jetheth,
verses.textLa: Adad autem mortuo, duces pro regibus in Edom esse cœperunt: dux Thamna, dux Alva, dux Ietheth,
verses.notes: This Thamna is kept in the Latin spelling to distinguish him from Timna (Latin: Thamna) in the previous verses.

verses.textEn: commander Oholibamah, commander Elah, commander Pinon,
verses.textLa: dux Oolibama, dux Ela, dux Phinon,

verses.textEn: commander Kanez, commander Teman, commander Mibzar,
verses.textLa: dux Cenez, dux Theman, dux Mabsar,

verses.textEn: commander Magdiel, commander Iram. These are the commanders of Edom.
verses.textLa: dux Magdiel, dux Hiram. Hi duces Edom.

verses.textEn: And the sons of Israel: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, and Zebulun,
verses.textLa: Filii autem Israel: Ruben, Simeon, Levi, Iuda, Issachar, et Zabulon,

verses.textEn: Dan, Joseph, Benjamin, Naphtali, Gad, and Asher.
verses.textLa: Dan, Ioseph, Beniamin, Nephthali, Gad et Aser.

verses.textEn: The sons of Judah: Er, Onan, and Shelah. These three were born to him from the daughter of Shua, the Canaanite. But Er, the firstborn of Judah, was evil in the sight of the Lord, and so he killed him.
verses.textLa: Filii Iuda: Her, Onan, et Sela. Hi tres nati sunt ei de filia Sue Chananitide. Fuit autem Her primogenitus Iuda, malus coram Domino, et occidit eum.

verses.textEn: Now Tamar, his daughter-in-law, bore to him Perez and Zerah. Therefore, all the sons of Judah were five.
verses.textLa: Thamar autem nurus eius peperit ei Phares et Zara. Omnes ergo filii Iuda, quinque.

verses.textEn: And the sons of Perez: Hezron and Hamul.
verses.textLa: Filii autem Phares: Hesron et Hamul.

verses.textEn: Also, the sons of Zerah: Zimri, and Ethan, and Heman, as well as Calcol and Dara, five altogether.
verses.textLa: Filii quoque Zaræ: Zamri, et Ethan, et Eman, Chalchal quoque, et Dara, simul quinque.

verses.textEn: The sons of Carmi: Achar, who disturbed Israel and sinned by the theft of what was anathema.
verses.textLa: Filii Charmi: Achar, qui turbavit Israel, et peccavit in furto anathematis.

verses.textEn: The sons of Ethan: Azariah.
verses.textLa: Filii Ethan: Azarias.

verses.textEn: And the sons of Hezron who were born to him: Jerahmeel, and Ram, and Chelubai.
verses.textLa: Filii autem Hesron qui nati sunt ei: Ierameel, et Ram, et Calubi.

verses.textEn: Then Ram conceived Amminadab. And Amminadab conceived Nahshon, a leader of the sons of Judah.
verses.textLa: Porro Ram genuit Aminadab. Aminadab autem genuit Nahasson, principem filiorum Iuda.

verses.textEn: Also, Nahshon conceived Salma, from whom Boaz rose up.
verses.textLa: Nahasson quoque genuit Salma, de quo ortus est Booz.

verses.textEn: Truly, Boaz conceived Obed, who also himself conceived Jesse.
verses.textLa: Booz vero genuit Obed, qui et ipse genuit Isai.

verses.textEn: Now Jesse conceived the firstborn Eliab, the second Abinadab, the third Shammah,
verses.textLa: Isai autem genuit primogenitum Eliab, secundum Abinadab, tertium Simmaa,

verses.textEn: the fourth Nethanel, the fifth Raddai,
verses.textLa: quartum Nathanael, quintum Raddai,

verses.textEn: the sixth Ozem, the seventh David.
verses.textLa: sextum Asom, septimum David.

verses.textEn: Their sisters were Zeruiah and Abigail. The sons of Zeruiah: Abishai, Joab, and Asahel, three.
verses.textLa: Quorum sorores fuerunt Sarvia, et Abigail. Filii Sarviæ: Abisai, Ioab, et Asael, tres.

verses.textEn: And Abigail conceived Amasa, whose father was Jether, the Ishmaelite.
verses.textLa: Abigail autem genuit Amasa, cuius pater fuit Iether Ismahelites.

verses.textEn: Truly, Caleb, the son of Hezron, took a wife named Azubah, of whom he conceived Jerioth. And her sons were Jesher, and Shobab, and Ardon.
verses.textLa: Caleb vero filius Hesron accepit uxorem nomine Azuba, de qua genuit Ierioth: fueruntque filii eius Iaser, et Sobab, et Ardon.

verses.textEn: And when Azubah had died, Caleb took as wife Ephratha, who bore to him Hur.
verses.textLa: Cumque mortua fuisset Azuba, accepit uxorem Caleb, Ephratha: quæ peperit ei Hur.

verses.textEn: Now Hur conceived Uri. And Uri conceived Bezalel.
verses.textLa: Porro Hur genuit Uri: et Uri genuit Bezeleel.

verses.textEn: And afterwards, Hezron entered to the daughter of Machir, father of Gilead. And he took her when he was sixty years old. And she bore to him Segub.
verses.textLa: Post hæc ingressus est Hesron ad filiam Machir patris Galaad, et accepit eam cum esset annorum sexaginta: quæ peperit ei Segub.

verses.textEn: And then Segub conceived Jair, and he possessed twenty-three cities in the land of Gilead.
verses.textLa: Sed et Segub genuit Iair, et possedit viginti tres civitates in Terra Galaad.

verses.textEn: And he seized Geshur and Aram, towns of Jair, and Kenath and its villages, sixty cities. All these were sons of Machir, father of Gilead.
verses.textLa: Cepitque Gessur, et Aram oppida Iair, et Canath, et viculos eius sexaginta civitatum. Omnes isti, filii Machir patris Galaad.

verses.textEn: Then, when Hezron had died, Caleb entered to Ephratha. Also, Hezron had as wife Abia, who bore to him Ashhur, the father of Tekoa.
verses.textLa: Cum autem mortuus esset Hesron, ingressus est Caleb ad Ephratha. Habuit quoque Hesron uxorem Abia, quæ peperit ei Assur patrem Thecuæ.

verses.textEn: Now sons were born to Jerahmeel, the firstborn of Hezron: Ram, his firstborn, and Bunah, and Oren, and Ozem, and Ahijah.
verses.textLa: Nati sunt autem filii Ierameel primogeniti Hesron, Ram primogenitus eius, et Buna, et Aram, et Asom, et Achia.

verses.textEn: Jerahmeel also married another wife, named Atarah, who was the mother of Onam.
verses.textLa: Duxit quoque uxorem alteram Ierameel, nomine Atara, quæ fuit mater Onam.

verses.textEn: Then too, the sons of Ram, the firstborn of Jerahmeel, were Maaz, Jamin, and Eker.
verses.textLa: Sed et filii Ram primogeniti Ierameel, fuerunt Moos, Iamin, et Achar.

verses.textEn: And Onam had sons: Shammai and Jada. And the sons of Shammai: Nadab and Abishur.
verses.textLa: Onam autem habuit filios Semei, et Iada. Filii autem Semei: Nadab, et Abisur.

verses.textEn: Truly, the name of the wife of Abishur was Abihail, who bore to him Ahban and Molid.
verses.textLa: Nomen vero uxoris Abisur, Abihail, quæ peperit ei Ahobban, et Molid.

verses.textEn: Now the sons of Nadab were Seled and Appaim. And Seled died without children.
verses.textLa: Filii autem Nadab fuerunt Saled, et Apphaim. Mortuus est autem Saled absque liberis.

verses.textEn: Truly, the son of Appaim was Ishi. And Ishi conceived Sheshan. Then Sheshan conceived Ahlai.
verses.textLa: Filius vero Apphaim, Iesi: qui Iesi genuit Sesan. Porro Sesan genuit Oholai.

verses.textEn: But the sons of Jada, the brother of Shammai, were Jether and Jonathan. Then Jether also died without children.
verses.textLa: Filii autem Iada fratris Semei: Iether, et Ionathan. Sed et Iether mortuus est absque liberis.

verses.textEn: And Jonathan conceived Peleth and Zaza. These were the sons of Jerahmeel.
verses.textLa: Porro Ionathan genuit Phaleth, et Ziza. Isti fuerunt filii Ierameel.

verses.textEn: Now Sheshan did not have sons, but only daughters, and an Egyptian servant named Jarha.
verses.textLa: Sesan autem non habuit filios, sed filias: et servum Ægyptium nomine Ieraa.

verses.textEn: And so he gave to him his daughter as wife, who bore to him Attai.
verses.textLa: Deditque ei filiam suam uxorem: quæ peperit ei Ethei.

verses.textEn: Then Attai conceived Nathan, and Nathan conceived Zabad.
verses.textLa: Ethei autem genuit Nathan, et Nathan genuit Zabad.

verses.textEn: Also, Zabad conceived Ephlal, and Ephlal conceived Obed.
verses.textLa: Zabad quoque genuit Ophlal, et Ophlal genuit Obed.

verses.textEn: Obed conceived Jehu; Jehu conceived Azariah.
verses.textLa: Obed genuit Iehu, Iehu genuit Azariam.

verses.textEn: Azariah conceived Helez, and Helez conceived Eleasah.
verses.textLa: Azarias genuit Helles, et Helles genuit Elasa.

verses.textEn: Eleasah conceived Sismai; Sismai conceived Shallum.
verses.textLa: Elasa genuit Sisamoi, Sisamoi genuit Sellum.

verses.textEn: Shallum conceived Jekamiah; then Jekamiah conceived Elishama.
verses.textLa: Sellum genuit Icamiam, Icamia autem genuit Elisama.

verses.textEn: And the sons of Caleb, the brother of Jerahmeel, were Mesha, his firstborn, who was the father of Ziph, and the sons of Mesha, the father of Hebron.
verses.textLa: Filii autem Caleb fratris Ierameel: Mesa primogenitus eius, ipse est pater Ziph: et filii Maresa patris Hebron.

verses.textEn: Now the sons of Hebron were Korah, and Tapuah, and Rekem, and Shema.
verses.textLa: Porro filii Hebron, Core, et Taphua, et Recem, et Samma.

verses.textEn: Then Shema conceived Raham, the father of Jorkeam. And Rekem conceived Shammai.
verses.textLa: Samma autem genuit Raham, patrem Iercaam, et Recem genuit Sammai.

verses.textEn: The son of Shammai was Maon, and Maon was the father of Bethzur.
verses.textLa: Filius Sammai, Maon: et Maon pater Bethsur.

verses.textEn: Now Ephah, the concubine of Caleb, bore Haran, and Moza, and Gazez. And Haran conceived Gazez.
verses.textLa: Epha autem concubina Caleb peperit Haran, et Mosa, et Gezez. Porro Haran genuit Gezez.

verses.textEn: And the sons of Jahdai: Regem, and Jotham, and Geshan, and Pelet, and Ephah, and Shaaph.
verses.textLa: Filii autem Iahaddai, Regom, et Ioathan, et Gesan, et Phalet, et Epha, et Saaph.

verses.textEn: And Maacah, the concubine of Caleb, bore Sheber and Tirhanah.
verses.textLa: Concubina Caleb Maacha, peperit Saber, et Tharana.

verses.textEn: Then Shaaph, the father of Madmannah, conceived Sheva, the father of Machbenah, and the father of Gibea. Truly, the daughter of Caleb was Achsah.
verses.textLa: Genuit autem Saaph pater Madmena, Sue patrem Machbena, et patrem Gabaa. Filia vero Caleb, fuit Achsa.

verses.textEn: These were the sons of Caleb, the son of Hur, the firstborn of Ephratha: Shobal, the father of Kiriath-jearim;
verses.textLa: Hi erant filii Caleb, filii Hur primogeniti Ephratha, Sobal pater Cariathiarim.

verses.textEn: Salma, the father of Bethlehem; Hareph, the father of Bethgader.
verses.textLa: Salma pater Bethlehem, Hariph pater Bethgader.

verses.textEn: Now there were sons for Shobal, the father of Kiriath-jearim, who saw half the places of rest.
verses.textLa: Fuerunt autem filii Sobal patris Cariathiarim, qui videbat dimidium requietionum.

verses.textEn: And from the kindred of Kiriath-jearim: the Ithrites, and the Puthites, and the Shumathites, and the Mishraites. From these, the Zorathites and the Eshtaolites went forth.
verses.textLa: Et de cognatione Cariathiarim, Iethrei, et Aphuthei, et Semathei, et Maserei. Ex his egressi sunt Saraitæ, et Esthaolitæ.

verses.textEn: The sons of Salma: Bethlehem, and the Netophathites, the crowns of the house of Joab, and half the places of rest of the Zorathites,
verses.textLa: Filii Salma, Bethlehem, et Netophathi, Coronæ domus Ioab, et dimidium requietionis Sarai,

verses.textEn: as well as the families of the scribes living in Jabesh, those singing and making music, and those dwelling in tents. These are the Kenites, who went forth from Calor, the father of the house of Rechab.
verses.textLa: cognationes quoque scribarum habitantium in Iabes, canentes atque resonantes, et in tabernaculis commorantes. Hi sunt Cinæi, qui venerunt de Calore patris domus Rechab.
verses.notes: Apparently, these were separate groups within the tribe of the Kenites: the scribes at Jabesh, the group employed in singing and making music, and those who were tent dwellers (perhaps implying that they were semi-nomadic).

verses.textEn: Truly, David had these sons, who were born to him in Hebron: the firstborn Amnon, of Ahinoam the Jezreelite; the second Daniel, from Abigail the Carmelite;
verses.textLa: David vero hos habuit filios, qui ei nati sunt in Hebron; primogenitum Amnon ex Achinoam Iezrahelitide, secundum Daniel de Abigail Carmelitide,

verses.textEn: the third Absalom, the son of Maacah, daughter of Talmai, king of Geshur; the fourth Adonijah, the son of Haggith;
verses.textLa: tertium Absalom filium Maacha filiæ Tholmai regis Gessur, quartum Adoniam filium Aggith,

verses.textEn: the fifth Shephatiah, of Abital; the sixth Ithream, from his wife Eglah.
verses.textLa: quintum Saphathiam ex Abital, sextum Iethraham de Egla uxore sua.

verses.textEn: Therefore, six were born to him in Hebron, where he reigned for seven years and six months. Then he reigned for thirty-three years in Jerusalem.
verses.textLa: Sex ergo nati sunt ei in Hebron, ubi regnavit septem annis et sex mensibus. Triginta autem et tribus annis regnavit in Ierusalem.

verses.textEn: Now in Jerusalem, sons were born to him: Shammua, and Sobab, and Nathan, and Solomon, these four from Bathsheba, the daughter of Ammiel;
verses.textLa: Porro in Ierusalem nati sunt ei filii Simmaa, et Sobab, et Nathan, et Salomon, quattuor de Bethsabee filia Ammiel,

verses.textEn: also Ibhar and Elishama,
verses.textLa: Iebaar quoque et Elisama,

verses.textEn: and Eliphelet, and Nogah, and Nepheg, and Japhia,
verses.textLa: et Eliphaleth, et Noge, et Nepheg, et Iaphia,

verses.textEn: indeed also Elishama, and Eliada, and Eliphelet, nine.
verses.textLa: necnon Elisama, et Eliada, et Elipheleth, novem:

verses.textEn: All these were sons of David, aside from the sons of the concubines. And they had a sister, Tamar.
verses.textLa: Omnes hi, filii David absque filiis concubinarum: habueruntque sororem Thamar.

verses.textEn: Now the son of Solomon was Rehoboam, from whom Abijah conceived a son, Asa. And from him, there was born Jehoshaphat,
verses.textLa: Filius autem Salomonis, Roboam: cuius Abia filius genuit Asa. De hoc quoque natus est Iosaphat,

verses.textEn: the father of Jehoram. And Jehoram conceived Ahaziah, from whom there was born Jehoash.
verses.textLa: pater Ioram: qui Ioram genuit Ochoziam, ex quo ortus est Ioas:

verses.textEn: And his son, Amaziah, conceived Azariah. Then Jotham, the son of Azariah,
verses.textLa: et huius Amasias filius genuit Azariam. Porro Azariæ filius Ioatham

verses.textEn: conceived Ahaz, the father of Hezekiah, from whom was born Manasseh.
verses.textLa: procreavit Achaz patrem Ezechiæ, de quo natus est Manasses.

verses.textEn: Then too, Manasseh conceived Amon, the father of Josiah.
verses.textLa: Sed et Manasses genuit Amon patrem Iosiæ.

verses.textEn: Now the sons of Josiah were these: the firstborn Johanan, the second Jehoiakim, the third Zedekiah, the fourth Shallum.
verses.textLa: Filii autem Iosiæ fuerunt, primogenitus Iohanan, secundus Ioakim, tertius Sedecias, quartus Sellum.

verses.textEn: From Jehoiakim was born Jeconiah and Zedekiah.
verses.textLa: De Ioakim natus est Iechonias, et Sedecias.

verses.textEn: The sons of Jeconiah the captive were: Shealtiel,
verses.textLa: Filii Iechoniæ fuerunt, Asir, Salathiel,

verses.textEn: Malchiram, Pedaiah, Shenazzar, and Jekamiah, Hoshama, and Nedabiah.
verses.textLa: Melchiram, Phadaia, Senneser et Iecemia, Sama, et Nadabia.

verses.textEn: From Pedaiah, there rose up Zerubbabel and Shimei. Zerubbabel conceived Meshullam, Hananiah, and their sister Shelomith,
verses.textLa: De Phadaia orti sunt Zorobabel et Semei. Zorobabel genuit Mosollam, Hananiam, et Salomith sororem eorum:
verses.notes: Other passages in Sacred Scripture state that Shealtiel conceived Zerubbabel. The phrasing that relates Zerubbabel to Pedaiah is somewhat unusual; instead of the more common ‘genuit’ (begot or conceived) used in the passages saying that Shealtiel conceived Zerubbabel, here the figurative phrase is used meaning ‘to rise up from’ (orti sunt). When a man died without a male heir, the custom among the Jews was for his brother to take the deceased man’s wife and conceive children on behalf of his brother. Thus it may be that Zerubbabel and Shimei were both conceived by Shealtiel, because Pedaiah had died without any son. Then this passage attributes Zerubbabel and Shimei to Pedaiah, as having risen up from him, but they actually had Shealtiel as their biological father.

verses.textEn: as well as Hashubah, and Ohel, and Berechiah, and Hasadiah, Jushab-hesed, five.
verses.textLa: Hasaban quoque, et Ohol, et Barachian, et Hasadian, Iosabhesed, quinque.

verses.textEn: Now the son of Hananiah was Pelatiah, the father of Jeshaiah, whose son was Rephaiah. And his son was Arnan, from whom was born Obadiah, whose son was Shecaniah.
verses.textLa: Filius autem Hananiæ, Phaltias pater Ieseiæ, cuius filius Raphaia. Huius quoque filius, Arnan, de quo natus est Obdia, cuius filius fuit Sechenias.

verses.textEn: The son of Shecaniah was Shemaiah, whose sons were these: Hattush, and Igal, and Bariah, and Neariah, and Shaphat, six in number.
verses.textLa: Filius Secheniæ, Semeia: cuius filii Hattus, et Iegaal, et Baria, et Naaria, et Saphat, sex numero.

verses.textEn: The sons of Neariah: Elioenai, and Hizkiaj, and Azrikam, three.
verses.textLa: Filius Naariæ, Elioenai, et Ezechias, et Ezricam, tres.

verses.textEn: The sons of Elioenai: Hodaviah, and Eliashib, and Pelaiah, and Akkub, and Johanan, and Delaiah, and Anani, seven.
verses.textLa: Filii Elioenai, Oduia, et Eliasub, et Pheleia, et Accub, et Iohanan, et Dalaia, et Anani, septem.

verses.textEn: The sons of Judah: Perez, Hezron, and Carmi, and Hur, and Shobal.
verses.textLa: Filii Iuda: Phares, Hesron, et Charmi, et Hur, et Sobal.

verses.textEn: Truly, Reaiah, the son of Shobal, conceived Jahath; from him were born Ahumai and Lahad. These are the kindred of the Zorathites.
verses.textLa: Raia vero filius Sobal genuit Iahath, de quo nati sunt Ahumai, et Laad. Hæ cognationes Sarathi.

verses.textEn: And this is the stock of Etam: Jezreel, and Ishma, and Idbash. And the name of their sister was Hazzelelponi.
verses.textLa: Ista quoque stirps Etam: Iezrahel, et Iesema, et Iedebos. Nomen quoque sororis eorum, Asalelphuni.

verses.textEn: Now Penuel was the father of Gedor, and Ezer was the father of Hushah. These are the sons of Hur, the firstborn of Ephratha, the father of Bethlehem.
verses.textLa: Phanuel autem pater Gedor, et Ezer pater Hosa. Isti sunt filii Hur primogeniti Ephratha patris Bethlehem.

verses.textEn: Truly, for Ashhur, the father of Tekoa, there were two wives: Helah and Naarah.
verses.textLa: Assur vero patri Thecuæ erant duæ uxores, Halaa, et Naara.

verses.textEn: And Naarah bore to him: Ahuzzam, and Hepher, and Temeni, and Haahashtari. These are the sons of Naarah.
verses.textLa: Peperit autem ei Naara, Oozam, et Hepher, et Themani, et Ahasthari. Isti sunt filii Naara.

verses.textEn: And the sons of Helah were Zereth, Izhar, and Ethnan.
verses.textLa: Porro filii Halaa, Sereth, Isaar, et Ethnan.

verses.textEn: Now Koz conceived Anub, and Zobebah, and the kindred of Aharhel, the son of Harum.
verses.textLa: Cos autem genuit Anob, et Soboba, et cognationem Aharehel filii Arum.

verses.textEn: But Jabez was renowned, more so than his brothers, and his mother called his name Jabez, saying, “For I bore him in sorrow.”
verses.textLa: Fuit autem Iabes inclytus præ fratribus suis, et mater eius vocavit nomen illius Iabes, dicens: Quia peperi eum in dolore.

verses.textEn: Truly, Jabez called upon the God of Israel, saying, “If only, when blessing, you will bless me, and will broaden my borders, and your hand will be with me, and you will cause me not to be oppressed by evil.” And God granted to him the things for which he prayed.
verses.textLa: Invocavit vero Iabes Deum Israel, dicens: Si benedicens benedixeris mihi, et dilataveris terminos meos, et fuerit manus tua mecum, et feceris me a malitia non opprimi. Et præstitit Deus quæ precatus est.

verses.textEn: Now Chelub, the brother of Shuhah, conceived Mehir, who was the father of Eshton.
verses.textLa: Caleb autem frater Sua genuit Mahir, qui fuit pater Esthon.

verses.textEn: Then Eshton conceived Bethrapha, and Paseah, and Tehinnah, the father of the city of Nahash. These are the men of Recah.
verses.textLa: Porro Esthon genuit Bethrapha, et Phesse, et Tehinna patrem urbis Naas: hi sunt viri Recha.

verses.textEn: Now the sons of Kenaz were Othniel and Seraiah. And the sons of Othniel were Hathath and Meonothai.
verses.textLa: Filii autem Cenez, Othoniel, et Saraia. Porro filii Othoniel, Hathath, et Maonathi.

verses.textEn: Meonothai conceived Ophrah, but Seraiah conceived Joab, the father of the Valley of Artisans. For indeed, there were artisans there.
verses.textLa: Maonathi genuit Ophra, Saraia autem genuit Ioab patrem Vallis artificum: ibi quippe artifices erant.

verses.textEn: Truly, the sons of Chelub, the son of Jephunneh, were Iru, and Elah, and Naam. And the sons of Elah: Kenaz.
verses.textLa: Filii vero Caleb filii Iephone, Hir, et Ela, et Naham. Filii quoque Ela: Cenez.
verses.notes: The word sons is plural, even though Elah had only one son, because all of that one son’s own sons would also be attributed to Elah as his ‘sons’.

verses.textEn: Also, the sons of Jehallelel: Ziph and Ziphah, Tiria and Asarel.
verses.textLa: Filii quoque Ialeleel: Ziph, et Zipha, Thiria, et Asrael.

verses.textEn: And the sons of Ezrah: Jether, and Mered, and Epher, and Jalon; and he conceived Miriam, and Shammai, and Ishbah, the father of Eshtemoa.
verses.textLa: Et filii Ezra, Iether, et Mered, et Epher, et Ialon, genuitque Mariam, et Sammai, et Iesba patrem Esthamo.

verses.textEn: And then his wife, Judaia, bore Jered, the father of Gedor, and Heber, the father of Soco, and Jekuthiel, the father of Zanoah. Now there were sons of Bithiah, the daughter of Pharaoh, whom Mered married,
verses.textLa: Uxor quoque eius Iudaia, peperit Iared patrem Gedor, et Heber patrem Socho, et Icuthiel patrem Zanoe. Hi autem filii Bethiæ filiæ Pharaonis, quam accepit Mered,
verses.notes: It is not clear from the Latin or Hebrew text what the relationship is among the persons mentioned in these verses.

verses.textEn: and sons of his wife Hodiah, the sister of Naham, the father of Keilah the Garmite, and of Eshtemoa, who was from Maacathi.
verses.textLa: et filii uxoris Odaiæ sororis Naham patris Ceila Garmi, et Esthamo, qui fuit de Machathi.

verses.textEn: And the sons of Shimon: Amnon, and Rinnah, son of Hanan, and Tilon. And the sons of Ishi: Zoheth and Benzoheth.
verses.textLa: Filii quoque Simon, Amnon, et Rinna filius Hanan, et Thilon. Et filii Iesi, Zoheth, et Benzoheth.
verses.notes: Benzoheth may have been the son of Zoheth and the grandson of Ishi. The word ‘son’ was used broadly by the Jews to include descendents beyond immediate sons.

verses.textEn: The sons of Shelah, the son of Judah: Er, the father of Lecah, and Laadah, the father of Mareshah, and the kindred of the house of the workers of fine linen in the house of the oath,
verses.textLa: Filii Sela, filii Iuda: Her pater Lecha, et Laada pater Maresa, et cognationes domus operantium byssum in domo iuramenti,

verses.textEn: and he who caused the sun to stand still, and the men of Lying, and Secure, and Burning, who were leaders in Moab, and who returned into Lehem. Now these words are ancient.
verses.textLa: et qui stare fecit Solem, virique Mendacii, et Securus, et Incendens, qui principes fuerunt in Moab, et qui reversi sunt in Lahem. Hæc autem verba vetera.

verses.textEn: These are the potters living in the Plantations and in the Hedges, with a king in his works, and they were dwelling there.
verses.textLa: Hi sunt figuli habitantes in Plantationibus, et in Sepibus, apud regem in operibus eius, commoratique sunt ibi.

verses.textEn: The sons of Simeon: Nemuel and Jamin, Jarib, Zerah, Shaul;
verses.textLa: Filii Simeon: Namuel et Iamin, Iarib, Zara, Saul.

verses.textEn: Shallum his son, Mibsam his son, Mishma his son.
verses.textLa: Sellum filius eius, Mapsam filius eius, Masma filius eius.

verses.textEn: The sons of Mishma: Hammuel his son, Zaccur his son, Shimei his son.
verses.textLa: Filii Masma: Hamuel filius eius, Zachur filius eius, Semei filius eius.

verses.textEn: The sons of Shimei were sixteen, and there were six daughters. But his brothers did not have many sons, and the entire kindred was not equal to the sum of the sons of Judah.
verses.textLa: Filii Semei sedecim, et filiæ sex: fratres autem eius non habuerunt filios multos, et universa cognatio non potuit adæquare summam filiorum Iuda.

verses.textEn: Now they lived in Beersheba, and Moladah, and Hazarshual,
verses.textLa: Habitaverunt autem in Bersabee, et Molada, et Hasarsuhal,

verses.textEn: and in Bilhah, and in Ezem, and in Tolad,
verses.textLa: et in Bala, et in Asom, et in Tholad,

verses.textEn: and in Bethuel, and in Hormah, and in Ziklag,
verses.textLa: et in Bathuel, et in Horma, et in Siceleg,

verses.textEn: and in Beth-marcaboth, and in Hazarsusim, and in Bethbiri, and in Shaaraim. These were their cities until king David.
verses.textLa: et in Bethmarchaboth, et in Hasarsusim, et in Bethberai, et in Saarim. Hæ civitates eorum usque ad regem David.

verses.textEn: And their towns were Etam, and Ain, Rimmon, and Tochen, and Ashan, five cities,
verses.textLa: Villæ quoque eorum: Etam, et Aen, Remmon, et Thochen, et Asan, civitates quinque.

verses.textEn: with all their villages, on every side of these cities, as far as Baal. This is their habitation and the distribution of the settlements.
verses.textLa: Et universi viculi eorum per circuitum civitatum istarum usque ad Baal. Hæc est habitatio eorum, et sedium distributio.

verses.textEn: And there were Meshobab and Jamlech, and Joshah, the son of Amaziah,
verses.textLa: Mosobab quoque et Iemlech, et Iosa filius Amasiæ,

verses.textEn: and Joel, and Jehu, the son of Joshibiah, the son of Seraiah, the son of Asiel,
verses.textLa: et Ioel, et Iehu filius Iosabiæ filii Saraiæ filii Asiel,

verses.textEn: and Elioenai, and Jaakobah, and Jeshohaiah, and Asaiah, and Adiel, and Jesimiel, and Benaiah,
verses.textLa: et Elioenai, et Iacoba, et Isuhaia, et Asaia, et Adiel, et Ismiel, et Banaia,

verses.textEn: as well as Ziza, the son of Shiphi, the son of Allon, the son of Jedaiah, the son of Shimri, the son of Shemaiah.
verses.textLa: Ziza quoque filius Sephei filii Allon filii Idaia filii Semri filii Samaia.

verses.textEn: These were the names of the leaders in their kindred. And they were multiplied greatly within the houses of their marriages.
verses.textLa: Isti sunt nominati principes in cognationibus suis, et in domo affinitatum suarum multiplicati sunt vehementer.

verses.textEn: And they set out, so that they might enter into Gedor, as far as the eastern valley, and so that they might seek pastures for their flocks.
verses.textLa: Et profecti sunt ut ingrederentur in Gador usque ad Orientem vallis, et ut quærerent pascua gregibus suis.

verses.textEn: And they found fat and very good pastures, and a very wide and quiet and fruitful land, in which some from the stock of Ham had lived before.
verses.textLa: Inveneruntque pascuas uberes, et valde bonas, et terram latissimam et quietam et fertilem, in qua ante habitaverant de stirpe Cham.

verses.textEn: So then, those whose names have been written above, went forth in the days of Hezekiah, the king of Judah. And they struck down the inhabitants who had been found there with their dwellings. And they wiped them out, even to the present day. And they lived in place of them, because they found very fat pastures there.
verses.textLa: Hi ergo venerunt, quos supra descripsimus nominatim, in diebus Ezechiæ regis Iuda: et percusserunt tabernacula eorum, et habitatores qui inventi fuerant ibi, et deleverunt eos usque in præsentem diem: habitaveruntque pro eis, quoniam uberrimas pascuas ibidem repererunt.

verses.textEn: Also, some of the sons of Simeon, five hundred men, went away to mount Seir, having as leaders Pelatiah and Neariah and Rephaiah and Uzziel, the sons of Ishi.
verses.textLa: De filiis quoque Simeon abierunt in montem Seir viri quingenti, habentes principes Phalthiam et Naariam et Raphaiam et Oziel filios Iesi:

verses.textEn: And they struck down the remnant of the Amalekites, those who had been able to escape, and they lived there in place of them, even to this day.
verses.textLa: et percusserunt reliquias, quæ evadere potuerant, Amalecitarum, et habitaverunt ibi pro eis usque ad diem hanc.

verses.textEn: Also, there were the sons of Reuben, the firstborn of Israel. For indeed, he was his firstborn, but when he had violated the bed of his father, his right as firstborn was given to the sons of Joseph, the son of Israel, and he was not reputed as firstborn.
verses.textLa: Filii quoque Ruben primogeniti Israel (Ipse quippe fuit primogenitus eius: sed cum violasset thorum patris sui, data sunt primogenita eius filiis Ioseph filii Israel, et non est ille reputatus in primogenitum.

verses.textEn: Moreover, Judah, who was strongest among his brothers, from his stock leaders sprung up, but the right of firstborn was reputed to Joseph.
verses.textLa: Porro Iudas, qui erat fortissimus inter fratres suos, de stirpe eius principes germinati sunt: primogenita autem reputata sunt Ioseph.)

verses.textEn: So then, the sons of Reuben, the firstborn of Israel, were Hanoch and Pallu, Hezron and Carmi.
verses.textLa: filii ergo Ruben primogeniti Israel: Enoch, et Phallu, Esron, et Carmi.

verses.textEn: The sons of Joel: Shemaiah his son, Gog his son, Shimei his son,
verses.textLa: Filii Ioel: Samia filius eius, Gog filius eius, Semei filius eius,

verses.textEn: Micah his son, Reaiah his son, Baal his son,
verses.textLa: Micha filius eius, Reia filius eius, Baal filius eius,

verses.textEn: Beerah his son, whom Tilgath-pilneser, the king of the Assyrians, led away captive, and he was a leader in the tribe of Reuben.
verses.textLa: Beera filius eius, quem captivum duxit Thelgathphalnasar rex Assyriorum, et fuit princeps in tribu Ruben.

verses.textEn: Now his brothers and all his kindred, when they were being numbered according to their families, had as leaders Jeiel and Zechariah.
verses.textLa: Fratres autem eius, et universa cognatio eius, quando numerabantur per familias suas, habuerunt principes Iehiel, et Zachariam.

verses.textEn: Now Bela, the son of Azaz, the son of Shema, the son of Joel, lived in Aroer, as far as Nebo and Baalmeon.
verses.textLa: Porro Bala filius Azaz, filii Samma, filii Ioel, ipse habitavit in Aroer usque ad Nebo, et Beelmeon.

verses.textEn: And he lived toward the eastern region, as far as the entrance to the wilderness and the river Euphrates. For indeed, they possessed a great number of cattle in the land of Gilead.
verses.textLa: Contra Orientalem quoque plagam habitavit usque ad introitum eremi, et flumen Euphraten. Multum quippe iumentorum numerum possidebant in Terra Galaad.

verses.textEn: Then, in the days of Saul, they battled against the Hagarites and put them to death. And they lived in place of them, in their dwellings, throughout the entire region that looks to the east of Gilead.
verses.textLa: In diebus autem Saul præliati sunt contra Agareos, et interfecerunt illos, habitaveruntque pro eis in tabernaculis eorum, in omni plaga, quæ respicit ad Orientem Galaad.

verses.textEn: Truly, the sons of Gad lived in the opposite region from them, in the land of Bashan, as far as Salecah:
verses.textLa: Filii vero Gad e regione eorum habitaverunt in Terra Basan usque Selcha:

verses.textEn: Joel the head, and Shapham the second, then Janai and Shaphat, in Bashan.
verses.textLa: Ioel in capite, et Saphan secundus: Ianai autem, et Saphat in Basan.

verses.textEn: Truly, their brothers, according to the houses of their kindred, were: Michael, and Meshullam, and Sheba, and Jorai, and Jacan, and Zia, and Eber, seven.
verses.textLa: Fratres vero eorum secundum domos cognationum suarum, Michael, et Mosollam, et Sebe, et Iorai, et Iachan, et Zie, et Heber, septem.

verses.textEn: These were the sons of Abihail, the son of Huri, the son of Jaroah, the son of Gilead, the son of Michael, the son of Jeshishai, the son of Jahdo, the son of Buz,
verses.textLa: Hi filii Abihail, filii Huri, filii Iara, filii Galaad, filii Michael, filii Iesesi, filii Ieddo, filii Buz.

verses.textEn: along with their brothers, the sons of Abdiel, the son of Guni, the leader of the house, in their families,
verses.textLa: Fratres quoque filii Abdiel, filii Guni, princeps domus in familiis suis.

verses.textEn: And they lived in Gilead, and in Bashan and its towns, and in all the suburbs of Sharon, as far as the borders.
verses.textLa: Et habitaverunt in Galaad, et in Basan, et in viculis eius, et in cunctis suburbanis Saron, usque ad terminos.

verses.textEn: All these were numbered in the days of Jotham, the king of Judah, and in the days of Jeroboam, the king of Israel:
verses.textLa: Omnes hi, numerati sunt in diebus Ioathan regis Iuda, et in diebus Ieroboam regis Israel.

verses.textEn: the sons of Reuben, and of Gad, and the one half tribe of Manasseh, men of war, carrying shields and swords, and bending the bow, and trained for battle, forty-four thousand and seven hundred sixty, advancing to the fight.
verses.textLa: Filii Ruben, et Gad, et dimidiæ tribus Manasse viri bellatores, scuta portantes, et gladios, et tendentes arcum, eruditique ad prælia quadraginta quattuor millia, et septingenti sexaginta procedentes ad pugnam.

verses.textEn: They struggled against the Hagarites, yet truly the Jetureans, and Naphish, and Nodab offered assistance to them.
verses.textLa: Dimicaverunt contra Agareos: Ituræi vero, et Naphis, et Nodab præbuerunt eis auxilium.

verses.textEn: And the Hagarites were delivered into their hands, and all who were with them. For they called upon God while they did battle. And he heeded them, because they had trusted in him.
verses.textLa: Traditique sunt in manus eorum Agarei, et universi, qui fuerant cum eis, quia Deum invocaverunt cum præliarentur: et exaudivit eos, eo quod credidissent in eum.

verses.textEn: And they seized all that they possessed, of camels fifty thousand, and of sheep two hundred fifty thousand, and of donkeys two thousand, and of men one hundred thousand lives.
verses.textLa: Ceperuntque omnia quæ possederant, camelorum quinquaginta millia, et ovium ducenta quinquaginta millia, et asinos duo millia, et animas hominum centum millia.

verses.textEn: And many fell down wounded. For it was a war of the Lord. And they lived in place of them, until the transmigration.
verses.textLa: Vulnerati autem multi corruerunt: fuit enim bellum Domini. Habitaveruntque pro eis usque ad transmigrationem.

verses.textEn: Also, the sons of the one half tribe of Manasseh possessed the land, from the parts of Bashan as far as Baal, Hermon, and Sanir, and Mount Hermon. For certainly, their number was immense.
verses.textLa: Filii quoque dimidiæ tribus Manasse possederunt terram a finibus Basan usque Baal, Hermon, et Sanir, et montem Hermon, ingens quippe numerus erat.

verses.textEn: And these were leaders of the house of their kindred: Epher, and Ishi, and Eliel, and Azriel, and Jeremiah, and Hodaviah, and Jahdiel, very valiant and powerful men, and renowned leaders in their families.
verses.textLa: Et hi fuerunt principes domus cognationis eorum, Epher, et Iesi, et Eliel, et Ezriel, et Ieremia, et Odoia, et Iediel viri fortissimi et potentes, et nominati duces in familiis suis.

verses.textEn: But they abandoned the God of their fathers, and they fornicated after the gods of the peoples of the land, whom God took away before them.
verses.textLa: Reliquerunt autem Deum patrum suorum, et fornicati sunt post deos populorum terræ, quos abstulit Deus coram eis.

verses.textEn: And so the God of Israel stirred up the spirit of Pul, the king of the Assyrians, and the spirit of Tilgath-pilneser, the king of Assur. And he took away Reuben, and Gad, and the one half tribe of Manasseh. And he led them to Halah, and to Habor, and to Hara, and to the river of Gozan, even to this day.
verses.textLa: Et suscitavit Deus Israel spiritum Phul regis Assyriorum, et spiritum Thelgathphalnasar regis Assur: et transtulit Ruben, et Gad, et dimidiam tribum Manasse, et adduxit eos in Lahela, et in Habor, et Ara, et fluvium Gozan, usque ad diem hanc.

verses.textEn: The sons of Levi: Gershom, Kohath, and Merari.
verses.textLa: Filii Levi: Gerson, Caath, et Merari.

verses.textEn: The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.
verses.textLa: Filii Caath: Amram, Isaar, Hebron, et Oziel.

verses.textEn: The sons of Amram: Aaron, Moses, and Miriam. The sons of Aaron: Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.
verses.textLa: Filii Amram: Aaron, Moyses, et Maria: Filii Aaron: Nadab et Abiu, Eleazar et Ithamar.

verses.textEn: Eleazar conceived Phinehas, and Phinehas conceived Abishua.
verses.textLa: Eleazar genuit Phinees, et Phinees genuit Abisue.

verses.textEn: Truly, Abishua conceived Bukki, and Bukki conceived Uzzi.
verses.textLa: Abisue vero genuit Bocci, et Bocci genuit Ozi.

verses.textEn: Uzzi conceived Zerahiah, and Zerahiah conceived Meraioth.
verses.textLa: Ozi genuit Zaraiam, et Zaraias genuit Meraioth.

verses.textEn: Then Meraioth conceived Amariah, and Amariah conceived Ahitub.
verses.textLa: Porro Meraioth genuit Amariam, et Amarias genuit Achitob.

verses.textEn: Ahitub conceived Zadok, and Zadok conceived Ahimaaz.
verses.textLa: Achitob genuit Sadoc, et Sadoc genuit Achimaas,

verses.textEn: Ahimaaz conceived Azariah; Azariah conceived Johanan.
verses.textLa: Achimaas genuit Azariam, Azarias genuit Iohanan.

verses.textEn: Johanan conceived Azariah. He is the one who executed the priestly office in the house that Solomon built in Jerusalem.
verses.textLa: Iohanan genuit Azariam. Ipse est qui sacerdotio functus est in domo, quam ædificavit Salomon in Ierusalem.

verses.textEn: Now Azariah conceived Amariah, and Amariah conceived Ahitub.
verses.textLa: Genuit autem Azarias Amariam, et Amarias genuit Achitob.

verses.textEn: Ahitub conceived Zadok, and Zadok conceived Shallum.
verses.textLa: Achitob genuit Sadoc, et Sadoc genuit Sellum.

verses.textEn: Shallum conceived Hilkiah, and Hilkiah conceived Azariah.
verses.textLa: Sellum genuit Helciam, et Helcias genuit Azariam.

verses.textEn: Azariah conceived Seraiah, and Seraiah conceived Jehozadak.
verses.textLa: Azarias genuit Saraiam, et Saraias genuit Iosedec.

verses.textEn: Now Jehozadak departed, when the Lord took away Judah and Jerusalem, by the hands of Nebuchadnezzar.
verses.textLa: Porro Iosedec egressus est, quando transtulit Dominus Iudam, et Ierusalem per manus Nabuchodonosor.

verses.textEn: So the sons of Levi were Gershom, Kohath, and Merari.
verses.textLa: Filii ergo Levi: Gersom, Caath, et Merari.

verses.textEn: And these are the names of the sons of Gershom: Libni and Shimei.
verses.textLa: Et hæc nomina filiorum Gersom: Lobni, et Semei.

verses.textEn: The sons of Kohath: Amram, and Izhar, and Hebron, and Uzziel.
verses.textLa: Filii Caath: Amram, et Isaar, et Hebron, et Oziel.

verses.textEn: The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. And so these are the kindred of Levi, according to their families.
verses.textLa: Filii Merari: Moholi et Musi. Hæ autem cognationes Levi secundum familias eorum.

verses.textEn: Of Gershom: Libni his son, Jahath his son, Zimmah his son,
verses.textLa: Gersom: Lobni filius eius, Iahath filius eius, Zamma filius eius,

verses.textEn: Joah his son, Iddo his son, Zerah his son, Jeatherai his son.
verses.textLa: Ioah filius eius, Addo filius eius, Zara filius eius, Iethrai filius eius.

verses.textEn: The sons of Kohath: Amminadab his son, Korah his son, Assir his son,
verses.textLa: Filii Caath: Aminadab filius eius, Core filius eius, Asir filius eius,

verses.textEn: Elkanah his son, Ebiasaph his son, Assir his son,
verses.textLa: Elcana filius eius, Abiasaph filius eius, Asir filius eius,

verses.textEn: Tahath his son, Uriel his son, Uzziah his son, Shaul his son.
verses.textLa: Thahath filius eius, Uriel filius eius, Ozias filius eius, Saul filius eius.

verses.textEn: The sons of Elkanah: Amasai and Ahimoth
verses.textLa: Filii Elcana: Amasai et Achimoth

verses.textEn: and Elkanah. The sons of Elkanah: Zophai his son, Nahath his son,
verses.textLa: et Elcana. Filii Elcana: Sophai filius eius, Nahath filius eius,

verses.textEn: Eliab his son, Jeroham his son, Elkanah his son.
verses.textLa: Eliab filius eius, Ieroham filius eius, Elcana filius eius.

verses.textEn: The sons of Samuel: Vasseni the firstborn, and Abijah.
verses.textLa: Filii Samuel: primogenitus Vasseni, et Abia.

verses.textEn: Now the sons of Merari were: Mahli, Libni his son, Shimei his son, Uzzah his son,
verses.textLa: Filii autem Merari, Moholi: Lobni filius eius, Semei filius eius, Oza filius eius,

verses.textEn: Shimea his son, Haggiah his son, Asaiah his son.
verses.textLa: Sammaa filius eius, Haggia filius eius, Asaia filius eius.

verses.textEn: These are the ones whom David appointed over the singing men in the house of the Lord, in the place where the ark was located.
verses.textLa: Isti sunt, quos constituit David super cantores domus Domini, ex quo collocata est arca:

verses.textEn: And they ministered before the tabernacle of the testimony with singing, until Solomon built the house of the Lord in Jerusalem. And they would stand according to their order in the ministry.
verses.textLa: et ministrabant coram tabernaculo testimonii, canentes donec ædificaret Salomon domum Domini in Ierusalem: stabant autem iuxta ordinem suum in ministerio.

verses.textEn: Truly, these are the ones who were assisting, with their sons, from the sons of Kohath: the singer Heman, the son of Joel, the son of Samuel,
verses.textLa: Hi vero sunt, qui assistebant cum filiis suis, de filiis Caath, Hemam cantor filius Ioel, filii Samuel,

verses.textEn: the son of Elkanah, the son of Jeroham, the son of Eliel, the son of Toah,
verses.textLa: filii Elcana, filii Ieroham, filii Eliel, filii Thohu,

verses.textEn: the son of Zuph, the son of Elkanah, the son of Mahath, the son of Amasai,
verses.textLa: filii Suph, filii Elcana, filii Mahath, filii Amasai,

verses.textEn: the son of Elkanah, the son of Joel, the son of Azariah, the son of Zephaniah,
verses.textLa: filii Elcana, filii Iohel, filii Azariæ, filii Sophoniæ,

verses.textEn: the son of Tahath, the son of Assir, the son of Ebiasaph, the son of Korah,
verses.textLa: filii Thahath, filii Asir, filii Abiasaph, filii Core,

verses.textEn: the son of Izhar, the son of Kohath, the son of Levi, the son of Israel.
verses.textLa: filii Isaar, filii Caath, filii Levi, filii Israel.

verses.textEn: And there was also his brother, Asaph, who was standing at his right, Asaph, the son of Berechiah, the son of Shimea,
verses.textLa: Et frater eius Asaph, qui stabat a dextris eius, Asaph filius Barachiæ, filii Samaa,

verses.textEn: the son of Michael, the son of Baaseiah, the son of Malchijah,
verses.textLa: filii Michael, filii Basaiæ, filii Melchiæ,

verses.textEn: the son of Ethni, the son of Zerah, the son of Adaiah,
verses.textLa: filii Athanai, filii Zara, filii Adaia,

verses.textEn: the son of Ethan, the son of Zimmah, the son of Shimei,
verses.textLa: filii Ethan, filii Zamma, filii Semei,

verses.textEn: the son of Jahath, the son of Gershom, the son of Levi.
verses.textLa: filii Ieth, filii Gersom, filii Levi.

verses.textEn: Now the sons of Merari, their brothers, were on the left: Ethan, the son of Kishi, the son of Abdi, the son of Malluch,
verses.textLa: Filii autem Merari fratres eorum, ad sinistram, Ethan filius Cusi, filii Abdi, filii Maloch,

verses.textEn: the son of Hashabiah, the son of Amaziah, the son of Hilkiah,
verses.textLa: filii Hasabiæ, filii Amasiæ, filii Helciæ,

verses.textEn: the son of Amzi, the son of Boni, the son of Shemer,
verses.textLa: filii Amasai, filii Boni, filii Somer,

verses.textEn: the son of Mahli, the son of Mushi, the son of Merari, the son of Levi.
verses.textLa: filii Moholi, filii Musi, filii Merari, filii Levi.

verses.textEn: There were also their brothers, Levites who were appointed for every ministry of the tabernacle of the house of the Lord.
verses.textLa: Fratres quoque eorum Levitæ, qui ordinati sunt in cunctum ministerium tabernaculi domus Domini.

verses.textEn: Truly, Aaron and his sons were burning offerings upon the altar of holocausts and upon the altar of incense, for the entire work of the Holy of Holies, and to pray on behalf of Israel, in accord with all the things that Moses, the servant of God, had instructed.
verses.textLa: Aaron vero, et filii eius adolebant incensum super altare holocausti, et super altare thymiamatis, in omne opus Sancti Sanctorum: et ut precarentur pro Israel iuxta omnia, quæ præceperat Moyses servus Dei.

verses.textEn: Now these are the sons of Aaron: Eleazar his son, Phinehas his son, Abishua his son,
verses.textLa: Hi sunt autem filii Aaron: Eleazar filius eius, Phinees filius eius, Abisue filius eius,

verses.textEn: Bukki his son, Uzzi his son, Zerahiah his son,
verses.textLa: Bocci filius eius, Ozi filius eius, Zarahia filius eius,

verses.textEn: Meraioth his son, Amariah his son, Ahitub his son,
verses.textLa: Meraioth filius eius, Amarias filius eius, Achitob filius eius,

verses.textEn: Zadok his son, Ahimaaz his son.
verses.textLa: Sadoc filius eius, Achimaas filius eius.

verses.textEn: And these are their habitations according to the villages and confines, specifically of the sons of Aaron, according to the kindred of the Kohathites. For it fell to them by lot.
verses.textLa: Et hæc habitacula eorum per vicos atque confinia, filiorum scilicet Aaron, iuxta cognationes Caathitarum: ipsis enim sorte contigerant.

verses.textEn: And so, they gave Hebron, in the land of Judah, and its suburbs all around, to them,
verses.textLa: Dederunt igitur eis Hebron in terra Iuda, et suburbana eius per circuitum:

verses.textEn: but they gave the fields of the city, and the villages, to Caleb, the son of Jephunneh.
verses.textLa: agros autem civitatis, et villas, Caleb filio Iephone.

verses.textEn: Then, to the sons of Aaron, they gave the cities of refuge: Hebron, and Libnah with its suburbs,
verses.textLa: Porro filiis Aaron dederunt civitates ad confugiendum Hebron, et Lobna, et suburbana eius,

verses.textEn: also Jattir and Eshtemoa with their suburbs, then also Hilen and Debir with their suburbs,
verses.textLa: Iether quoque, et Esthemo cum suburbanis suis, sed et Helon, et Dabir cum suburbanis suis,

verses.textEn: as well as Ashan and Beth-shemesh with their suburbs.
verses.textLa: Asan quoque, et Bethsemes, et suburbana earum.

verses.textEn: And from the tribe of Benjamin: Geba with its suburbs, and Alemeth with its suburbs, as well as Anathoth with its suburbs. All the cities throughout their kindred were thirteen.
verses.textLa: De tribu autem Beniamin: Gabee et suburbana eius, et Almath cum suburbanis suis, Anathoth quoque cum suburbanis suis. Omnes civitates, tredecim, per cognationes suas.

verses.textEn: Now to the sons of Kohath, those remaining from their kindred, they gave ten cities, from the one half tribe of Manasseh, as a possession;
verses.textLa: Filiis autem Caath residuis de cognatione sua dederunt ex dimidia tribu Manasse in possessionem urbes decem.

verses.textEn: and to the sons of Gershom, according to their families, from the tribe of Issachar, and from the tribe of Asher, and from the tribe of Naphtali, and from the tribe Manasseh in Bashan: thirteen cities.
verses.textLa: Porro filiis Gersom per cognationes suas de tribu Issachar, et de tribu Aser, et de tribu Nephthali, et de tribu Manasse in Basan, urbes tredecim.

verses.textEn: Then to the sons of Merari, according to their families, from the tribe of Reuben, and from the tribe of Gad, and from the tribe of Zebulun, they gave by lot twelve cities.
verses.textLa: Filiis autem Merari per cognationes suas de tribu Ruben, et de tribu Gad, et de tribu Zabulon, dederunt sorte civitates duodecim.

verses.textEn: Also, the sons of Israel gave, to the Levites, cities and their suburbs,
verses.textLa: Dederunt quoque filii Israel Levitis civitates, et suburbana earum:

verses.textEn: and they gave them by lot, out of the tribe of the sons of Judah, and out of the tribe of the sons of Simeon, and out of the tribe of the sons of Benjamin, these cities, which they called by their names.
verses.textLa: dederuntque per sortem, ex tribu filiorum Iuda, et ex tribu filiorum Simeon, et ex tribu filiorum Beniamin urbes has, quas vocaverunt nominibus suis,

verses.textEn: And for those who were from the kindred of the sons of Kohath, the cities with their borders were from the tribe of Ephraim.
verses.textLa: et his, qui erant de cognatione filiorum Caath, fueruntque civitates in terminis eorum de tribu Ephraim.

verses.textEn: Then they gave to them the cities of refuge: Shechem with its suburbs on mount Ephraim, and Gezer with its suburbs,
verses.textLa: Dederunt ergo eis urbes ad confugiendum, Sichem cum suburbanis suis in monte Ephraim, et Gazer cum suburbanis suis,

verses.textEn: as well as Jokmeam with its suburbs, and Beth-horon similarly,
verses.textLa: Iecmaam quoque cum suburbanis suis, et Bethoron similiter,

verses.textEn: and indeed Hilen with its suburbs, and Gath Rimmon in the same manner.
verses.textLa: necnon et Helon cum suburbanis suis, et Gethremmon in eundem modum.

verses.textEn: Then too, out of the one half tribe of Manasseh: Aner and its suburbs, Bileam and its suburbs; these in particular went to those who were remaining from the kindred of the sons of Kohath.
verses.textLa: Porro ex dimidia tribu Manasse, Aner et suburbana eius, Balaam et suburbana eius: his videlicet, qui de cognatione filiorum Caath reliqui erant.

verses.textEn: And to the sons of Gershom, from the kindred of the one half tribe of Manasseh: Golan, in Bashan, and its suburbs, and Ashtaroth with its suburbs;
verses.textLa: Filiis autem Gersom de cognatione dimidiæ tribus Manasse Gaulon in Basan, et suburbana eius, et Astaroth cum suburbanis suis;

verses.textEn: from the tribe of Issachar: Kedesh and its suburbs, and Daberath with its suburbs,
verses.textLa: de tribu Issachar, Cedes et suburbanis suis, et Dabereth cum suburbanis suis;

verses.textEn: as well as Ramoth and its suburbs, and Anem with its suburbs;
verses.textLa: Ramoth quoque et suburbana eius, et Anem cum suburbanis suis;

verses.textEn: truly, from the tribe of Asher: Mashal with its suburbs, and Abdon similarly;
verses.textLa: de tribu vero Aser: Masal cum suburbanis suis, et Abdon similiter;

verses.textEn: as well as Hukkok and its suburbs, and Rehob with its suburbs;
verses.textLa: Husac quoque et suburbana eius, et Rohob cum suburbanis suis;

verses.textEn: moreover, from the tribe of Naphtali: Kedesh in Galilee and its suburbs, Hammon with its suburbs, and Kiriathaim and its suburbs.
verses.textLa: porro de tribu Nephthali, Cedes in Galilæa et suburbana eius, Hamon cum suburbanis suis, et Cariathaim et suburbana eius.

verses.textEn: Then to the remaining sons of Merari, from the tribe of Zebulun: Rimmono and its suburbs, and Tabor with its suburbs;
verses.textLa: Filiis autem Merari residuis: de tribu Zabulon, Remmono et suburbana eius, et Thabor cum suburbanis sus:

verses.textEn: and also, across the Jordan opposite Jericho, facing the east of the Jordan, from the tribe of Reuben: Bezer in the wilderness with its suburbs, and Jahzah with its suburbs;
verses.textLa: trans Iordanem quoque ex adverso Iericho contra Orientem Iordanis, de tribu Ruben, Bosor in solitudine cum suburbanis suis, et Iassa cum suburbanis suis;

verses.textEn: as well as Kedemoth and its suburbs, and Mephaath with its suburbs;
verses.textLa: Cademoth quoque et suburbana eius, et Mephaat cum suburbanis suis;

verses.textEn: indeed also, from the tribe of Gad: Ramoth in Gilead and its suburbs, and Mahanaim with its suburbs;
verses.textLa: necnon et de tribu Gad, Ramoth in Galaad et suburbana eius, et Manaim cum suburbanis suis;

verses.textEn: then too, Heshbon with its suburbs, and Jazer with its suburbs.
verses.textLa: sed et Hesebon cum suburbanis suis, et Iezer cum suburbanis suis.

verses.textEn: Now the sons of Issachar were Tola and Puah, Jashub and Shimron, four.
verses.textLa: Porro filii Issachar: Thola, et Phua, Iasub, et Simeron, quattuor.

verses.textEn: The sons of Tola: Uzzi, and Rephaiah, and Jeriel, and Jahmai, and Ibsam, and Shemuel, leaders according to the houses of their kindred. From the stock of Tola, there were numbered, in the days of David, twenty-two thousand six hundred very strong men.
verses.textLa: Filii Thola: Ozi et Raphaia, et Ieriel, et Iemai, et Iebsem, et Samuel, principes per domos cognationum suarum. De stirpe Thola viri fortissimi numerati sunt in diebus David, viginti duo millia sexcenti.

verses.textEn: The sons of Uzzi: Izrahiah, from whom were born: Michael, and Obadiah, and Joel, and Isshiah; all five were leaders.
verses.textLa: Filii Ozi: Izrahia, de quo nati sunt Michael, et Obadia, et Ioel, et Iesia, quinque omnes principes.

verses.textEn: And with them, by their families and peoples, there were thirty-six thousand very strong men, girded for battle. And they had many wives and children.
verses.textLa: Cumque eis per familias, et populos suos, accincti ad prælium, viri fortissimi, triginta sex millia: multas enim habuerunt uxores, et filios.

verses.textEn: Also, their brothers, throughout all the kindred of Issachar, were numbered as eighty-seven thousand, very fit for battle.
verses.textLa: Fratres quoque eorum per omnem cognationem Issachar robustissimi ad pugnandum, octoginta septem millia numerati sunt.

verses.textEn: The sons of Benjamin: Bela, and Becher, and Jediael, three.
verses.textLa: Filii Beniamin: Bela, et Bechor, et Iadihel, tres.

verses.textEn: The sons of Bela: Ezbon, and Uzzi, and Uzziel, and Jerimoth and Iri, five leaders of families, also very fit for battle; and their number was twenty-two thousand thirty-four.
verses.textLa: Filii Bela: Esbon, et Ozi, et Oziel, et Ierimoth, et Urai, quinque principes familiarum, et ad pugnandum robustissimi: numerus autem eorum, viginti duo millia et triginta quattuor.

verses.textEn: Now the sons of Becher: Zemirah, and Joash, and Eliezer, and Elioenai, and Omri, and Jeremoth, and Abijah, and Anathoth, and Alemeth: all these were sons of Becher.
verses.textLa: Porro filii Bechor: Zamira, et Ioas, et Eliezer, et Elioenai, et Amri, et Ierimoth, et Abia, et Anathoth, et Almath: omnes hi, filii Bechor.

verses.textEn: And they were numbered according to their families, by the leaders of their kindred, very strong in warfare, twenty thousand and two hundred.
verses.textLa: Numerati sunt autem per familias suas principes cognationum suarum ad bella fortissimi, viginti millia et ducenti.

verses.textEn: And the sons of Jediael: Bilhan, and the sons of Bilhan: Jeush, and Benjamin, and Ehud, and Chenaanah, and Zethan, and Tarshish, and Ahishahar.
verses.textLa: Porro filii Iadihel: Balan. Filii autem Balan: Iehus, et Beniamin, et Aod, et Chanana, et Zethan, et Tharsis, et Ahisahar.

verses.textEn: All these were sons of Jediael, the leaders of their kindred, very strong men, seventeen thousand and two hundred, going forth to battle.
verses.textLa: Omnes hi filii Iadihel, principes cognationum suarum, viri fortissimi, decem et septem millia, et ducenti ad prælium procedentes.

verses.textEn: Also, Shuppim and Huppim, the sons of Ir; and Hushim, sons of Aher.
verses.textLa: Sepham quoque, et Hapham filii Hir: et Hasim filii Aher.

verses.textEn: Then the sons of Naphtali: Jahziel, and Guni, and Jezer, and Shallum, sons of Bilhah.
verses.textLa: Filii autem Nephthali: Iaziel, et Guni, et Ieser, et Sellum, filii Bala.

verses.textEn: Also, the son of Manasseh: Asriel. And his concubine, a Syrian, bore Machir, the father of Gilead.
verses.textLa: Porro filius Manasse, Esriel: concubinaque eius Syra peperit Machir patrem Galaad.

verses.textEn: Now Machir took wives for his sons, Huppim and Shuppim. And he had a sister named Maacah; but the name of the second was Zelophehad, and daughters were born to Zelophehad.
verses.textLa: Machir autem accepit uxores filiis suis Happhim, et Saphan: et habuit sororem nomine Maacha: nomen autem secundi, Salphaad, natæque sunt Salphaad filiæ.

verses.textEn: And Maacah, the wife of Machir, bore a son, and she called his name Peresh. And the name of his brother was Sheresh. And his sons were Ulam and Rakem.
verses.textLa: Et peperit Maacha uxor Machir filium, vocavitque nomen eius Phares: porro nomen fratris eius, Sares: et filii eius, Ulam, et Recen.

verses.textEn: Then the son of Ulam: Bedan. These are the sons of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh.
verses.textLa: Filius autem Ulam, Badan. Hi sunt filii Galaad, filii Machir, filii Manasse.

verses.textEn: And his sister, Regina, bore Ishhod, and Abiezer, and Mahlah.
verses.textLa: Soror autem eius Regina peperit virum-decorum, et Abiezer, et Mohola.

verses.textEn: Now the sons of Shemida were Ahian, and Shechem, and Likhi and Aniam.
verses.textLa: Erant autem filii Semida, Ahin, et Sechem, et Leci, et Aniam.

verses.textEn: And the sons of Ephraim: Shuthelah, Bered his son, Tahath his son, Eleadah his son, Tahath his son, whose son was Zabad,
verses.textLa: Filii autem Ephraim: Suthala, Bared filius eius, Thahath filius eius, Elada filius eius, Thahath filius eius, huius filius Zabad,

verses.textEn: and his son was Shuthelah, and his son was Ezer, and also Elead. But the men indigenous to Gath killed them, because they had descended to invade their possessions.
verses.textLa: et huius filius Suthula, et huius filius Ezer et Elad: occiderunt autem eos viri Geth indigenæ, quia descenderant ut invaderent possessiones eorum.

verses.textEn: And so their father, Ephraim, mourned for many days; and his brothers arrived, so that they might console him.
verses.textLa: Luxit igitur Ephraim pater eorum multis diebus, et venerunt fratres eius ut consolarentur eum.

verses.textEn: And he entered to his wife; she conceived and bore a son. And he called his name Beriah, because he rose up during a time of evil for his house.
verses.textLa: Ingressusque est ad uxorem suam: quæ concepit, et peperit filium, et vocavit nomen eius Beria, eo quod in malis domus eius ortus esset:

verses.textEn: Now his daughter was Sheerah, who built lower and upper Beth-horon, and also Uzzen-sheerah.
verses.textLa: filia autem eius fuit Sara, quæ ædificavit Bethoron inferiorem et superiorem, et Ozensara.

verses.textEn: And Rephah was his son, and Resheph, and Telah, from whom was born Tahan,
verses.textLa: Porro filius eius Rapha, et Reseph, et Thale, de quo natus est Thaan,

verses.textEn: who conceived Ladan. And his son was Ammihud, who conceived Elishama,
verses.textLa: qui genuit Laadan: huius quoque filius Ammiud, qui genuit Elisama,

verses.textEn: from whom was born Nun, who had Joshua as a son.
verses.textLa: de quo ortus est Nun, qui habuit filium Iosue.

verses.textEn: Now their possessions and habitations were: Bethel with her daughters, and toward the east, Naaran, and toward the western region, Gezer and her daughters, as well as Shechem with her daughters, as far as Ayyah with her daughters;
verses.textLa: Possessio autem eorum et habitatio, Bethel cum filiabus suis, et contra Orientem Noran, ac Occidentalem plagam Gazer et filiæ eius, Sichem quoque cum filiabus suis, usque ad Aza cum filiabus eius.

verses.textEn: also, beside the sons of Manasseh, Bethshean and her daughters, Taanach and her daughters, Megiddo and her daughters, Dor and her daughters. In these places, there lived the sons of Joseph, the son of Israel.
verses.textLa: Iuxta filios quoque Manasse Bethsan et filias eius, Thanach et filias eius, Mageddo et filias eius: Dor et filias eius: in his habitaverunt filii Ioseph, filii Israel.

verses.textEn: The sons of Asher: Imnah, and Ishvah, and Ishvi, and Beriah, and Serah their sister.
verses.textLa: Filii Aser: Iemna, et Iesua, et Iessui, et Baria, et Sara soror eorum.

verses.textEn: And the sons of Beriah: Heber, and Malchiel, the same is the father of Birzaith.
verses.textLa: Filii autem Baria: Heber, et Melchiel: ipse est pater Barsaith.

verses.textEn: Now Heber conceived Japhlet, and Shomer, and Hotham, and their sister Shua.
verses.textLa: Heber autem genuit Iephlat, et Somer, et Hotham, et Suaa sororem eorum.

verses.textEn: The sons of Japhlet: Pasach, and Bimhal, and Ashvath; these are the sons of Japhlet.
verses.textLa: Filii Iephlat: Phosech, et Chamaal, et Asoth: hi filii Iephlat.

verses.textEn: Then the sons of Shomer: Ahi, and Rohgah, and Jehubbah, and Aram.
verses.textLa: Porro filii Somer: Ahi, et Roaga, et Haba, et Aram.
verses.notes: The word or name ‘Ahi’ is from the Hebrew ‘achi’ which might in this verse be a name or the word ‘brother,’ meaning that Shomer is the brother of Japhlet.

verses.textEn: And the sons of Helem, his brother: Zophah, and Imna, and Shelesh, and Amal.
verses.textLa: Filii autem Helem fratris eius: Supha, et Iemna, et Selles, et Amal.

verses.textEn: The sons of Zophah: Suah, Harnepher, and Shual, and Beri, and Imrah,
verses.textLa: Filii Supha: Sue, Harnapher, et Sual, et Beri, et Iamra,

verses.textEn: Bezer, and Hod, and Shamma, and Shilshah, and Ithran, and Beera.
verses.textLa: Bosor, et Hod, et Samma, et Salusa, et Iethran, et Bera.

verses.textEn: The sons of Jether: Jephunneh, and Pispa, and Ara.
verses.textLa: Filii Iether: Iephone, et Phaspha, et Ara.

verses.textEn: Then the sons of Ulla: Arah, and Hanniel, and Rizia.
verses.textLa: Filii autem Olla: Aree, et Haniel, et Resia.

verses.textEn: All these were sons of Asher, the leaders of families, elect and very strong rulers among rulers. And the number of those who were of an age that was fit for warfare was twenty-six thousand.
verses.textLa: Omnes hi filii Aser, principes cognationum, electi atque fortissimi duces ducum: numerus autem eorum ætatis, quæ apta esset ad bellum, viginti sex millia.

verses.textEn: Now Benjamin conceived Bela as his firstborn, Ashbel the second, Aharah the third,
verses.textLa: Beniamin autem genuit Bale primogenitum suum, Asbel secundum, Ahara tertium,

verses.textEn: Nohah the fourth, and Rapha the fifth.
verses.textLa: Nohaa quartum, et Rapha quintum.

verses.textEn: And the sons of Bela were: Addar, and Gera, and Abihud,
verses.textLa: Fueruntque filii Bale: Addar, et Gera, et Abiud,

verses.textEn: as well as Abishua, and Naaman, and Ahoah,
verses.textLa: Abisue quoque et Naaman, et Ahoe,

verses.textEn: then also Gera, and Shephuphan, and Huram.
verses.textLa: sed et Gera, et Sephuphan, et Huram.

verses.textEn: These are the sons of Ehud, leaders of the kindred living in Geba, who were moved away to Manahath.
verses.textLa: Hi sunt filii Ahod, principes cognationum habitantium in Gabaa, qui translati sunt in Manahath.

verses.textEn: And Naaman, and Ahijah, and Gera, he also moved them away; and he conceived Uzza and Ahihud.
verses.textLa: Naaman autem, et Achia, et Gera ipse transtulit eos, et genuit Osa, et Ahiud.

verses.textEn: Then Shaharaim conceived, in the region of Moab, after he sent away Hushim and Baara, his wives;
verses.textLa: Porro Saharaim genuit in regione Moab, postquam dimisit Husim, et Bara uxores suas.

verses.textEn: and so, of his wife Hodesh, he conceived Jobab, and Zibia, and Mesha, and Malcam,
verses.textLa: Genuit autem de Hodes uxore sua Iobab, et Sebia, et Mosa, et Molchom,

verses.textEn: and also Jeuz and Sachia, and Mirmah. These were his sons, the leaders of their families.
verses.textLa: Iehus quoque, et Sechia, et Marma. Hi sunt filii eius principes in familiis suis.

verses.textEn: Truly, of Hushim he conceived Abitub and Elpaal.
verses.textLa: Mehusim vero genuit Abitob, et Elphaal.

verses.textEn: And the sons of Elpaal were Eber, and Misham, and Shemed, who built Ono and Lod and its daughters.
verses.textLa: Porro filii Elphaal: Heber, et Misaam, et Samad: hic ædificavit Ono, et Lod, et filias eius.

verses.textEn: Now Beriah and Shema were leaders of their families living in Aijalon; these put to flight the inhabitants of Gath.
verses.textLa: Baria autem, et Sama principes cognationum habitantium in Aialon: hi fugaverunt habitatores Geth.

verses.textEn: And Ahio, and Shashak, and Jeremoth,
verses.textLa: Et Ahio, et Sesac, et Ierimoth,

verses.textEn: and Zebadiah, and Arad, and Eder,
verses.textLa: et Zabadia, et Arod, et Heder,

verses.textEn: as well as Michael, and Ishpah, and Joha, were the sons of Beriah.
verses.textLa: Michael quoque, et Iespha, et Ioha filii Baria.

verses.textEn: Then Zebadiah, and Meshullam, and Hizki, and Heber,
verses.textLa: Et Zabadia, et Mosollam, et Hezeci, et Heber,

verses.textEn: and Ishmerai, and Izliah, and Jobab were the sons of Elpaal.
verses.textLa: et Iesamari, et Iezlia, et Iobab filii Elphaal,

verses.textEn: Then Jakim, and Zichri, and Zabdi,
verses.textLa: et Iacim, et Zechri, et Zabdi,

verses.textEn: and Elienai, and Zillethai, and Eliel,
verses.textLa: et Elioenai, et Selethai, et Eliel,

verses.textEn: and Adaiah, and Beraiah, and Shimrath were the sons of Shimei.
verses.textLa: et Adaia, et Baraia, et Samarath filii Semei.

verses.textEn: Then Ishpan, and Eber, and Eliel,
verses.textLa: Et Iespham, et Heber, et Eliel,

verses.textEn: and Abdon, and Zichri, and Hanan,
verses.textLa: et Abdon, et Zechri, et Hanan,

verses.textEn: and Hananiah, and Elam, and Anthothijah,
verses.textLa: et Hanania, et Ælam, et Anathothia,

verses.textEn: and Iphdeiah, and Penuel were the sons of Shashak.
verses.textLa: et Iephdaia, et Phanuel filii Sesac.

verses.textEn: Then Shamsherai, and Shehariah and Athaliah,
verses.textLa: Et Samsari, et Sohoria, et Otholia,

verses.textEn: and Jaareshiah, and Elijah, and Zichri were the sons of Jeroham.
verses.textLa: et Iersia, et Elia, et Zechri, filii Ieroham.

verses.textEn: These were the patriarchs and leaders of the families who were living in Jerusalem.
verses.textLa: Hi patriarchæ, et cognationum principes, qui habitaverunt in Ierusalem.

verses.textEn: Now in Gibeon, there lived Jeiel, the father of Gibeon; and the name of his wife was Maacah,
verses.textLa: In Gabaon autem habitaverunt Iehiel pater Gabaon, et nomen uxoris eius Maacha:

verses.textEn: and his firstborn son was Abdon, and then Zur, and Kish, and Baal, and Nadab,
verses.textLa: filiusque eius primogenitus Abdon, et Sur, et Cis, et Baal, et Nadab.

verses.textEn: and Gedor, and Ahio, and Zecher, and Mikloth.
verses.textLa: Gedor quoque, et Ahio, et Zacher, et Macelloth:

verses.textEn: And Mikloth conceived Shimeah. And they lived opposite their brothers in Jerusalem, with their brothers.
verses.textLa: et Macelloth genuit Samaa: habitaveruntque ex adverso fratrum suorum in Ierusalem cum fratribus suis.

verses.textEn: Now Ner conceived Kish, and Kish conceived Saul. Then Saul conceived Jonathan, and Malchishua, and Abinadab, and Eshbaal.
verses.textLa: Ner autem genuit Cis, et Cis genuit Saul. Porro Saul genuit Ionathan, et Melchisua, et Abinadab, et Esbaal.

verses.textEn: And the son of Jonathan was Meribbaal; and Meribbaal conceived Micah.
verses.textLa: Filius autem Ionathan, Meribbaal: et Meribbaal genuit Micha.

verses.textEn: The sons of Micah were Pithon, and Melech, and Tarea, and Ahaz.
verses.textLa: Filii Micha, Phithon, et Melech, et Tharaa, et Ahaz.

verses.textEn: And Ahaz conceived Jehoaddah. And Jehoaddah conceived Alemeth, and Azmaveth, and Zimri. And Zimri conceived Moza.
verses.textLa: Et Ahaz genuit Ioada: et Ioada genuit Alamath, et Azmoth, et Zamri: porro Zamri genuit Mosa,

verses.textEn: And Moza conceived Binea, whose son was Raphah, of whom was born Eleasah, who conceived Azel.
verses.textLa: et Mosa genuit Banaa, cuius filius fuit Rapha, de quo ortus est Elasa, qui genuit Asel.

verses.textEn: Now there were six sons for Azel, whose names were Azrikam, Bocheru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah, and Hanan. All these were the sons of Azel.
verses.textLa: Porro Asel sex filii fuerunt his nominibus, Ezricam, Bocru, Ismahel, Saria, Obdia, et Hanan. Omnes hi filii Asel.

verses.textEn: Then the sons of Eshek, his brother, were Ulam the firstborn, and Jeush the second, and Eliphelet the third.
verses.textLa: Filii autem Esec fratris eius, Ulam primogenitus, et Iehus secundus, et Eliphalet tertius.

verses.textEn: And the sons of Ulam were very robust men, drawing the bow with great strength. And they had many sons and grandsons, even to one hundred fifty. All these were sons of Benjamin.
verses.textLa: Fueruntque filii Ulam viri robustissimi, et magno robore tendentes arcum: et multos habentes filios ac nepotes, usque ad centum quinquaginta. Omnes hi, filii Beniamin.

verses.textEn: And so, all of Israel was numbered. And the sum of them was written in the book of the kings of Israel and of Judah. And they were taken away to Babylon because of their transgression.
verses.textLa: Universus ergo Israel dinumeratus est: et summa eorum scripta est in Libro regum Israel, et Iuda: translatique sunt in Babylonem propter delictum suum.

verses.textEn: Now the first who lived in their possessions and in their cities were Israel, and the priests, and the Levites, and the temple servants.
verses.textLa: Qui autem habitaverunt primi in possessionibus, et in urbibus suis: Israel, et Sacerdotes, et Levitæ, et Nathinæi.

verses.textEn: Staying in Jerusalem were some from the sons of Judah, and from the sons of Benjamin, and also from the sons of Ephraim and of Manasseh:
verses.textLa: Commorati sunt in Ierusalem de filiis Iuda, et de filiis Beniamin, de filiis quoque Ephraim, et Manasse.

verses.textEn: Uthai, the son of Ammihud, the son of Omri, the son of Imri, the son of Bani, from the sons of Perez, the son of Judah.
verses.textLa: Othei filius Ammiud, filii Amri, filii Omrai, filii Bonni, de filiis Phares filii Iuda.

verses.textEn: And from Shiloni: Asaiah the firstborn, and his sons.
verses.textLa: Et de Siloni: Asaia primogenitus, et filii eius.

verses.textEn: Then from the sons of Zerah: Jeuel, and their brothers, six hundred ninety.
verses.textLa: De filiis autem Zara: Iehuel, et fratres eorum, sexcenti nonaginta.

verses.textEn: And from the sons of Benjamin: Sallu, the son of Meshullam, the son of Hodaviah, the son of Hassenuah;
verses.textLa: Porro de filiis Beniamin: Salo filius Mosollam, filii Oduia, filii Asana:

verses.textEn: and Ibneiah, the son of Jeroham; and Elah, the son of Uzzi, the son of Michri; and Meshullam, the son of Shephatiah, the son of Reuel, the son of Ibnijah;
verses.textLa: et Iobania filius Ieroham: et Ela filius Ozi, filii Mochori: et Mosollam filius Saphatiæ, filii Rahuel, filii Iebaniæ,

verses.textEn: and their brothers according to their families, nine hundred fifty-six. All these were leaders of their kindred, according to the houses of their fathers.
verses.textLa: et fratres eorum per familias suas, nongenti quinquaginta sex. Omnes hi, principes cognationum per domos patrum suorum.

verses.textEn: And from the priests: Jedaiah, Jehoiarib, and Jachin;
verses.textLa: De sacerdotibus autem: Iedaia, Ioiarib, et Iachin:
