verses.textEn: and also Azariah, the son of Hilkiah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Zadok, the son of Meraioth, the son of Ahitub, the high priest of the house of God;
verses.textLa: Azarias quoque filius Helciæ, filii Mosollam, filii Sadoc, filii Maraioth, filii Achitob, pontifex domus Dei.

verses.textEn: then Adaiah, the son of Jeroham, the son of Pashhur, the son of Malchijah; and Maasai, the son of Adiel, the son of Jahzerah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Meshillemith, the son of Immer;
verses.textLa: Porro Adaias filius Ieroham, filii Phassur, filii Melchiæ: et Maasai filius Adiel, filii Iezra, filii Mosollam, filii Mosollamith, filii Emmer:

verses.textEn: and also their brothers, leaders according to their families, one thousand seven hundred sixty, very strong experienced men, for the work of the ministry in the house of God.
verses.textLa: fratres quoque eorum principes per familias suas, mille septingenti sexaginta, fortissimi robore ad faciendum opus ministerii in domo Dei.

verses.textEn: Then from the Levites: Shemaiah, the son of Hasshub, the son of Azrikam, the son of Hashabiah, of the sons of Merari;
verses.textLa: De Levitis autem: Semeia filius Hassub filii Ezricam, filii Hasebia de filiis Merari.

verses.textEn: and also Bakbakkar the carpenter; and Galal; and Mattaniah, the son of Mica, the son of Zichri, the son of Asaph;
verses.textLa: Bacbacar quoque carpentarius, et Galal, et Mathania filius Micha, filii Zechri, filii Asaph:

verses.textEn: and Obadiah, the son of Shemaiah, the son of Galal, the son of Jeduthun; and Berechiah, the son of Asa, the son of Elkanah, who lived at the entrance to Netophah.
verses.textLa: et Obdia filius Semeiæ, filii Galal, filii Idithun: et Barachia filius Asa, filii Elcana, qui habitavit in atriis Netophati.

verses.textEn: Now the gatekeepers were Shallum, and Akkub, and Talmon, and Ahiman; and their brother Shallum was the leader.
verses.textLa: Ianitores autem: Sellum, et Accub, et Telmon, et Ahimam: et frater eorum Sellum princeps,

verses.textEn: For until that time, at the gate of the king to the east, the sons of Levi served in their turns.
verses.textLa: usque ad illud tempus, in porta regis ad orientem, observabant per vices suas de filiis Levi.

verses.textEn: Truly, Shallum, the son of Kore, the son of Ebiasaph, the son of Korah, with his brothers and his father’s house, these Korahites, were over the works of the ministry of keeping the vestibules of the tabernacle. And their families, in turns, were keepers of the entrance to the camp of the Lord.
verses.textLa: Sellum vero filius Core filii Abiasaph, filii Core, cum fratribus suis, et domo patris sui, hi sunt Coritæ super opera ministerii, custodes vestibulorum tabernaculi: et familiæ eorum per vices castrorum Domini custodientes introitum.

verses.textEn: Now Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, was their ruler before the Lord.
verses.textLa: Phinees autem filius Eleazari, erat dux eorum coram Domino.

verses.textEn: But Zechariah, the son of Meshelemiah, was the keeper of the gate of the tabernacle of the testimony.
verses.textLa: Porro Zacharias filius Mosollamia, ianitor portæ tabernaculi testimonii.

verses.textEn: All these, chosen as porters for the gates, were two hundred twelve. And they were recorded in their own towns, those whom David, and the seer Samuel, appointed, in their faith,
verses.textLa: Omnes hi electi in ostiarios per portas, ducenti duodecim: et descripti in villis propriis: quos constituerunt David, et Samuel videns, in fide sua

verses.textEn: as with them, so also with their sons, at the gates of the house of the Lord and the tabernacle, by their turns.
verses.textLa: tam ipsos, quam filios eorum in ostiis domus Domini, et in tabernaculo vicibus suis.

verses.textEn: At the four directions, there were gatekeepers, that is, at the east, and at the west, and at the north, and at the south.
verses.textLa: Per quattuor ventos erant ostiarii, id est, ad Orientem, et ad Occidentem, et ad Aquilonem, et ad Austrum.

verses.textEn: Now their brothers were staying in the villages, and they arrived on their Sabbaths, from time to time.
verses.textLa: Fratres autem eorum in viculis morabantur, et veniebant in Sabbatis suis de tempore usque ad tempus.

verses.textEn: To these four Levites were entrusted the entire number of the gatekeepers, and they were over the chambers and storehouses of the house of the Lord.
verses.textLa: His quattuor Levitis creditus erat omnis numerus ianitorum, et erant super exedras, et thesauros domus Domini.

verses.textEn: And they remained in their watches, on all sides of the temple of the Lord, so that, when the time had arrived, they might open the gates in the morning.
verses.textLa: Per gyrum quoque templi Domini morabantur in custodiis suis: ut cum tempus fuisset, ipsi mane aperirent fores.

verses.textEn: Some from their kindred were also over the vessels of the ministry. For the vessels were both carried in and carried out according to number.
verses.textLa: De horum genere erant et super vasa ministerii: ad numerum enim et inferebantur vasa, et efferebantur.

verses.textEn: Some of them also were entrusted with the equipment of the sanctuary; they were in charge of the fine wheat flour, and the wine, and the oil, and the frankincense, and the aromatics.
verses.textLa: De ipsis et qui credita habebant utensilia sanctuarii, præerant similæ, et vino, et oleo, et thuri, et aromatibus.

verses.textEn: Now the sons of the priests composed the ointments from the aromatics.
verses.textLa: Filii autem sacerdotum unguenta ex aromatibus conficiebant.

verses.textEn: And Mattithiah, a Levite, the firstborn of Shallum the Korahite, was in charge of those things that were cooked in a frying pan.
verses.textLa: Et Mathathias Levites primogenitus Sellum Coritæ, præfectus erat eorum, quæ in sartagine frigebantur.

verses.textEn: Now some of the sons of Kohath, their brothers, were over the bread of the presence, so that they might continually prepare it new for each Sabbath.
verses.textLa: Porro de filiis Caath fratribus eorum, super panes erant propositionis, ut semper novos per singula Sabbata præpararent.

verses.textEn: These are the leaders of the singing men, according to the families of the Levites, who were dwelling in the chambers, so that they might carry out their ministry continually, day and night.
verses.textLa: Hi sunt principes cantorum per familias Levitarum, qui in exedris morabantur, ut die ac nocte iugiter suo ministerio deservirent.

verses.textEn: The heads of the Levites, leaders according to their families, abode in Jerusalem.
verses.textLa: Capita Levitarum, per familias suas principes, manserunt in Ierusalem.

verses.textEn: Now in Gibeon, there lived Jeiel, the father of Gibeon, and the name of his wife was Maacah.
verses.textLa: In Gabaon autem commorati sunt pater Gabaon Iehiel, et nomen uxoris eius Maacha.

verses.textEn: His firstborn son was Abdon, and then Zur, and Kish, and Baal, and Ner, and Nadab,
verses.textLa: Filius primogenitus eius Abdon, et Sur, et Cis, et Baal, et Ner, et Nadab,

verses.textEn: as well as Gedor, and Ahio, and Zechariah, and Mikloth.
verses.textLa: Gedor quoque, et Ahio, et Zacharias, et Macelloth.

verses.textEn: Then Mikloth conceived Shimeam. These lived opposite their brothers in Jerusalem, with their brothers.
verses.textLa: Porro Macelloth genuit Samaan: isti habitaverunt e regione fratrum suorum in Ierusalem, cum fratribus suis.

verses.textEn: Now Ner conceived Kish, and Kish conceived Saul. And Saul conceived Jonathan, and Malchishua, and Abinadab, and Eshbaal.
verses.textLa: Ner autem genuit Cis: et Cis genuit Saul: et Saul genuit Ionathan, et Melchisua, et Abinadab, et Esbaal.

verses.textEn: And the son of Jonathan was Meribbaal. And Meribbaal conceived Micah.
verses.textLa: Filius autem Ionathan, Meribbaal: et Meribbaal genuit Micha.

verses.textEn: Now the sons of Micah were Pithon, and Melech, and Tahrea, and Ahaz.
verses.textLa: Porro filii Micha, Phithon, et Melech, et Tharaa, et Ahaz.

verses.textEn: And Ahaz conceived Jarah. And Jarah conceived Alemeth, and Azmaveth, and Zimri. Then Zimri conceived Moza.
verses.textLa: Ahaz autem genuit Iara: et Iara genuit Alamath, et Azmoth, et Zamri. Zamri autem genuit Mosa.

verses.textEn: Truly, Moza conceived Binea, whose son, Rephaiah, conceived Eleasah, from of whom was born Azel.
verses.textLa: Mosa vero genuit Banaa: cuius filius Raphaia, genuit Elasa: de quo ortus est Asel.

verses.textEn: Now Azel had six sons, whose names are: Azrikam, Bocheru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah, Hanan. These are the sons of Azel.
verses.textLa: Porro Asel sex filios habuit his nominibus, Ezricam, Bocru, Ismahel, Saria, Obdia, Hanan. Hi sunt filii Asel.

verses.textEn: Now the Philistines were fighting against Israel, and the men of Israel fled from the Philistines, and they fell down wounded on mount Gilboa.
verses.textLa: Philisthiim autem pugnabant contra Israel, fugeruntque viri Israel Palæsthinos, et ceciderunt vulnerati in monte Gelboe.

verses.textEn: And when the Philistines had drawn near, pursuing Saul and his sons, they struck down Jonathan, and Abinadab, and Malchishua, the sons of Saul.
verses.textLa: Cumque appropinquassent Philisthæi persequentes Saul, et filios eius, percusserunt Ionathan, et Abinadab, et Melchisua filios Saul.

verses.textEn: And the battle grew heavy against Saul. And the archers found him, and they wounded him with arrows.
verses.textLa: Et aggravatum est prælium contra Saul, inveneruntque eum sagittarii, et vulneraverunt iaculis.

verses.textEn: And Saul said to his armor bearer: “Unsheathe your sword and kill me. Otherwise, these uncircumcised men may arrive and mock me.” But his armor bearer was not willing, having been struck with fear. And so, Saul took hold of his sword, and he fell upon it.
verses.textLa: Et dixit Saul ad armigerum suum: Evagina gladium tuum, et interfice me: ne forte veniant incircumcisi isti, et illudant mihi. Noluit autem armiger eius hoc facere, timore perterritus: arripuit ergo Saul ensem, et irruit in eum.

verses.textEn: And when his armor bearer had seen this, specifically, that Saul was dead, he now fell on his sword also, and he died.
verses.textLa: Quod cum vidisset armiger eius, videlicet mortuum esse Saul, irruit etiam ipse in gladium suum, et mortuus est.

verses.textEn: Therefore, Saul died, and his three sons passed away, and his entire house fell, together.
verses.textLa: Interiit ergo Saul, et tres filii eius, et omnis domus illius pariter concidit.

verses.textEn: And when the men of Israel who were living in the plains had seen this, they fled. And since Saul and his sons were dead, they abandoned their cities and were dispersed, here and there. And the Philistines arrived and lived among them.
verses.textLa: Quod cum vidissent viri Israel, qui habitabant in campestribus, fugerunt: et Saul ac filiis eius mortuis, dereliquerunt urbes suas, et huc illucque dispersi sunt: veneruntque Philisthiim, et habitaverunt in eis.

verses.textEn: Then, on the next day, when the Philistines were taking away the spoils of the slain, they found Saul and his sons, lying on mount Gilboa.
verses.textLa: Die igitur altero detrahentes Philisthiim spolia cæsorum, invenerunt Saul, et filios eius iacentes in monte Gelboe.

verses.textEn: And when they had despoiled him, and had cut off his head, and had stripped his armor, they sent these things into their land, so that they would be carried around and displayed in the temples of the idols and to the people.
verses.textLa: Cumque spoliassent eum, et amputassent caput, armisque nudassent, miserunt in terram suam, ut circumferretur, et ostenderetur idolorum templis, et populis:

verses.textEn: But his armor they consecrated in the shrine of their god, and his head they affixed in the temple of Dagon.
verses.textLa: arma autem eius consecraverunt in fano dei sui, et caput affixerunt in templo Dagon.

verses.textEn: When the men of Jabesh Gilead had heard this, specifically, all that the Philistines had done concerning Saul,
verses.textLa: Hoc cum audissent viri Iabes Galaad, omnia scilicet quæ Philisthiim fecerant super Saul,

verses.textEn: each one of the valiant men rose up, and they took the bodies of Saul and of his sons. And they brought them to Jabesh. And they buried their bones under the oak that was in Jabesh. And they fasted for seven days.
verses.textLa: consurrexerunt singuli virorum fortium, et tulerunt cadavera Saul et filiorum eius: attuleruntque ea in Iabes, et sepelierunt ossa eorum subter quercum, quæ erat in Iabes, et ieiunaverunt septem diebus.

verses.textEn: Thus did Saul die for his iniquities, because he betrayed the commandment of the Lord which he had instructed, and did not keep it. And moreover, he even consulted a woman diviner;
verses.textLa: Mortuus est ergo Saul propter iniquitates suas, eo quod prævaricatus sit mandatum Domini quod præceperat, et non custodierit illud: sed insuper etiam pythonissam consuluerit,

verses.textEn: for he did not trust in the Lord. Because of this, he caused his death, and he transferred his kingdom to David, the son of Jesse.
verses.textLa: nec speraverit in Domino: propter quod interfecit eum, et transtulit regnum eius ad David filium Isai.

verses.textEn: Then all of Israel was gathered to David at Hebron, saying: “We are your bone and your flesh.
verses.textLa: Congregatus est igitur omnis Israel ad David in Hebron, dicens: Os tuum sumus, et caro tua.

verses.textEn: Also, yesterday and the day before, when Saul still reigned, you were the one who led out and brought in Israel. For the Lord your God said to you: ‘You shall pasture my people Israel, and you shall be the leader over them.’ ”
verses.textLa: Heri quoque, et nudiustertius cum adhuc regnaret Saul, tu eras qui educebas, et introducebas Israel: tibi enim dixit Dominus Deus tuus: Tu pasces populum meum Israel, et tu eris princeps super eum.

verses.textEn: Therefore, all those greater by birth of Israel went to the king at Hebron. And David formed a pact with them before the Lord. And they anointed him king over Israel, in accord with the word of the Lord, which he spoke by the hand of Samuel.
verses.textLa: Venerunt ergo omnes maiores natu Israel ad regem in Hebron, et iniit David cum eis fœdus coram Domino: unxeruntque eum regem super Israel, iuxta sermonem Domini, quem locutus est in manu Samuel.

verses.textEn: Then David and all of Israel went to Jerusalem. The same is Jebus, where the Jebusites, the inhabitants of the land, were.
verses.textLa: Abiit quoque David, et omnis Israel in Ierusalem. Hæc est Iebus, ubi erant Iebusæi habitatores terræ.

verses.textEn: And those who were living in Jebus said to David: “You shall not enter here.” But David seized the stronghold of Zion, which is the city of David.
verses.textLa: Dixeruntque qui habitabant in Iebus ad David: Non ingredieris huc. Porro David cepit arcem Sion, quæ est Civitas David,

verses.textEn: And he said, “Whoever shall strike the Jebusites first, shall be ruler and commander.” And so Joab, the son of Zeruiah, ascended first, and he was made the leader.
verses.textLa: dixitque: Omnis qui percusserit Iebusæum in primis, erit princeps et dux. Ascendit igitur primus Ioab filius Sarviæ, et factus est princeps.

verses.textEn: Then David lived in the stronghold, and for this reason it was called the City of David.
verses.textLa: Habitavit autem David in arce, et idcirco appellata est Civitas David.

verses.textEn: And he built up the city all around, from Millo even to every side. But Joab built the rest of the city.
verses.textLa: Ædificavitque urbem in circuitu a Mello usque ad gyrum: Ioab autem reliqua urbis extruxit.

verses.textEn: And David continued advancing and increasing, and the Lord of hosts was with him.
verses.textLa: Proficiebatque David vadens et crescens, et Dominus exercituum erat cum eo.

verses.textEn: These are the leaders of the strong men of David, who assisted him, so that he would become king over all of Israel, in accord with the word of the Lord, which he spoke to Israel.
verses.textLa: Hi principes virorum fortium David, qui adiuverunt eum ut rex fieret super omnem Israel iuxta verbum Domini, quod locutus est ad Israel.

verses.textEn: And this is the number of the robust of David: Jashobeam, the son of a Hachmonite, leader among the thirty. He lifted up his spear over three hundred, who were wounded at one time.
verses.textLa: Et iste numerus robustorum David: Iesbaam filius Hachamoni princeps inter triginta: iste levavit hastam suam super trecentos vulneratos una vice.

verses.textEn: And after him, there was Eleazar, the son of his uncle, an Ahohite, who was among the three powerful ones.
verses.textLa: Et post eum Eleazar filius patrui eius Ahohites, qui erat inter tres potentes.

verses.textEn: He was with David in Pasdammim, when the Philistines were gathered to that place for battle. Now the field of that region was full of barley, but the people had fled from the face of the Philistines.
verses.textLa: Iste fuit cum David in Phesdomim, quando Philisthiim congregati sunt ad locum illum in prælium: et erat ager regionis illius plenus hordeo, fugeratque populus a facie Philisthinorum.

verses.textEn: These men stood in the midst of the field, and they defended it. And when they had struck down the Philistines, the Lord gave a great salvation to his people.
verses.textLa: Hi steterunt in medio agri, et defenderunt eum: cumque percussissent Philisthæos, dedit Dominus salutem magnam populo suo.

verses.textEn: Then three from the thirty leaders descended to the rock where David was, to the cave of Adullam, when the Philistines had made camp in the Valley of the Rephaim.
verses.textLa: Descenderunt autem tres de triginta principibus ad petram, in qua erat David, ad speluncam Odollam, quando Philisthiim fuerant castrametati in Valle Raphaim.

verses.textEn: Now David was in a stronghold, and a garrison of the Philistines was in Bethlehem.
verses.textLa: Porro David erat in præsidio, et statio Philisthinorum in Bethlehem.

verses.textEn: And then David desired and said, “O if only someone would give me water from the well of Bethlehem, which is at the gate!”
verses.textLa: Desideravit igitur David, et dixit: O si quis daret mihi aquam de cisterna Bethlehem, quæ est in porta!

verses.textEn: Therefore, these three broke through to the midst of the camp of the Philistines, and they drew water from the well of Bethlehem, which was at the gate. And they took it to David, so that he might drink. But he was not willing; and instead, he offered it as a libation to the Lord,
verses.textLa: Tres ergo isti per media castra Philisthinorum perrexerunt, et hauserunt aquam de cisterna Bethlehem, quæ erat in porta, et attulerunt ad David ut biberet: qui noluit, sed magis libavit illam Domino,

verses.textEn: saying: “Far be it from me, that I would do this in the sight of my God, and that I would drink the blood of these men. For at the peril of their own lives, they brought the water to me.” And for this reason, he was not willing to drink. The three most powerful accomplished these things.
verses.textLa: dicens: Absit ut in conspectu Dei mei hoc faciam, et sanguinem istorum virorum bibam: quia in periculo animarum suarum attulerunt mihi aquam. Et ob hanc causam noluit bibere. Hæc fecerunt tres robustissimi.

verses.textEn: Also, Abishai, the brother of Joab, was the leader of the three, and he lifted up his spear against three hundred, who were wounded. And he was most renowned among the three,
verses.textLa: Abisai quoque frater Ioab ipse erat princeps trium, et ipse levavit hastam suam contra trecentos vulneratos, et ipse erat inter tres nominatissimus,

verses.textEn: and he was famous among the second three and their leader. Yet truly, he did not reach as far as the first three.
verses.textLa: et inter tres secundos inclytus, et princeps eorum: verumtamen usque ad tres primos non pervenerat.
verses.notes: Or: and he was well-known to the second three and their leader.

verses.textEn: Benaiah, the son of Jehoiada, from Kabzeel, was a very mature man, who had accomplished many deeds. He struck down the two lions of God from Moab. And he descended and killed a lion in the middle of a pit, in the time of snow.
verses.textLa: Banaias filius Ioiadæ viri robustissimi, qui multa opera perpetrarat, de Cabseel: ipse percussit duos ariel Moab: et ipse descendit, et interfecit leonem in media cisterna tempore nivis.
verses.notes: These two lions were of God in two senses, they were of the one true God, first and foremost, in the sense that God used these lions, being killed by an Israelite, to rebuke the false religion of the Moabites. And they were apparently lions that had some type of religious meaning or role in the pagan Moabite religion, so that they were of the pagan gods.

verses.textEn: And he struck down an Egyptian man, whose stature was five cubits, and who had a spear like a weaver’s beam. And yet he descended to him with a staff. And he seized the spear that he was holding in his hand. And he killed him with his own spear.
verses.textLa: Et ipse percussit virum Ægyptium, cuius statura erat quinque cubitorum, et habebat lanceam ut liciatorium texentium: descendit igitur ad eum cum virga, et rapuit hastam, quam tenebat manu. Et interfecit eum hasta sua.

verses.textEn: These things were done by Benaiah, the son of Jehoiada, who was most renowned among the three robust ones,
verses.textLa: Hæc fecit Banaias filius Ioiadæ, qui erat inter tres robustos nominatissimus,

verses.textEn: the first among the thirty. Yet truly, he did not reach as far as the three. Then David placed him beside his ear.
verses.textLa: inter triginta primus, verumtamen ad tres usque non pervenerat: posuit autem eum David ad auriculam suam.

verses.textEn: Moreover, the strongest men of the army were Asahel, the brother of Joab; and Elhanan, the son of his uncle, from Bethlehem;
verses.textLa: Porro fortissimi viri in exercitu, Asahel frater Ioab, et Elchanan filius patrui eius de Bethlehem,

verses.textEn: Shammoth, a Harorite; Helez, a Pelonite;
verses.textLa: Sammoth Arorites, Helles Pharonites,

verses.textEn: Ira, the son of Ikkesh, a Tekoite; Abiezer, an Anathothite;
verses.textLa: Ira filius Acces Thecuites, Abiezer Anathothites,

verses.textEn: Sibbecai, a Hushathite; Ilai, an Ahohite;
verses.textLa: Sobbochai Husathites, Ilai Ahohites,

verses.textEn: Maharai, a Netophathite; Heled, the son of Baanah, a Netophathite;
verses.textLa: Maharai Netophathites, Heled filius Baana Netophathites,

verses.textEn: Ithai, the son of Ribai, from Gibeah, of the sons of Benjamin; Benaiah, a Pirathonite;
verses.textLa: Ethai filius Ribai de Gabaath filiorum Beniamin, Banaia Pharatonites,

verses.textEn: Hurai, from the torrent Gaash; Abiel, an Arbathite; Azmaveth, a Baharumite; Eliahba, a Shaalbonite.
verses.textLa: Hurai de Torrente Gaas, Abiel Arbathites, Azmoth Bauramites, Eliaba Salabonites.

verses.textEn: The sons of Hashem, a Gizonite: Jonathan, the son of Shagee, a Hararite;
verses.textLa: Filii Assem Gezonites, Ionathan filius Sage Ararites,

verses.textEn: Ahiam, the son of Sachar, a Hararite;
verses.textLa: Ahiam filius Sachar Ararites,

verses.textEn: Eliphal, the son of Ur;
verses.textLa: Eliphal filius Ur,

verses.textEn: Hepher, a Mecherathite; Ahijah, a Pelonite;
verses.textLa: Hepher Mecherathites, Ahia Phelonites,

verses.textEn: Hezro, a Carmelite; Naharai, the son of Ezbai;
verses.textLa: Hesro Carmelites, Naarai filius Asbai,

verses.textEn: Joel, the brother of Nathan; Mibhar, the son of Hagri;
verses.textLa: Ioel frater Nathan, Mibahar filius Agarai.

verses.textEn: Zelek, an Ammonite; Naarai, a Beerothite, the armor bearer of Joab, the son of Zeruiah;
verses.textLa: Selec Ammonites, Naharai Berothites armiger Ioab filii Sarviæ.

verses.textEn: Ira, an Ithrite; Gareb, an Ithrite;
verses.textLa: Ira Iethræus, Gareb Iethræus,

verses.textEn: Uriah, a Hittite; Zabad, the son of Ahlai;
verses.textLa: Urias Hethæus, Zabad filius Oholi,

verses.textEn: Adina, the son of Shiza, a Reubenite, the leader of the Reubenites, and thirty who were with him;
verses.textLa: Adina filius Siza Rubenites princeps Rubenitarum, et cum eo triginta:

verses.textEn: Hanan, the son of Maacah; and Joshaphat, a Mithnite;
verses.textLa: Hanan filius Maacha, et Iosaphat Mathanites,

verses.textEn: Uzzia, an Ashterathite; Shama and Jeiel, the sons of Hotham, an Aroerite;
verses.textLa: Ozia Astarothites, Samma, et Iehiel filii Hotham Arorites,

verses.textEn: Jediael, the son of Shimri; and Joha, his brother, a Tizite;
verses.textLa: Iedihel filius Samri, et Ioha frater eius Thosaites,

verses.textEn: Eliel, a Mahavite; and Jeribai and Joshaviah, the sons of Elnaam; and Ithmah, a Moabite; Eliel, and Obed, and Jaasiel from Mezobaite.
verses.textLa: Eliel Mahumites, et Ieribai, et Iosaia filii Elnaem, et Iethma Moabites, Eliel, et Obed, et Iasiel de Masobia.

verses.textEn: Also, these went to David at Ziklag, while he was still fleeing from Saul, the son of Kish. And they were very strong and distinguished fighters,
verses.textLa: Hi quoque venerunt ad David in Siceleg, cum adhuc fugeret Saul filium Cis, qui erant fortissimi et egregii pugnatores,

verses.textEn: bending the bow, and using either hand in casting stones with slings, and shooting arrows. From the brothers of Saul, out of Benjamin:
verses.textLa: tendentes arcum, et utraque manu fundis saxa iacientes, et dirigentes sagittas: de fratribus Saul ex Beniamin.

verses.textEn: the leader was Ahiezer, with Joash, sons of Shemaah from Gibeah, and Jeziel and Pelet, sons of Azmaveth, and Beracah and Jehu, from Anathoth.
verses.textLa: Princeps Ahiecer, et Ioas filii Samaa Gabaathites, et Iaziel, et Phallet filii Azmoth, et Baracha, et Iehu Anathotites.

verses.textEn: Also, there was Ishmaiah, from Gibeon, the strongest among the thirty and over the thirty; Jeremiah, and Jahaziel, and Johanan, and Jozabad, from Gederah;
verses.textLa: Samaias quoque Gabaonites fortissimus inter triginta et super triginta. Ieremias, et Ieheziel, et Iohanan, et Iezabad Gaderothites,

verses.textEn: and Eluzai, and Jerimoth, and Bealiah, and Shemariah, and Shephatiah, the Haruphites;
verses.textLa: et Eluzai et Ierimuth, et Baalia, et Samaria, et Saphatia Haruphites.

verses.textEn: Elkanah, and Isshiah, and Azarel, and Joezer, and Jashobeam, from Carehim;
verses.textLa: Elcana, et Iesia, et Azareel, et Ioezer, et Iesbaam de Carehim:

verses.textEn: and also Joelah and Zebadiah, sons of Jeroham, from Gedor.
verses.textLa: Ioela quoque, et Zabadia filii Ieroham de Gedor.

verses.textEn: Then too, from Gad, there went over to David, when he was hiding in the desert, very robust men, who were excellent fighters, taking hold of shield and spear; their faces were like the faces of a lion, and they were swift like the roe deer upon the mountains.
verses.textLa: Sed et de Gaddi transfugerunt ad David, cum lateret in deserto, viri robustissimi, et pugnatores optimi, tenentes clypeum et hastam: facies eorum quasi facies leonis, et veloces quasi capreæ in montibus:

verses.textEn: Ezer was the leader, Obadiah the second, Eliab the third,
verses.textLa: Ezer princeps, Obdias secundus, Eliab tertius,

verses.textEn: Mishmannah the fourth, Jeremiah the fifth,
verses.textLa: Masmana quartus, Ieremias quintus,

verses.textEn: Attai the sixth, Eliel the seventh,
verses.textLa: Ethi sextus, Eliel septimus,

verses.textEn: Johanan the eighth, Elzabad the ninth,
verses.textLa: Iohanan octavus, Elzebad nonus,

verses.textEn: Jeremiah the tenth, Machbannai the eleventh.
verses.textLa: Ieremias decimus, Machbanai undecimus.

verses.textEn: These were from the sons of Gad, leaders of the army. The least was in charge of one hundred soldiers, and the greatest was in charge of one thousand.
verses.textLa: Hi de filiis Gad principes exercitus: novissimus centum militibus præerat, et maximus, mille.

verses.textEn: These are the ones who crossed over the Jordan in the first month, when it is accustomed to overflow its banks. And they put to flight all those who were staying in the valleys, to the eastern region and to the west.
verses.textLa: Isti sunt qui transierunt Iordanem mense primo, quando inundare consuevit super ripas suas: et omnes fugaverunt qui morabantur in vallibus ad orientalem plagam et occidentalem.

verses.textEn: Then some from Benjamin and from Judah also arrived at the stronghold where David was staying.
verses.textLa: Venerunt autem et de Beniamin, et de Iuda ad præsidium, in quo morabatur David.

verses.textEn: And David went out to meet them, and he said: “If you have arrived peacefully, so as to be a help to me, may my heart be joined to you; but if to betray me to my adversaries, though I have no iniquity in my hands, may the God of our fathers see and judge.”
verses.textLa: Egressusque est David obviam eis, et ait: Si pacifice venistis ad me ut auxiliemini mihi, cor meum iungatur vobis: si autem insidiamini mihi pro adversariis meis, cum ego iniquitatem in manibus non habeam, videat Deus patrum nostrorum, et iudicet.

verses.textEn: Truly, the Spirit clothed Amasai, the leader among the thirty, and he said: “O David, we are yours! O son of Jesse, we are for you! Peace, peace to you, and peace to your helpers. For your God helps you.” Therefore, David received them, and he appointed them as leaders of troops.
verses.textLa: Spiritus vero induit Amasai principem inter triginta, et ait: Tui sumus, o David, et tecum, fili Isai: pax, pax tibi, et pax adiutoribus tuis. Te enim adiuvat Deus tuus. Suscepit ergo eos David, et constituit principes turmæ.

verses.textEn: Moreover, some from Manasseh crossed over to David, when he went forth with the Philistines against Saul, so that he might fight. But he did not fight with them. For the leaders of the Philistines, taking counsel, sent him back, saying, “To the peril of our own heads, he will return to his lord, Saul.”
verses.textLa: Porro de Manasse transfugerunt ad David, quando veniebat cum Philisthiim adversus Saul, ut pugnaret: et non dimicavit cum eis. Quia inito consilio remiserunt eum principes Philisthinorum, dicentes: Periculo capitis nostri revertetur ad dominum suum Saul.

verses.textEn: And so, when he returned to Ziklag, some fled over to him from Manasseh: Adnah, and Jozabad, and Jediael, and Michael, and Adnah, and Jozabad, and Elihu, and Zillethai, leaders of thousands in Manasseh.
verses.textLa: Quando igitur reversus est in Siceleg, transfugerunt ad eum de Manasse, Ednas, et Iozabad, et Iedihel, et Michael, et Ednas, et Iozabad, et Eliu, et Salathi, principes millium in Manasse.

verses.textEn: These offered assistance to David against the robbers. For all were very strong men, and they became leaders in the army.
verses.textLa: Hi præbuerunt auxilium David adversus latrunculos: omnes enim erant viri fortissimi, et facti sunt principes in exercitu.

verses.textEn: Then, too, some came to David throughout each day, in order to help him, until they became a great number, like the army of God.
verses.textLa: Sed et per singulos dies veniebant ad David ad auxiliandum ei, usque dum fieret grandis numerus, quasi exercitus Dei.

verses.textEn: Now this is the number of the leaders of the army who went to David when he was at Hebron, so that they might transfer the kingdom of Saul to him, in accord with the word of the Lord:
verses.textLa: Iste quoque est numerus principum exercitus, qui venerunt ad David, cum esset in Hebron, ut transferrent regnum Saul ad eum, iuxta verbum Domini.

verses.textEn: the sons of Judah, carrying shield and spear, six thousand eight hundred, equipped for battle;
verses.textLa: Filii Iuda portantes clypeum et hastam, sex millia octingenti expediti ad prælium.

verses.textEn: from the sons of Simeon, very strong men for the fight, seven thousand one hundred;
verses.textLa: De filiis Simeon virorum fortissimorum ad pugnandum, septem millia centum.

verses.textEn: from the sons of Levi, four thousand six hundred;
verses.textLa: De filiis Levi, quattuor millia sexcenti.

verses.textEn: as well as Jehoiada, a leader from the stock of Aaron, and with him three thousand seven hundred;
verses.textLa: Ioioda quoque princeps de stirpe Aaron, et cum eo tria millia septingenti.

verses.textEn: and then Zadok, a youth of distinguished qualities, and the house of his father, twenty-two leaders;
verses.textLa: Sadoc etiam puer egregiæ indolis, et domus patris eius, principes viginti duo.

verses.textEn: and from the sons of Benjamin, brothers of Saul, three thousand, for still a great part of them were following the house of Saul.
verses.textLa: De filiis autem Beniamin fratribus Saul, tria millia: magna enim pars eorum adhuc sequebatur domum Saul.

verses.textEn: Then from the sons of Ephraim, there were twenty thousand eight hundred, very strong and robust men, renowned among their kindred.
verses.textLa: Porro de filiis Ephraim viginti millia octingenti, fortissimi robore, viri nominati in cognationibus suis.

verses.textEn: And out of the one half tribe of Manasseh, eighteen thousand, each by their names, went forth so that they might appoint David as king.
verses.textLa: Et ex dimidia tribu Manasse, decem et octo millia, singuli per nomina sua venerunt ut constituerent regem David.

verses.textEn: Also, from the sons of Issachar, there were learned men, who knew each of the times, in order to anticipate what Israel ought to do, two hundred leaders. And all the remainder of the tribe were following their counsel.
verses.textLa: De filiis quoque Issachar viri eruditi, qui noverant singula tempora ad præcipiendum quid facere deberet Israel, principes ducenti: omnis autem reliqua tribus eorum consilium sequebatur.

verses.textEn: Then, from Zebulun, there were those who went forth to battle, and who were standing in a battle line, prepared with the weapons of warfare; these fifty thousand arrived to assist, without duplicity of heart.
verses.textLa: Porro de Zabulon qui egrediebantur ad prælium, et stabant in acie instructi armis bellicis, quinquaginta millia venerunt in auxilium, non in corde duplici.

verses.textEn: And from Naphtali, there were one thousand leaders; and with them were thirty-seven thousand, prepared with shield and spear.
verses.textLa: Et de Nephthali, principes mille: et cum eis instructi clypeo et hasta, triginta et septem millia.

verses.textEn: And then from Dan, there were twenty-eight thousand six hundred, ready for battle.
verses.textLa: De Dan etiam præparati ad prælium, viginti octo millia sexcenti.

verses.textEn: And from Asher, there were forty thousand, going forth to fight, and summoned to the battle line.
verses.textLa: Et de Aser egredientes ad pugnam, et in acie provocantes, quadraginta millia.

verses.textEn: Then, across the Jordan, there were, from the sons of Reuben, and from Gad, and from the one half tribe of Manasseh, one hundred twenty thousand, prepared with the weapons of warfare.
verses.textLa: Trans Iordanem autem de filiis Ruben, et de Gad, et dimidia parte tribus Manasse instructi armis bellicis, centum viginti millia.

verses.textEn: All these men of war, equipped for the fight, went with a perfect heart to Hebron, so that they might appoint David as king over all of Israel. Then, too, all the remainder of Israel were of one heart, so that they might make David king.
verses.textLa: Omnes isti viri bellatores expediti ad pugnandum, corde perfecto venerunt in Hebron, ut constituerent regem David super universum Israel: sed et omnes reliqui ex Israel, uno corde erant, ut rex fieret David.

verses.textEn: And they were in that place with David for three days, eating and drinking. For their brothers had made preparations for them.
verses.textLa: Fueruntque ibi apud David tribus diebus comedentes et bibentes. Præparaverant enim eis fratres sui.

verses.textEn: Moreover, those who were near to them, even as far as Issachar, and Zebulun, and Naphtali, were bringing, on donkeys and camels and mules and oxen, bread for their provisions, with grain, dried figs, dried grapes, wine, oil, and oxen and sheep, with all abundance. For indeed, there was joy in Israel.
verses.textLa: Sed et qui iuxta eos erant, usque ad Issachar, et Zabulon, et Nephthali, afferebant panes in asinis, et camelis, et mulis, et bobus ad vescendum: farinam, palathas, uvam passam, vinum, oleum, boves, arietes ad omnem copiam. Gaudium quippe erat in Israel.

verses.textEn: Then David took counsel with the tribunes, and the centurions, and all the leaders.
verses.textLa: Iniit autem consilium David cum tribunis, et centurionibus, et universis principibus,

verses.textEn: And he said to the entire assembly of Israel: “If it pleases you, and if the words that I speak come from the Lord our God, let us send to the remainder of our brothers, in all the regions of Israel, and to the priests and Levites who live in the suburbs of the cities, so that they may gather to us.
verses.textLa: et ait ad omnem cœtum Israel: Si placet vobis: et a Domino Deo nostro egreditur sermo, quem loquor: mittamus ad fratres nostros reliquos in universas regiones Israel, et ad Sacerdotes, et Levitas, qui habitant in suburbanis urbium, ut congregentur ad nos,

verses.textEn: And let us bring back the ark of our God to us. For we did not seek it during the days of Saul.”
verses.textLa: et reducamus arcam Dei nostri ad nos: non enim requisivimus eam in diebus Saul.

verses.textEn: And the entire multitude responded that it should be done. For the word had pleased all the people.
verses.textLa: Et respondit universa multitudo ut ita fieret: placuerat enim sermo omni populo.

verses.textEn: Therefore, David gathered all of Israel, from Shihor of Egypt even to the entrance of Hamath, so as to bring the ark of God from Kiriath-jearim.
verses.textLa: Congregavit ergo David cunctum Israel a Sihor Ægypti, usque dum ingrediaris Emath, ut adduceret arcam Dei de Cariathiarim.

verses.textEn: And David ascended with all the men of Israel to the hill of Kiriath-jearim, which is in Judah, so that he might bring from there the ark of the Lord God, sitting upon the Cherubim, where his name is invoked.
verses.textLa: Et ascendit David, et omnis vir Israel ad collem Cariathiarim, qui est in Iuda, ut afferret inde arcam Domini Dei sedentis super cherubim, ubi invocatum est nomen eius.

verses.textEn: And they placed the ark of God upon a new cart from the house of Abinadab. Then Uzzah and his brother drove the cart.
verses.textLa: Imposueruntque arcam Dei super plaustrum novum, de domo Abinadab: Oza autem, et frater eius minabant plaustrum.

verses.textEn: Now David and all of Israel were playing before God, with all of their ability, in songs, and with harps, and psalteries, and timbrels, and cymbals, and trumpets.
verses.textLa: Porro David, et universus Israel ludebant coram Deo omni virtute in canticis, et in citharis, et psalteriis, et tympanis, et cymbalis, et tubis.

verses.textEn: And when they had arrived at the threshing floor of Chidon, Uzzah reached out his hand, so that he might support the ark. For indeed, the ox being wanton had caused it to incline a little.
verses.textLa: Cum autem pervenisset ad Aream Chidon, tetendit Oza manum suam, ut sustentaret arcam: bos quippe lasciviens paululum inclinaverat eam.

verses.textEn: And so the Lord became angry against Uzzah. And he struck him down because he had touched the ark. And he died there before the Lord.
verses.textLa: Iratus est itaque Dominus contra Ozam, et percussit eum, eo quod tetigisset arcam: et mortuus est ibi coram Domino.

verses.textEn: And David was greatly saddened because the Lord had divided Uzzah. And he called that place ‘the Division of Uzzah,’ even to the present day.
verses.textLa: Contristatusque est David, eo quod divisisset Dominus Ozam: vocavitque locum illum: Divisio Ozæ usque in præsentem diem.

verses.textEn: And then he feared God, at that time, saying: “How will I be able to bring in the ark of God to myself?”
verses.textLa: Et timuit Deum tunc temporis, dicens: Quo modo possum ad me introducere arcam Dei?

verses.textEn: And for this reason, he did not bring it to himself, that is, into the City of David. Instead, he turned aside to the house of Obededom, the Gittite.
verses.textLa: Et ob hanc causam non adduxit eam ad se, hoc est, in Civitatem David, sed avertit in domum Obededom Gethæi.

verses.textEn: Therefore, the ark of God dwelt in the house of Obededom for three months. And the Lord blessed his house and all that he had.
verses.textLa: Mansit ergo arca Dei in domo Obededom tribus mensibus: et benedixit Dominus domui eius, et omnibus quæ habebat.

verses.textEn: Also, Hiram, the king of Tyre, sent messengers to David, and cedar wood, and artisans of walls and of wood, so that they might build a house for him.
verses.textLa: Misit quoque Hiram rex Tyri nuncios ad David, et ligna cedrina, et artifices parietum, lignorumque: ut ædificarent ei domum.

verses.textEn: And David realized that the Lord had confirmed him as king over Israel, and that his kingdom had been lifted up over his people Israel.
verses.textLa: Cognovitque David quod confirmasset eum Dominus in regem super Israel, et sublevatum esset regnum suum super populum eius Israel.

verses.textEn: Also, David took other wives in Jerusalem. And he conceived sons and daughters.
verses.textLa: Accepit quoque David alias uxores in Ierusalem: genuitque filios, et filias.

verses.textEn: And these are the names of those who were born to him in Jerusalem: Shammua and Shobab, Nathan and Solomon,
verses.textLa: Et hæc nomina eorum, qui nati sunt ei in Ierusalem: Samua, et Sobab, Nathan, et Salomon,

verses.textEn: Ibhar, and Elishua, and Elpelet,
verses.textLa: Iebahar, et Elisua, et Eliphalet,

verses.textEn: as well as Nogah, and Nepheg, and Japhia,
verses.textLa: Noga quoque, et Napheg, et Iaphia,

verses.textEn: Elishama, and Beeliada, and Eliphelet.
verses.textLa: Elisama, et Baaliada, et Eliphalet.

verses.textEn: Then, hearing that David had been anointed as king over all of Israel, all the Philistines ascended so that they might seek him. But when David had heard of it, he went out to meet them.
verses.textLa: Audientes autem Philisthiim eo quod unctus esset David regem super universum Israel, ascenderunt omnes ut quærerent eum: quod cum audisset David, egressus est obviam eis.

verses.textEn: Now the Philistines, arriving, spread out in the Valley of the Rephaim.
verses.textLa: Porro Philisthiim venientes, diffusi sunt in Valle Raphaim.

verses.textEn: And so David consulted the Lord, saying, “Shall I ascend to the Philistines, and will you deliver them into my hand?” And the Lord said to him, “Ascend, and I will deliver them into your hand.”
verses.textLa: Consuluitque David Dominum, dicens: Si ascendam ad Philisthæos, et si trades eos in manu mea? Et dixit ei Dominus: Ascende, et tradam eos in manu tua.

verses.textEn: And when they had ascended to Baal-perazim, David struck them there, and he said: “God has divided my enemies by my hand, just as waters are divided.” And therefore the name of that place was called Baal-perazim.
verses.textLa: Cumque illi ascendissent in Baalpharasim, percussit eos ibi David, et dixit: Divisit Deus inimicos meos per manum meam, sicut dividuntur aquæ: et idcirco vocatum est nomen illius loci Baalpharasim.

verses.textEn: And they left behind their gods in that place, and so David ordered them to be burned.
verses.textLa: Dereliqueruntque ibi deos suos, quos David iussit exuri.

verses.textEn: And then, at another time, the Philistines invaded, and they spread out in the valley.
verses.textLa: Alia etiam vice Philisthiim irruerunt, et diffusi sunt in valle.

verses.textEn: And again, David consulted God. And God said to him: “You shall not ascend after them. Draw away from them. And you shall come against them opposite the balsam trees.
verses.textLa: Consuluitque rursum David Deum, et dixit ei Deus: Non ascendas post eos, recede ab eis, et venies contra illos ex adverso pyrorum.

verses.textEn: And when you hear a sound approaching in the tops of the balsam trees, then you shall go forth to war. For God has gone forth before you, so that he may strike down the army of the Philistines.”
verses.textLa: Cumque audieris sonitum gradientis in cacumine pyrorum, tunc egredieris ad bellum. Egressus est enim Deus ante te, ut percutiat castra Philisthiim.

verses.textEn: Therefore, David did just as God had instructed him. And he struck down the army of the Philistines, from Gibeon as far as Gazera.
verses.textLa: Fecit ergo David sicut præceperat ei Deus, et percussit castra Philisthinorum, de Gabaon usque Gazera.

verses.textEn: And the name of David became well-known in all the regions. And the Lord placed the fear of him over all the nations.
verses.textLa: Divulgatumque est nomen David in universis regionibus, et Dominus dedit pavorem eius super omnes gentes.

verses.textEn: Also, he made houses for himself in the City of David. And built a place for the ark of God, and he set up a tent for it.
verses.textLa: Fecit quoque sibi domos in Civitate David: et ædificavit locum arcæ Dei, tetenditque ei tabernaculum.

verses.textEn: Then David said: “It is illicit for anyone to carry the ark of God except the Levites, whom the Lord chose to carry it and to minister to himself, even unto eternity.”
verses.textLa: Tunc dixit David: illicitum est ut a quocumque portetur arca Dei nisi a Levitis, quos elegit Dominus ad portandum eam, et ad ministrandum sibi usque in æternum.

verses.textEn: And he gathered all of Israel in Jerusalem, so that the ark of God might be brought into its place, which he had prepared for it.
verses.textLa: Congregavitque universum Israel in Ierusalem, ut afferretur arca Dei in locum suum, quem præparaverat ei.

verses.textEn: Certainly, there were both the sons of Aaron and the Levites:
verses.textLa: Necnon et filios Aaron, et Levitas:

verses.textEn: From the sons of Kohath, Uriel was the leader, and his brothers were one hundred twenty.
verses.textLa: De filiis Caath, Uriel princeps fuit, et fratres eius centum viginti.

verses.textEn: From the sons of Merari: Asaiah was the leader, and his brothers were two hundred twenty.
verses.textLa: De filiis Merari, Asaia princeps: et fratres eius ducenti viginti.

verses.textEn: From the sons of Gershom: Joel was the leader, and his brothers were one hundred thirty.
verses.textLa: De filiis Gersom, Ioel princeps; et fratres eius centum triginta.

verses.textEn: From the sons of Elizaphan: Shemaiah was the leader, and his brothers were two hundred.
verses.textLa: De filiis Elisaphan, Semeias princeps, et fratres eius ducenti.

verses.textEn: From the sons of Hebron: Eliel was the leader, and his brothers were eighty.
verses.textLa: De filiis Hebron, Eliel princeps; et fratres eius octoginta.

verses.textEn: From the sons of Uzziel: Amminadab was the leader, and his brothers were one hundred twelve.
verses.textLa: De filiis Oziel, Aminadab princeps: et fratres eius centum duodecim.

verses.textEn: And David summoned the priests, Zadok and Abiathar, and the Levites: Uriel, Asaiah, Joel, Shemaiah, Eliel, and Amminadab.
verses.textLa: Vocavitque David Sadoc, et Abiathar Sacerdotes, et Levitas, Uriel, Asaiam, Ioel, Semeiam, Eliel, et Aminadab:

verses.textEn: And he said to them: “You who are the leaders of the Levitical families, be sanctified with your brothers, and bring the ark of the Lord God of Israel to the place that has been prepared for it.
verses.textLa: et dixit ad eos: Vos qui estis principes familiarum Leviticarum, sanctificamini cum fratribus vestris, et afferte arcam Domini Dei Israel ad locum, qui ei præparatus est:

verses.textEn: Otherwise, as it was before, when the Lord struck us because you were not present, so also it might be now, if we do what is illicit.”
verses.textLa: ne ut a principio, quia non eratis præsentes, percussit nos Dominus; sic et nunc fiat, illicitum quid nobis agentibus.

verses.textEn: Therefore, the priests and the Levites were sanctified, so that they might carry the ark of the Lord God of Israel.
verses.textLa: Sanctificati sunt ergo Sacerdotes, et Levitæ, ut portarent arcam Domini Dei Israel.

verses.textEn: And the sons of Levi took the ark of God, just as Moses had instructed, in accord with the word of the Lord, upon their shoulders by the bars.
verses.textLa: Et tulerunt filii Levi arcam Dei, sicut præceperat Moyses iuxta verbum Domini humeris suis in vectibus.

verses.textEn: And David spoke to the leaders of the Levites, so that they might appoint, from their brothers, singers with musical instruments, specifically, psalteries, and harps, and cymbals, so that a joyful noise might resound on high.
verses.textLa: Dixitque David principibus Levitarum, ut constituerent de fratribus suis cantores in organis musicorum, nablis videlicet, et lyris, et cymbalis, ut resonaret in excelsis sonitus lætitiæ.

verses.textEn: And they appointed from the Levites: Heman, the son of Joel; and from his brothers, Asaph, the son of Berechiah; and truly, from their brothers, the sons of Merari: Ethan, the son of Kushaiah.
verses.textLa: Constitueruntque Levitas: Heman filium Ioel, et de fratribus eius Asaph filium Barachiæ: de filiis vero Merari, fratribus eorum: Ethan filium Casaiæ.

verses.textEn: And with them were their brothers in the second rank: Zechariah, and Ben, and Jaaziel, and Shemiramoth, and Jahiel, and Unni, and Eliab, and Benaiah, and Maaseiah, and Mattithiah, and Eliphelehu, and Mikneiah, and Obededom, and Jeiel, who were gatekeepers.
verses.textLa: Et cum eis fratres eorum: in secundo ordine, Zachariam, et Ben, et Iaziel, et Semiramoth, et Iahiel, et Ani, Eliab, et Banaiam, et Maasiam, et Mathathiam, et Eliphalu, et Maceniam, et Obededom, et Iehiel, ianitores.

verses.textEn: Now the singers, Heman, Asaph, and Ethan, were sounding out with cymbals of brass.
verses.textLa: Porro cantores, Heman, Asaph, et Ethan; in cymbalis æneis concrepantes.

verses.textEn: And Zechariah, and Aziel, and Shemiramoth, and Jehiel, and Unni, and Eliab, and Maaseiah, and Benaiah were singing mysteries with the psalteries.
verses.textLa: Zacharias autem, et Oziel, et Semiramoth, et Iahiel, et Ani, et Eliab, et Maasias, et Banaias in nablis arcana cantabant.

verses.textEn: Then Mattithiah, and Eliphelehu, and Mikneiah and Obededom, and Jeiel and Azaziah were singing a song of victory with the harps, for the octave.
verses.textLa: Porro Mathathias, et Eliphalu, et Macenias, et Obededom, et Iehiel, et Ozaziu, in citharis pro octava canebant epinicion.

verses.textEn: Now Chenaniah, the leader of the Levites, was foremost over the prophecies, in order to mark out in advance the melodies. For indeed, he was very skillful.
verses.textLa: Chonenias autem princeps Levitarum, prophetiæ præerat, ad præcinendam melodiam: erat quippe valde sapiens.
verses.notes: The word ‘præcinendam’ can refer to a prediction, but in this context it means that he wrote out the musical notes in advance. This verse indicates that the ancient Israelites had some form of written musical notation, perhaps similar to what the Greek or Arabic peoples of that time used. Few musicians in that day had knowledge of written music at all, which is why he is called very skillful.

verses.textEn: And Berechiah and Elkanah were porters of the ark.
verses.textLa: Et Barachias, et Elcana: ianitores arcæ.

verses.textEn: And the priests, Shebaniah, and Joshaphat, and Nethanel, and Amasai, and Zechariah, and Benaiah, and Eliezer, were sounding the trumpets before the ark of God. And Obededom and Jehiah were porters of the ark.
verses.textLa: Porro Sebenias, et Iosaphat, et Nathanael, et Amasai, et Zacharias, et Banaias, et Eliezer sacerdotes, clangebant tubis coram arca Dei: et Obededom et Iehias erant ianitores arcæ.

verses.textEn: Therefore, David, and all those greater by birth of Israel, and the tribunes, went to carry the ark of the covenant of the Lord from the house of Obededom with rejoicing.
verses.textLa: Igitur David et omnes maiores natu Israel, et tribuni ierunt ad deportandam arcam fœderis Domini de domo Obededom cum lætitia.

verses.textEn: And when God had assisted the Levites, who were carrying the ark of the covenant of the Lord, they immolated seven bulls and seven rams.
verses.textLa: Cumque adiuvisset Deus Levitas, qui portabant arcam fœderis Domini, immolabantur septem tauri, et septem arietes.

verses.textEn: Now David was clothed with a robe of fine linen, as were all the Levites who were carrying the ark, and the singers, and Chenaniah, the leader of the prophecy among the singers. But David was also clothed with a linen ephod.
verses.textLa: Porro David erat indutus stola byssina, et universi Levitæ qui portabant arcam, cantoresque et Chonenias princeps prophetiæ inter cantores: David autem etiam indutus erat ephod lineo.

verses.textEn: And all of Israel were leading back the ark of the covenant of the Lord with jubilation, sounding out with the noise of horns, and trumpets, and cymbals, and psalteries, and harps.
verses.textLa: Universusque Israel deducebant arcam fœderis Domini in iubilo, et sonitu buccinæ, et tubis, et cymbalis, et nablis, et citharis concrepantes.

verses.textEn: And when the ark of the covenant of the Lord had arrived in the City of David, Michal, the daughter of Saul, gazing through a window, saw king David dancing and playing, and she despised him in her heart.
verses.textLa: Cumque pervenisset arca fœderis Domini usque ad Civitatem David, Michol filia Saul prospiciens per fenestram, vidit regem David saltantem atque ludentem, et despexit eum in corde suo.

verses.textEn: And so they took the ark of God, and they set it in the midst of the tabernacle, which David had pitched for it. And they offered holocausts and peace offerings before God.
verses.textLa: Attulerunt igitur arcam Dei, et constituerunt eam in medio tabernaculi, quod tetenderat ei David: et obtulerunt holocausta, et pacifica coram Deo.

verses.textEn: And when David had completed offering holocausts and peace offerings, he blessed the people in the name of the Lord.
verses.textLa: Cumque complesset David offerens holocausta, et pacifica, benedixit populo in nomine Domini.

verses.textEn: And he divided to every single one, from men even to women, a twist of bread, and a piece of roasted beef, and fine wheat flour fried with oil.
verses.textLa: Et divisit universis per singulos, a viro usque ad mulierem tortam panis, et partem assæ carnis bubalæ, et frixam oleo similam.

verses.textEn: And he appointed some from the Levites who would minister before the ark of the Lord, and commemorate his works, and glorify and praise the Lord, the God of Israel.
verses.textLa: Constituitque coram arca Domini de Levitis, qui ministrarent, et recordarentur operum eius, et glorificarent, atque laudarent Dominum Deum Israel:

verses.textEn: Asaph was the leader, and second to him was Zechariah. In addition, there were Jeiel, and Shemiramoth, and Jehiel, and Mattithiah, and Eliab, and Benaiah, and Obededom. And Jeiel was over the instruments of the psaltery and the harps. But Asaph sounded out with the cymbals.
verses.textLa: Asaph principem, et secundum eius Zachariam: Porro Iahiel, et Semiramoth, et Iehiel, et Mathathiam, et Eliab, et Banaiam, et Obededom: Iehiel super organa psalterii, et lyras: Asaph autem ut cymbalis personaret;

verses.textEn: Truly, the priests, Benaiah and Jahaziel, were to sound the trumpet continually before the ark of the covenant of the Lord.
verses.textLa: Banaiam vero, et Iaziel sacerdotes, canere tuba iugiter coram arca fœderis Domini.

verses.textEn: In that day, David made Asaph the leader, in order to confess to the Lord with his brothers:
verses.textLa: In illo die fecit David principem ad confitendum Domino Asaph, et fratres eius.

verses.textEn: “Confess to the Lord, and invoke his name. Make known his endeavors among the peoples.
verses.textLa: Confitemini Domino, et invocate nomen eius: notas facite in populis adinventiones eius.

verses.textEn: Sing to him, and sing psalms to him, and describe all his miracles.
verses.textLa: Cantate ei, et psallite ei: et narrate omnia mirabilia eius.

verses.textEn: Praise his holy name! Let the heart of those who seek the Lord rejoice!
verses.textLa: Laudate nomen sanctum eius: lætetur cor quærentium Dominum.

verses.textEn: Seek the Lord and his virtue. Seek his face always.
verses.textLa: Quærite Dominum, et virtutem eius: quærite faciem eius semper.

verses.textEn: Remember his miracles, which he has accomplished, his signs, and the judgments of his mouth.
verses.textLa: Recordamini mirabilium eius quæ fecit: signorum illius, et iudiciorum oris eius.

verses.textEn: O offspring of Israel, his servants! O sons of Jacob, his elect!
verses.textLa: Semen Israel servi eius: filii Iacob electi eius.

verses.textEn: He is the Lord our God. His judgments are throughout all the earth.
verses.textLa: Ipse Dominus Deus noster: in universa terra iudicia eius.

verses.textEn: Remember forever his covenant, the word that he instructed unto a thousand generations,
verses.textLa: Recordamini in sempiternum pacti eius: sermonis, quem præcepit in mille generationes.

verses.textEn: the covenant that he formed with Abraham, and his oath with Isaac.
verses.textLa: Quem pepigit cum Abraham: et iuramenti illius cum Isaac.

verses.textEn: And he appointed the same to Jacob as a precept, and to Israel as an everlasting pact,
verses.textLa: Et constituit illud Iacob in præceptum: et Israel in pactum sempiternum,

verses.textEn: saying: ‘To you, I will give the land of Canaan, the lot of your inheritance.’
verses.textLa: dicens: Tibi dabo Terram Chanaan, funiculum hereditatis vestræ.

verses.textEn: At that time, they were small in number, they were few and were settlers there.
verses.textLa: Cum essent pauci numero, parvi et coloni eius.

verses.textEn: And they passed through, from nation to nation, and from one kingdom to another people.
verses.textLa: Et transierunt de gente in gentem, et de regno ad populum alterum.

verses.textEn: He did not permit anyone to falsely accuse them. Instead, he reproved kings on their behalf:
verses.textLa: Non dimisit quemquam calumniari eos, sed increpavit pro eis reges.

verses.textEn: ‘Do not touch my Christ. And do not malign my prophets.’
verses.textLa: Nolite tangere Christos meos: et in prophetis meis nolite malignari.
verses.notes: The Israelites are called Christ in that they were chosen by God to prepare for the Christ.

verses.textEn: Sing to the Lord, all the earth! Announce his salvation, from day to day.
verses.textLa: Cantate Domino omnis terra, annunciate ex die in diem salutare eius.

verses.textEn: Describe his glory among the Gentiles, his miracles among all the peoples.
verses.textLa: Narrate in gentibus gloriam eius: in cunctis populis mirabilia eius.

verses.textEn: For the Lord is great and exceedingly praiseworthy. And he is terrible, above all gods.
verses.textLa: Quia magnus Dominus, et laudabilis nimis: et horribilis super omnes deos.

verses.textEn: For all the gods of the peoples are idols. But the Lord made the heavens.
verses.textLa: Omnes enim dii populorum, idola: Dominus autem cælos fecit.

verses.textEn: Confession and magnificence are before him. Strength and gladness are in his place.
verses.textLa: Confessio et magnificentia coram eo: fortitudo et gaudium in loco eius.

verses.textEn: Bring to the Lord, O families of the peoples, bring to the Lord glory and dominion.
verses.textLa: Afferte Domino familiæ populorum: afferte Domino gloriam et imperium.

verses.textEn: Give glory to the Lord, to his name. Lift up sacrifice, and approach before his sight. And adore the Lord in holy attire.
verses.textLa: Date Domino gloriam, nomini eius, levate sacrificium, et venite in conspectu eius: et adorate Dominum in decore sancto.

verses.textEn: Let all the earth be moved before his face. For he founded the globe immoveable.
verses.textLa: Commoveatur a facie eius omnis terra: ipse enim fundavit orbem immobilem.

verses.textEn: Let the heavens rejoice, and let the earth exult. And let them say among the nations, ‘The Lord has reigned.’
verses.textLa: Lætentur cæli, et exultet terra: et dicant in nationibus, Dominus regnavit.

verses.textEn: Let the sea roar, with all its plenitude. Let the fields exult, with all that is in them.
verses.textLa: Tonet mare, et plenitudo eius: exultent agri, et omnia quæ in eis sunt.

verses.textEn: Then the trees of the forest will give praise before the Lord. For he comes to judge the earth.
verses.textLa: Tunc laudabunt ligna saltus coram Domino: quia venit iudicare terram.

verses.textEn: Confess to the Lord, for he is good. For his mercy is eternal.
verses.textLa: Confitemini Domino, quoniam bonus: quoniam in æternum misericordia eius.

verses.textEn: And say: ‘Save us, O God our savior! And gather us together, and rescue us from the nations, so that we may confess to your holy name, and may exult in your songs.
verses.textLa: Et dicite: Salva nos Deus salvator noster; et congrega nos, et erue de gentibus, ut confiteamur nomini sancto tuo, et exultemus in carminibus tuis.

verses.textEn: Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel, from eternity to eternity.’ And let all the people say, ‘Amen,’ and let them sing a hymn to the Lord.”
verses.textLa: Benedictus Dominus Deus Israel ab æterno usque in æternum: et dicat omnis populo: Amen, et hymnum Domino.
verses.notes: The 1590 Sixtine Vulgate has ‘sing a hymn to God.’

verses.textEn: And so, there before the ark of the covenant of the Lord, he left Asaph and his brothers, so that they might minister in the sight of the ark continually, throughout each day, and in their turns.
verses.textLa: Reliquit itaque ibi coram arca fœderis Domini Asaph, et fratres eius, ut ministrarent in conspectu arcæ iugiter per singulos dies, et vices suas.

verses.textEn: Now Obededom and his brothers were sixty-eight. And he appointed Obededom, the son of Jeduthun, and Hosah to be porters.
verses.textLa: Porro Obededom, et fratres eius sexaginta octo; et Obededom filium Idithun, et Hosa constituit ianitores.

verses.textEn: But Zadok the priest, and his brothers the priests, were before the tabernacle of the Lord in the high place, which was in Gibeon,
verses.textLa: Sadoc autem sacerdotem, et fratres eius sacerdotes, coram tabernaculo Domini in excelso, quod erat in Gabaon,

verses.textEn: so that they could offer holocausts to the Lord upon the altar of holocausts continually, morning and evening, according to all that was written in the law of the Lord, which he instructed to Israel.
verses.textLa: ut offerrent holocausta Domino super altare holocautomatis iugiter, mane et vespere, iuxta omnia quæ scripta sunt in lege Domini, quam præcepit Israeli.

verses.textEn: And after him, Heman, and Jeduthun, and the remainder of the elect, each one by his name, were appointed to confess to the Lord: “For his mercy endures forever.”
verses.textLa: Et post eum Heman, et Idithun, et reliquos electos, unumquemque vocabulo suo ad confitendum Domino: Quoniam in æternum misericordia eius.

verses.textEn: Also Heman and Jeduthun sounded the trumpet, and they played upon the cymbals, and upon every kind of musical instrument, in order to sing praises to God. But the sons of Jeduthun he made to be porters.
verses.textLa: Heman quoque, et Idithun canentes tuba, et quatientes cymbala, et omnia musicorum organa ad canendum Deo; filios autem Idithun fecit esse portarios.

verses.textEn: And all the people returned to their houses, and David also, so that he might bless his own house too.
verses.textLa: Reversusque est omnis populus in domum suam: et David, ut benediceret etiam domui suæ.

verses.textEn: Now when David was living in his house, he said to the prophet Nathan: “Behold, I live in a house of cedar. But the ark of the covenant of the Lord is under tent skins.”
verses.textLa: Cum autem habitaret David in domo sua, dixit ad Nathan prophetam: Ecce ego habito in domo cedrina: arca autem fœderis Domini sub pellibus est.

verses.textEn: And Nathan said to David: “Do all that is in your heart. For God is with you.”
verses.textLa: Et ait Nathan ad David: Omnia, quæ in corde tuo sunt, fac: Deus enim tecum est.

verses.textEn: And yet, that night the word of God came to Nathan, saying:
verses.textLa: Igitur nocte illa factus est sermo Dei ad Nathan, dicens:

verses.textEn: “Go, and speak to my servant David: Thus says the Lord: You shall not build a house for me as a dwelling place.
verses.textLa: Vade, et loquere David servo meo: Hæc dicit Dominus: Non ædificabis tu mihi domum ad habitandum.

verses.textEn: For I have not stayed in a house from the time when I led out Israel, even to this day. Instead, I have been continually changing places, in a tabernacle and tent,
verses.textLa: Neque enim mansi in domo ex eo tempore, quo eduxi Israel, usque ad diem hanc: sed fui semper mutans loca tabernaculi, et in tentorio

verses.textEn: dwelling with all of Israel. When did I ever speak to any one at all, among the judges of Israel whom I placed in charge so that they might pasture my people, saying: ‘Why have you not built a house of cedar for me?’
verses.textLa: manens cum omni Israel. Numquid locutus sum saltem uni Iudicum Israel, quibus præceperam, ut pascerent populum meum, et dixi: Quare non ædificastis mihi domum cedrinam?

verses.textEn: And so, now you shall say this to my servant David: Thus says the Lord of hosts: I took you when you were following the flock in the pastures, so that you would be the leader of my people Israel.
verses.textLa: Nunc itaque sic loqueris ad servum meum David: Hæc dicit Dominus exercituum: Ego tuli te, cum in pascuis sequereris gregem, ut esses dux populi mei Israel.

verses.textEn: And I have been with you wherever you have gone. And I have slain all your enemies before you, and I have made a name for you like one of the great ones who are celebrated upon the earth.
verses.textLa: Et fui tecum quocumque perrexisti: et interfeci omnes inimicos tuos coram te, fecique tibi nomen quasi unius magnorum, qui celebrantur in terra.

verses.textEn: And I have given a place to my people Israel. They shall be planted, and they shall live in it, and they shall no longer be moved. Neither shall the sons of iniquity wear them away, as in the beginning,
verses.textLa: Et dedi locum populo meo Israel: plantabitur, et habitabit in eo, et ultra non commovebitur: nec filii iniquitatis atterent eos, sicut a principio,

verses.textEn: from the days when I gave judges to my people Israel, and I humbled all your enemies. Therefore, I announce to you that the Lord will build a house for you.
verses.textLa: ex diebus quibus dedi iudices populo meo Israel, et humiliavi universos inimicos tuos. Annuncio ergo tibi, quod ædificaturus sit tibi Dominus domum.

verses.textEn: And when you will have completed your days, so that you go to your fathers, I will raise up your offspring after you, who shall be from your sons. And I will establish his kingdom.
verses.textLa: Cumque impleveris dies tuos ut vadas ad patres tuos, suscitabo semen tuum post te, quod erit de filiis tuis: et stabiliam regnum eius.

verses.textEn: He shall build a house for me, and I will make firm his throne, even unto eternity.
verses.textLa: Ipse ædificabit mihi domum, et firmabo solium eius usque in æternum.

verses.textEn: I will be a father to him, and he shall be a son to me. And I will not take away my mercy from him, as I took it away from the one who was before you.
verses.textLa: Ego ero ei in patrem, et ipse erit mihi in filium: et misericordiam meam non auferam ab eo, sicut abstuli ab eo, qui ante te fuit.

verses.textEn: And I will station him in my house and in my kingdom, even forever. And his throne will be very firm, in perpetuity.”
verses.textLa: Et statuam eum in domo mea, et in regno meo usque in sempiternum: et thronus eius erit firmissimus in perpetuum.

verses.textEn: According to all these words, and according to this entire vision, so did Nathan speak to David.
verses.textLa: Iuxta omnia verba hæc, et iuxta universam visionem istam, sic locutus est Nathan ad David.

verses.textEn: And when king David had departed, and had sat down before the Lord, he said: “Who am I, O Lord God, and what is my house, that you would grant such things to me?
verses.textLa: Cumque venisset rex David, et sedisset coram Domino, dixit: Quis ego sum Domine Deus, et quæ domus mea, ut præstares mihi talia?

verses.textEn: But even this has seemed little in your sight, and therefore you have also spoken about the house of your servant even for the future. And you have made me a spectacle above all men, O Lord God.
verses.textLa: Sed et hoc parum visum est in conspectu tuo, ideoque locutus es super domum servi tui etiam in futurum: et fecisti me spectabilem super omnes homines Domine Deus.

verses.textEn: What more can David add, since you have so glorified your servant, and have known him?
verses.textLa: Quid ultra addere potest David, cum ita glorificaveris servum tuum, et cognoveris eum?

verses.textEn: O Lord, because of your servant, in accord with your own heart, you have brought about all this magnificence, and you have willed all these great things to be known.
verses.textLa: Domine, propter famulum tuum iuxta cor tuum fecisti omnem magnificentiam hanc, et nota esse voluisti universa magnalia.

verses.textEn: O Lord, there is no one like you. And there is no other God apart from you, out of all whom we have heard about with our ears.
verses.textLa: Domine, non est similis tui: et non est alius Deus absque te, ex omnibus, quos audivimus auribus nostris.

verses.textEn: For what other single nation upon earth is like your people Israel, to whom God reached out, so that he might free them, and might make a people for himself, and by his greatness and terribleness cast out the nations before the face of those whom he had freed from Egypt?
verses.textLa: Quis enim est alius, ut populus tuus Israel, gens una in terra, ad quam perrexit Deus, ut liberaret, et faceret populum sibi, et magnitudine sua atque terroribus eiiceret nationes a facie eius, quem de Ægypto liberarat?

verses.textEn: And you have set your people Israel to be your people, even unto eternity. And you, O Lord, have become their God.
verses.textLa: Et posuisti populum tuum Israel tibi in populum usque in æternum, et tu Domine factus es Deus eius.

verses.textEn: Now therefore, O Lord, let the word that you have spoken to your servant, and over his house, be confirmed in perpetuity, and do just as you have spoken.
verses.textLa: Nunc igitur Domine, sermo, quem locutus es famulo tuo, et super domum eius, confirmetur in perpetuum, et fac sicut locutus es.

verses.textEn: And may your name remain and be magnified even for all time. And let it be said: ‘The Lord of hosts is the God of Israel. And the house of his servant David remains forever before him.’
verses.textLa: Permaneatque et magnificetur nomen tuum usque in sempiternum: et dicatur: Dominus exercituum Deus Israel, et domus David servi eius permanens coram eo.

verses.textEn: For you, O Lord my God, have revealed to the ear of your servant that you will build a house for him. And therefore your servant has found faith so that he might pray before you.
verses.textLa: Tu enim Domine Deus meus revelasti auriculam servi tui, ut ædificares ei domum: et idcirco invenit servus tuus fiduciam, ut oret coram te.

verses.textEn: Now then, O Lord, you are God. And you have spoken to your servant such great benefits.
verses.textLa: Nunc ergo Domine tu es Deus: et locutus es ad servum tuum tanta beneficia.

verses.textEn: And you have begun to bless the house of your servant, so that it may be always before you. For since it is you who is blessing, O Lord, it shall be blessed forever.”
verses.textLa: Et cœpisti benedicere domui servi tui, ut sit semper coram te: te enim Domine benedicente, benedicta erit in perpetuum.

verses.textEn: Now after these things, it happened that David struck the Philistines, and he humbled them, and he took Gath and her daughters from the hand of the Philistines.
verses.textLa: Factum est autem post hæc, ut percuteret David Philisthiim, et humiliaret eos, et tolleret Geth, et filias eius de manu Philisthiim,

verses.textEn: And he struck Moab. And the Moabites became the servants of David, offering gifts to him.
verses.textLa: percuteretque Moab, et fierent Moabitæ servi David, offerentes ei munera.

verses.textEn: In that time, David also struck Hadadezer, the king of Zobah, in the region of Hamath, when he went forth so that he might extend his dominion as far as the river Euphrates.
verses.textLa: Eo tempore percussit David etiam Adarezer regem Soba regionis Hemath, quando perrexit ut dilataret imperium suum usque ad flumen Euphraten.

verses.textEn: Then David seized one thousand of his four-horse chariots, and seven thousand horsemen, and twenty thousand men on foot. And he hamstrung all the chariot horses, except for one hundred four-horse chariots, which he reserved for himself.
verses.textLa: Cepit ergo David mille quadrigas eius, et septem millia equitum, ac viginti millia virorum peditum, subnervavitque omnes equos curruum, exceptis centum quadrigis, quas reservavit sibi.
verses.notes: When compared to 2 Samuel 8:4, the number of horsemen does not agree. This might be a typographical error in certain manuscripts, or there might be an explanation such that one number is true in one sense, and the other number is true in another sense.

verses.textEn: Then the Syrians of Damascus also arrived, so that they might offer assistance to Hadadezer, the king of Zobah. And so, David then struck of them twenty-two thousand men.
verses.textLa: Supervenit autem et Syrus Damascenus, ut auxilium præberet Adarezer regi Soba: sed et huius percussit David vigintiduo millia virorum.

verses.textEn: And he stationed soldiers in Damascus, so that Syria also would serve him, and would offer gifts. And the Lord assisted him in all the things to which he went forth.
verses.textLa: Et posuit milites in Damasco, ut Syria quoque serviret sibi, et offerret munera. Adiuvitque eum Dominus in cunctis, ad quæ perrexerat.

verses.textEn: Also, David took the golden quivers, which the servants of Hadadezer had, and he brought them to Jerusalem.
verses.textLa: Tulit quoque David pharetras aureas, quas habuerant servi Adarezer, et attulit eas in Ierusalem.

verses.textEn: In addition, from Tibhath and Cun, cities of Hadadezer, he brought very much brass, from which Solomon made the sea of brass, and the pillars, and the vessels of brass.
verses.textLa: Necnon de Thebath, et Chun urbibus Adarezer æris plurimum, de quo fecit Salomon mare æneum, et columnas, et vasa ænea.

verses.textEn: Now when Toi, the king of Hamath, had heard this, specifically that David had struck the entire army of Hadadezer, the king of Zobah,
verses.textLa: Quod cum audisset Thou rex Hemath, percussisse videlicet David omnem exercitum Adarezer regis Soba,

verses.textEn: he sent his son Hadoram to king David so that he might petition peace from him, and so that he might congratulate him that he had struck and defeated Hadadezer. For indeed, Toi was an adversary to Hadadezer.
verses.textLa: misit Adoram filium suum ad regem David, ut postularet ab eo pacem, et congratularetur ei quod percussisset, et expugnasset Adarezer: adversarius quippe erat Thou Adarezer.

verses.textEn: Moreover, all the vessels of gold and silver and brass king David consecrated to the Lord, with the silver and gold that he had taken from all the nations, as much from Idumea, and Moab, and the sons of Ammon, as from the Philistines and Amalek.
verses.textLa: Sed et omnia vasa aurea, et argentea, et ænea consecravit David rex Domino, cum argento et auro, quod tulerat ex universis gentibus, tam de Idumæa, et Moab, et filiis Ammon, quam de Philisthiim et Amalec.

verses.textEn: Truly, Abishai, the son of Zeruiah, struck eighteen thousand of the Edomites in the Valley of the Salt Pits.
verses.textLa: Abisai vero filius Sarviæ percussit Edom in Valle Salinarum, decem et octo millia:

verses.textEn: And he stationed a garrison in Edom, so that Idumea would serve David. And the Lord saved David in all the things to which he went forth.
verses.textLa: et constituit in Edom præsidium, ut serviret Idumæa David: salvavitque Dominus David in cunctis, ad quæ perrexerat.

verses.textEn: Therefore, David reigned over all of Israel, and he executed judgment and justice among all his people.
verses.textLa: Regnavit ergo David super universum Israel, et faciebat iudicium atque iustitiam cuncto populo suo.

verses.textEn: Now Joab, the son of Zeruiah, was over the army, and Jehoshaphat, the son of Ahilud, was the keeper of records.
verses.textLa: Porro Ioab filius Sarviæ erat super exercitum, et Iosaphat filius Ahilud a commentariis.

verses.textEn: And Zadok, the son of Ahitub, and Ahimelech, the son of Abiathar, were the priests. And Shavsha was the scribe.
verses.textLa: Sadoc autem filius Achitob, et Ahimelech, filius Abiathar, sacerdotes: et Susa, scriba.

verses.textEn: Also, Benaiah, the son of Jehoiada, was over the legions of the Cherethites and Pelethites. But the sons of David were first at the hand of the king.
verses.textLa: Banaias quoque filius Ioiadæ super legiones Cerethi, et Phelethi: porro filii David, primi ad manum regis.

verses.textEn: Now it happened that Nahash, the king of the sons of Ammon, died, and his son reigned in his place.
verses.textLa: Accidit autem ut moreretur Naas rex filiorum Ammon, et regnaret filius eius pro eo.

verses.textEn: And David said: “I will act with mercy toward Hanun, the son of Nahash. For his father was gracious to me.” And so David sent messengers to console him over the death of his father. But when they had reached the land of the sons of Ammon, so that they might console Hanun,
verses.textLa: Dixitque David: Faciam misericordiam cum Hanon filio Naas: præstitit enim mihi pater eius gratiam. Misitque David nuncios ad consolandum eum super morte patris sui. Qui cum pervenissent in terram filiorum Ammon, ut consolarentur Hanon,

verses.textEn: the leaders of the sons of Ammon said to Hanun: “Do you think that perhaps David has sent them to console you in order to honor your father? Have you not noticed that his servants came to you so that they might explore, and investigate, and examine your land?”
verses.textLa: dixerunt principes filiorum Ammon ad Hanon: Tu forsitan putas, quod David honoris causa in patrem tuum miserit qui consolentur te? Nec animadvertis quod ut explorent, et investigent, et scrutentur terram tuam, venerint ad te servi eius?

verses.textEn: And so Hanun shaved the heads and beards of the servants of David, and he cut away their tunics from the buttocks to the feet, and he sent them away.
verses.textLa: Igitur Hanon pueros David decalvavit, et rasit, et præcidit tunicas eorum a natibus usque ad pedes, et dimisit eos.

verses.textEn: And when they had gone, and had sent word to David, (for they had suffered a great disgrace,) he sent to meet them, and he instructed them that they should remain at Jericho until their beards grew, and then they should return.
verses.textLa: Qui cum abiissent, et hoc mandassent David, misit in occursum eorum (grandem enim contumeliam sustinuerant) et præcepit ut manerent in Iericho, donec cresceret barba eorum, et tunc reverterentur.
