verses.textEn: Then, when the sons of Ammon realized that they had committed an injury against David, both Hanun and the rest of the people sent one thousand talents of silver, so that they might hire for themselves chariots and horsemen from Mesopotamia, and from Syrian Maacah, and from Zobah.
verses.textLa: Videntes autem filii Ammon, quod iniuriam fecissent David, tam Hanon, quam reliquus populus, miserunt mille talenta argenti, ut conducerent sibi de Mesopotamia, et de Syria Maacha, et de Soba currus et equites.

verses.textEn: And they hired thirty-two thousand chariots, and the king of Maacah with his people. When these had arrived, they made camp in the region opposite Medeba. Also, the sons of Ammon, gathering from their cities, went to war.
verses.textLa: Conduxeruntque triginta duo millia curruum, et regem Maacha cum populo eius. Qui cum venissent, castrametati sunt e regione Medaba. Filii quoque Ammon congregati de urbibus suis, venerunt ad bellum.

verses.textEn: And when David had heard this, he sent Joab and the entire army of strong men.
verses.textLa: Quod cum audisset David, misit Ioab, et omnem exercitum virorum fortium:

verses.textEn: And the sons of Ammon, going out, set up a battle line before the gate of the city. But the kings who had come to their aid stood separately in the field.
verses.textLa: egressique filii Ammon, direxerunt aciem iuxta portam civitatis: reges autem, qui ad auxilium eius venerant, separatim in agro steterunt.

verses.textEn: And so Joab, understanding the war to be set facing him and behind his back, chose the strongest men from all of Israel, and he went out against the Syrians.
verses.textLa: Igitur Ioab intelligens bellum ex adverso, et post tergum contra se fieri, elegit viros fortissimos de universo Israel, et perrexit contra Syrum.

verses.textEn: But the remaining portion of the people he placed under the hand of his brother Abishai. And they went out against the sons of Ammon.
verses.textLa: Reliquam autem partem populi dedit sub manu Abisai fratris sui; et perrexerunt contra filios Ammon.

verses.textEn: And he said: “If the Syrians prevail over me, then you shall be a help to me. But if the sons of Ammon prevail over you, I will be a safeguard for you.
verses.textLa: Dixitque: Si vicerit me Syrus, auxilio eris mihi: si autem superaverint te filii Ammon, ero tibi in præsidium.

verses.textEn: Be strengthened, and let us act manfully on behalf of our people, and on behalf of the cities of our God. And the Lord will do what is good in his own sight.”
verses.textLa: Confortare, et agamus viriliter pro populo nostro, et pro urbibus Dei nostri: Dominus autem quod in conspectu suo bonum est, faciet.

verses.textEn: Therefore, Joab, and the people who were with him, went out to battle against the Syrians. And he put them to flight.
verses.textLa: Perrexit ergo Ioab, et populus qui cum eo erat, contra Syrum ad prælium: et fugavit eos.

verses.textEn: Then the sons of Ammon, seeing that the Syrians had fled, also themselves fled from Abishai, his brother, and they entered into the city. And now Joab returned to Jerusalem.
verses.textLa: Porro filii Ammon videntes quod fugisset Syrus, ipsi quoque fugerunt Abisai fratrem eius, et ingressi sunt civitatem: reversusque est etiam Ioab in Ierusalem.

verses.textEn: But the Syrians, seeing that they had fallen before Israel, sent messengers, and they brought the Syrians who were across the river. And Shophach, the leader of the military of Hadadezer, was their commander.
verses.textLa: Videns autem Syrus quod cecidisset coram Israel, misit nuncios, et adduxit Syrum, qui erat trans fluvium: Sophach autem princeps militiæ Adarezer, erat dux eorum.

verses.textEn: When this had been reported to David, he gathered together all of Israel, and he crossed the Jordan. And he rushed toward them. And he set up a battle line facing them. And they fought against him.
verses.textLa: Quod cum nunciatum esset David, congregavit universum Israel, et transivit Iordanem, irruitque in eos, et direxit ex adverso aciem, illis contra pugnantibus.

verses.textEn: But the Syrians fled from Israel. And David killed of the Syrians seven thousand chariots, and forty thousand men on foot, and Shophach, the leader of the army.
verses.textLa: Fugit autem Syrus Israel: et interfecit David de Syris septem millia curruum, et quadraginta millia peditum, et Sophach exercitus principem.

verses.textEn: Then the servants of Hadadezer, seeing themselves to be overwhelmed by Israel, crossed over to David, and they served him. And Syria was no longer willing to offer aid to the sons of Ammon.
verses.textLa: Videntes autem servi Adarezer se ab Israel esse superatos, transfugerunt ad David, et servierunt ei: noluitque ultra Syria auxilium præbere filiis Ammon.

verses.textEn: Now it happened that, after the course of a year, in the time when kings usually go forth to war, Joab gathered an army with experienced soldiers, and he laid waste to the land of the sons of Ammon. And he continued on and besieged Rabbah. But David was staying in Jerusalem when Joab struck Rabbah and destroyed it.
verses.textLa: Factum est autem post anni circulum, eo tempore, quo solent reges ad bella procedere, congregavit Ioab exercitum, et robur militiæ, et vastavit terram filiorum Ammon; perrexitque et obsedit Rabba: porro David manebat in Ierusalem quando Ioab percussit Rabba, et destruxit eam.
verses.notes: Spring is the time when kings go forth to war, because the weather is good for travel, and will remain good for many months.

verses.textEn: Then David took the crown of Milcom from his head, and he found in it the weight of one talent of gold, and very precious gems. And he made for himself a diadem from it. Also, he took the best spoils of the city, which were very many.
verses.textLa: Tulit autem David coronam Melchom de capite eius, et invenit in ea auri pondo talentum, et pretiosissimas gemmas, fecitque sibi inde diadema: manubias quoque urbis plurimas tulit:

verses.textEn: Then he led away the people who were in it. And he caused plows, and sleds, and iron chariots to go over them, so much so that they were cut apart and crushed. So did David treat all the cities of the sons of Ammon. And he returned with all his people to Jerusalem.
verses.textLa: populum autem, qui erat in ea, eduxit: et fecit super eos tribulas, et trahas, et ferrata carpenta transire, ita ut dissecarentur, et contererentur: sic fecit David cunctis urbibus filiorum Ammon: et reversus est cum omni populo suo in Ierusalem.

verses.textEn: After these things, a war was begun at Gezer against the Philistines, in which Sibbecai the Hushathite struck Sippai from the race of the Rephaim, and he humbled them.
verses.textLa: Post hæc initum est bellum in Gazer adversum Philisthæos: in quo percussit Sobochai Husathites, Saphai de genere Raphaim, et humiliavit eos.

verses.textEn: Also, another war was undertaken against the Philistines, in which Adeodatus, a son of the forest, a Bethlehemite, struck the brother of Goliath the Gittite, the wood of whose spear was like a weaver’s beam.
verses.textLa: Aliud quoque bellum gestum est adversus Philisthæos, in quo percussit Adeodatus filius Saltus Bethlehemites fratrem Goliath Gethæi, cuius hastæ lignum erat quasi liciatorium texentium.

verses.textEn: Then too, another war occurred in Gath, in which there was a very tall man, having six digits, that is, all together twenty-four. This man too was born from the stock of the Rephaim.
verses.textLa: Sed et aliud bellum accidit in Geth, in quo fuit homo longissimus, senos habens digitos, id est, simul viginti quattuor: qui et ipse de Rapha fuerat stirpe generatus.

verses.textEn: He blasphemed Israel. And Jonathan, the son of Shimea, the brother of David, struck him down. These were the sons of the Rephaim in Gath, who fell by the hand of David and his servants.
verses.textLa: Hic blasphemavit Israel: et percussit eum Ionathan filius Samaa fratris David. Hi sunt filii Rapha in Geth, qui ceciderunt in manu David et servorum eius.

verses.textEn: Now Satan rose up against Israel, and he incited David so that he would number Israel.
verses.textLa: Consurrexit autem Satan contra Israel: et concitavit David ut numeraret Israel.

verses.textEn: And David said to Joab and to the leaders of the people: “Go, and number Israel, from Beersheba even to Dan. And bring me the number, so that I may know it.”
verses.textLa: Dixitque David ad Ioab, et ad principes populi: Ite, et numerate Israel a Bersabee usque Dan: et afferte mihi numerum ut sciam.

verses.textEn: And Joab responded: “May the Lord increase his people a hundred times more than they are. But, my lord the king, are they not all your servants? Why would my lord seek this thing, which may be imputed as a sin to Israel?”
verses.textLa: Responditque Ioab: Augeat Dominus populum suum centuplum, quam sunt: nonne domine mi rex, omnes servi tui sunt? Quare hoc quærit dominus meus, quod in peccatum reputetur Israeli?

verses.textEn: But the word of the king prevailed instead. And Joab went away, and he traveled around, through all of Israel. And he returned to Jerusalem.
verses.textLa: Sed sermo regis magis prævaluit: egressusque est Ioab, et circuivit universum Israel; et reversus est Ierusalem:

verses.textEn: And he gave to David the number of those whom he had surveyed. And the entire number of Israel was found to be one million and one hundred thousand men who could draw the sword; but from Judah, there were four hundred and seventy thousand men of war.
verses.textLa: Deditque David numerum eorum, quos circuierat: et inventus est omnis numerus Israel, mille millia et centum millia virorum educentium gladium: de Iuda autem quadringenta septuaginta millia bellatorum.

verses.textEn: But Levi and Benjamin he did not number. For Joab executed the orders of the king unwillingly.
verses.textLa: Nam Levi, et Beniamin non numeravit: eo quod Ioab invitus exequeretur regis imperium.

verses.textEn: Then God was displeased with what had been ordered, and so he struck Israel.
verses.textLa: Displicuit autem Deo quod iussum erat; et percussit Israel.

verses.textEn: And David said to God: “I have sinned exceedingly in doing this. I beg you take away the iniquity of your servant. For I have acted unwisely.”
verses.textLa: Dixitque David ad Deum: Peccavi nimis ut hoc facerem: obsecro aufer iniquitatem servi tui, quia insipienter egi.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Gad, the seer of David, saying:
verses.textLa: Et locutus est Dominus ad Gad Videntem Davidis, dicens:

verses.textEn: “Go, and speak to David, and tell him: Thus says the Lord: I give to you the option of three things. Choose the one that you will want, and I will do it to you.”
verses.textLa: Vade, et loquere ad David, et dic ei: Hæc dicit Dominus: Trium tibi optionem do; unum, quod volueris, elige, et faciam tibi.

verses.textEn: And when Gad had gone to David, he said to him: “Thus says the Lord: Choose what you will want:
verses.textLa: Cumque venisset Gad ad David, dixit ei: Hæc dicit Dominus: Elige quod volueris:

verses.textEn: Either three years of famine, or three months for you to flee from your enemies, unable to escape from their sword, or three days for the sword of the Lord and a pestilence to turn within the land, with the Angel of the Lord killing in every part of Israel. Now therefore, see what I should respond to him who sent me.”
verses.textLa: aut tribus annis famem: aut tribus mensibus te fugere hostes tuos, et gladium eorum non posse evadere: aut tribus diebus gladium Domini, et pestilentiam versari in terra, et Angelum Domini interficere in universis finibus Israel: nunc igitur vide quid respondeam ei, qui misit me.

verses.textEn: And David said to Gad: “There are difficulties pressing upon me from every side. But it is better for me to fall into the hands of the Lord, for his mercies are many, than into the hands of men.”
verses.textLa: Et dixit David ad Gad: Ex omni parte me angustiæ premunt: sed melius mihi est, ut incidam in manus Domini, quia multæ sunt miserationes eius, quam in manus hominum.

verses.textEn: Therefore, the Lord sent a pestilence upon Israel. And there fell from Israel seventy thousand men.
verses.textLa: Misit ergo Dominus pestilentiam in Israel: et ceciderunt de Israel septuaginta millia virorum.

verses.textEn: Also, he sent an Angel to Jerusalem, so that he might strike it. And while he was striking, the Lord saw and took pity over the magnitude of the harm. And he commanded the Angel who was striking: “It is enough. Now let your hand cease.” And the Angel of the Lord was standing beside the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
verses.textLa: Misit quoque Angelum in Ierusalem, ut percuteret eam: cumque percuteretur, vidit Dominus, et misertus est super magnitudine mali: et imperavit Angelo, qui percutiebat: Sufficit, iam cesset manus tua. Porro Angelus Domini stabat iuxta aream Ornan Iebusæi.

verses.textEn: And David, lifting up his eyes, saw the Angel of the Lord, standing between heaven and earth with a drawn sword in his hand, turned toward Jerusalem. And both he and those greater by birth, being clothed in haircloth, fell prone upon the ground.
verses.textLa: Levansque David oculos suos, vidit Angelum Domini stantem inter cælum et terram, et evaginatum gladium in manu eius, et versum contra Ierusalem: et ceciderunt tam ipse, quam maiores natu vestiti ciliciis, proni in terram.

verses.textEn: And David said to God: “Am I not the one who ordered that the people be numbered? It is I who sinned; it is I who did evil. This flock, what does it deserve? O Lord my God, I beg you to let your hand be turned against me and against the house of my father. But let not your people be struck down.”
verses.textLa: Dixitque David ad Deum: Nonne ego sum, qui iussi ut numeraretur populus? Ego, qui peccavi: ego, qui malum feci: iste grex quid commeruit? Domine Deus meus vertatur obsecro manus tua in me, et in domum patris mei: populus autem tuus non percutiatur.

verses.textEn: Then the Angel of the Lord instructed Gad to tell David that he should ascend and build an altar to the Lord God on the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
verses.textLa: Angelus autem Domini præcepit Gad ut diceret Davidi ut ascenderet, extrueretque altare Domino Deo in area Ornan Iebusæi.

verses.textEn: Therefore, David ascended, in accord with the word of Gad, which he had spoken to him in the name of the Lord.
verses.textLa: Ascendit ergo David iuxta sermonem Gad, quem locutus ei fuerat ex nomine Domini.

verses.textEn: Now when Ornan had looked up and seen the Angel, he and his four sons hid themselves. For at that time, he was threshing wheat upon the floor.
verses.textLa: Porro Ornan cum suspexisset et vidisset Angelum, quattuorque filii eius cum eo, absconderunt se: nam eo tempore terebat in area triticum.

verses.textEn: Then, as David was approaching Ornan, Ornan saw him, and he went out from the threshing floor to meet him. And he reverenced him prone on the ground.
verses.textLa: Igitur cum veniret David ad Ornan, conspexit eum Ornan, et processit ei obviam de area, et adoravit eum pronus in terram.

verses.textEn: And David said to him: “Give this place of your threshing floor to me, so that I may build an altar to the Lord upon it. And you shall accept from me as much money as it is worth, so that the plague may cease from the people.”
verses.textLa: Dixitque ei David: Da mihi locum areæ tuæ, ut ædificem in ea altare Domino: ita ut quantum valet argenti accipias, et cesset plaga a populo.

verses.textEn: But Ornan said to David: “Take it, and may my lord the king do whatever pleases him. Moreover, I give the oxen also as a holocaust, and the plow for wood, and the wheat for a sacrifice. I will offer all freely.”
verses.textLa: Dixit autem Ornan ad David: Tolle, et faciat dominus meus rex quodcumque ei placet: sed et boves do in holocaustum, et tribulas in ligna, et triticum in sacrificium: Omnia libens præbebo.

verses.textEn: And king David said to him: “By no means shall it be so. Instead, I will give money to you, as much as it is worth. For I must not take it from you, and thereby offer to the Lord holocausts that cost nothing.”
verses.textLa: Dixitque ei rex David: Nequaquam ita fiet, sed argentum dabo quantum valet: neque enim tibi auferre debeo, et sic offerre Domino holocausta gratuita.

verses.textEn: Therefore, David gave Ornan, for the place, the very just weight of six hundred shekels of gold.
verses.textLa: Dedit ergo David Ornan pro loco siclos auri iustissimi ponderis sexcentos.

verses.textEn: And he built an altar to the Lord there. And he offered holocausts and peace offerings, and he called upon the Lord. And he heeded him by sending fire from heaven upon the altar of the holocaust.
verses.textLa: Et ædificavit ibi altare Domino: obtulitque holocausta, et pacifica, et invocavit Dominum, et exaudivit eum in igne de cælo super altare holocausti.

verses.textEn: And the Lord instructed the Angel, and he turned his sword back into its sheath.
verses.textLa: Præcepitque Dominus Angelo: et convertit gladium suum in vaginam.

verses.textEn: Then, seeing that the Lord had heeded him at the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite, David immediately immolated victims there.
verses.textLa: Protinus ergo David, videns quod exaudisset eum Dominus in area Ornan Iebusæi, immolavit ibi victimas.

verses.textEn: But the tabernacle of the Lord, which Moses had made in the desert, and the altar of holocausts, were at that time on the high place of Gibeon.
verses.textLa: Tabernaculum autem Domini, quod fecerat Moyses in deserto, et altare holocaustorum, ea tempestate erat in excelso Gabaon.

verses.textEn: And David was unable to go to the altar, so that he might pray to God there. For he had been struck with an exceedingly great fear, seeing the sword of the Angel of the Lord.
verses.textLa: Et non prævaluit David ire ad altare ut ibi obsecraret Deum: nimio enim fuerat in timore perterritus, videns gladium Angeli Domini.

verses.textEn: And David said, “This is the house of God, and this is the altar for the holocaust of Israel.”
verses.textLa: Dixitque David: Hæc est domus Dei, et hoc altare in holocaustum Israeli.

verses.textEn: And he instructed them to gather all the new converts from the land of Israel. And from these he appointed stoneworkers, to hew stones and to polish them, so that he might build the house of God.
verses.textLa: Et præcepit ut congregarentur omnes proselyti de Terra Israel, et constituit ex eis latomos ad cædendos lapides et poliendos, ut ædificaretur domus Dei.

verses.textEn: Also, David prepared very much iron to use for the nails of the gates, and for the seams and joints, as well as an immeasurable weight of brass.
verses.textLa: Ferrum quoque plurimum ad clavos ianuarum, et ad commissuras atque iuncturas præparavit David: et æris pondus innumerabile.

verses.textEn: Also, the cedar trees, which the Sidonians and Tyrians had transported to David, were not able to be counted.
verses.textLa: Ligna quoque cedrina non poterant æstimari, quæ Sidonii, et Tyrii deportaverant ad David.

verses.textEn: And David said: “My son Solomon is a young and tender boy. But the house that I desire to be built to the Lord ought to be so great that it is renowned in every region. Therefore, I will prepare what will be necessary for him.” And for this reason, before his death, he prepared all the expenses.
verses.textLa: Et dixit David: Solomon filius meus puer parvulus est et delicatus; domus autem, quam ædificari volo Domino, talis esse debet ut in cunctis regionibus nominetur: præparabo ergo ei necessaria. Et ob hanc causam ante mortem suam omnes præparavit impensas.

verses.textEn: And he called for Solomon, his son. And he instructed him to build a house to the Lord, the God of Israel.
verses.textLa: Vocavitque Salomonem filium suum: et præcepit ei ut ædificaret domum Domino Deo Israel.

verses.textEn: And David said to Solomon: “My son, it was my will that I build a house to the name of the Lord my God.
verses.textLa: Dixitque David ad Salomonem: Fili mi, voluntatis meæ fuit ut ædificarem domum nomini Domini Dei mei:

verses.textEn: But the word of the Lord came to me, saying: ‘You have shed much blood, and you have battled in many wars. You are not able to build a house to my name, so great was the shedding of blood before me.
verses.textLa: Sed factus est sermo Domini ad me, dicens: Multum sanguinem effudisti, et plurima bella bellasti: non poteris ædificare domum nomini meo, tanto effuso sanguine coram me:

verses.textEn: The son who shall be born to you will be a very quiet man. For I will cause him to have rest from all his enemies on every side. And for this reason, he shall be called Peaceful. And I will grant peace and tranquility to Israel during all his days.
verses.textLa: filius, qui nascetur tibi, erit vir quietissimus: faciam enim eum requiescere ab omnibus inimicis suis per circuitum: et ob hanc causam Pacificus vocabitur: et pacem et otium dabo in Israel cunctis diebus eius.

verses.textEn: He shall build a house to my name. And he shall be a son to me, and I will be a father to him. And I will establish the throne of his kingdom over Israel unto eternity.’
verses.textLa: Ipse ædificabit domum nomini meo, et ipse erit mihi in filium, et ego ero illi in patrem: firmaboque solium regni eius super Israel in æternum.

verses.textEn: Now then, my son, may the Lord be with you, and may you prosper and build a house to the Lord your God, just as he has spoken concerning you.
verses.textLa: Nunc ergo fili mi, sit Dominus tecum, et prosperare, et ædifica domum Domino Deo tuo, sicut locutus est de te.

verses.textEn: Also, may the Lord give you prudence and understanding, so that you may be able to rule Israel and to guard the law of the Lord your God.
verses.textLa: Det quoque Dominus prudentiam et sensum, ut regere possis Israel, et custodire legem Domini Dei tui.

verses.textEn: For then you will be able to advance, if you keep the commandments and judgments that the Lord instructed Moses to teach to Israel. Be strengthened and act manfully. You should not fear, and you should not dread.
verses.textLa: Tunc enim proficere poteris, si custodieris mandata, et iudicia, quæ præcepit Dominus Moysi ut doceret Israel: confortare et virilter age, ne timeas, neque paveas.

verses.textEn: Behold, in my poverty I have prepared the expenses for the house of the Lord: one hundred thousand talents of gold, and one million of talents of silver. Yet truly, there is no measuring the brass and the iron. For their magnitude is beyond numbering. And I have prepared the timber and the stones for the entire project.
verses.textLa: Ecce ego in paupertate mea præparavi impensas domus Domini, auri talenta centum millia, et argenti mille millia talentorum: æris vero, et ferri non est pondus, vincitur enim numerus magnitudine: ligna et lapides præparavi ad universa impendia.

verses.textEn: Also, you have very many artisans: stoneworkers, and builders of walls, and craftsmen of wood, and those most prudent in doing the work of every art,
verses.textLa: Habes quoque plurimos artifices, latomos, et cæmentarios, artificesque lignorum, et omnium artium ad faciendum opus prudentissimos,

verses.textEn: with gold and silver, and with brass and iron, of which there is no number. Therefore, rise up and act. And the Lord will be with you.”
verses.textLa: in auro et argento et ære et ferro, cuius non est numerus. Surge igitur, et fac, et erit Dominus tecum.

verses.textEn: Also, David instructed all the leaders of Israel, so that they would assist his son Solomon,
verses.textLa: Præcepit quoque David cunctis principibus Israel, ut adiuvarent Salomonem filium suum.

verses.textEn: saying: “You discern that the Lord your God is with you, and that he has given you rest on all sides, and that he has delivered all your enemies into your hands, and that the land has been subdued before the Lord and before his people.
verses.textLa: Cernitis, inquiens, quod Dominus Deus vester vobiscum sit, et dederit vobis requiem per circuitum, et tradiderit omnes inimicos vestros in manus vestras, et subiecta sit terra coram Domino, et coram populo eius.

verses.textEn: Therefore, offer your hearts and your souls, so that you seek the Lord your God. And rise up and build a sanctuary to the Lord God, so that the ark of the covenant of the Lord, and the vessels consecrated to the Lord, may be brought into the house that is built to the name of the Lord.”
verses.textLa: Præbete igitur corda vestra et animas vestras, ut quæratis Dominum Deum vestrum: et consurgite, et ædificate sanctuarium Domino Deo, ut introducatur arca fœderis Domini, et vasa Domino consecrata, in domum, quæ ædificatur nomini Domini.

verses.textEn: Then David, being old and full of days, appointed his son Solomon as king over Israel.
verses.textLa: Igitur David senex et plenus dierum, regem constituit Salomonem filium suum super Israel.

verses.textEn: And he gathered together all the leaders of Israel, with the priests as well as the Levites.
verses.textLa: Et congregavit omnes principes Israel, et Sacerdotes atque Levitas.

verses.textEn: And the Levites were numbered from the age of thirty years and upward. And there were found thirty-eight thousand men.
verses.textLa: Numeratique sunt Levitæ a triginta annis, et supra: et inventa sunt triginta octo millia virorum.

verses.textEn: Of these, twenty-four thousand were chosen and distributed to the ministry of the house of the Lord. Then six thousand were overseers and judges.
verses.textLa: Ex his electi sunt, et distributi in ministerium domus Domini viginti quattuor millia: præpositorum autem et iudicum sex millia.

verses.textEn: Moreover, four thousand were porters. And the same number were the singers of psalms to the Lord, with the musical instruments which he had made for the music.
verses.textLa: Porro quattuor millia ianitores: et totidem psaltæ canentes Domino in organis, quæ fecerat ad canendum.

verses.textEn: And David distributed them into courses according to the sons of Levi, specifically, Gershom, and Kohath, and Merari.
verses.textLa: Et distribuit eos David per vices filiorum Levi, Gerson videlicet, et Caath, et Merari.

verses.textEn: The sons of Gershom: Ladan and Shimei.
verses.textLa: Filii Gerson: Leedan, et Semei.

verses.textEn: The sons of Ladan: the leader Jahiel, and Zetham, and Joel, three.
verses.textLa: Filii Leedan: princeps Iahiel, et Zethan, et Ioel, tres.

verses.textEn: The sons of Shimei: Shelomoth, and Haziel, and Haran, three. These were the leaders of the families of Ladan.
verses.textLa: Filii Semei: Salomith, et Hosiel, et Aran, tres: isti principes familiarum Leedan.

verses.textEn: Then the sons of Shimei: Jahath, and Zizah, and Jeush, and Beriah. These were the sons of Shimei, four.
verses.textLa: Porro filii Semei: Leheth, et Ziza, et Iaus, et Baria: isti filii Semei, quattuor.

verses.textEn: Now Jahath was first, Zizah second, but Jeush and Beriah did not have many sons, and for this reason they were reckoned as one family and one house.
verses.textLa: Erat autem Leheth prior, Ziza secundus: porro Iaus et Baria non habuerunt plurimos filios, et idcirco in una familia, unaque domo computati sunt.

verses.textEn: The sons of Kohath: Amram and Izhar, Hebron and Uzziel, four.
verses.textLa: Filii Caath: Amram, et Isaar, Hebron, et Oziel, quattuor.

verses.textEn: The sons of Amram: Aaron and Moses. Now Aaron was separated so that he might minister in the Holy of Holies, he and his sons forever, and so that he might burn incense to the Lord, according to his rite, and so that he might bless his name in perpetuity.
verses.textLa: Filii Amram: Aaron et Moyses. Separatusque est Aaron ut ministraret in Sancto Sanctorum, ipse et filii eius in sempiternum, et adoleret incensum Domino secundum ritum suum, ac benediceret nomini eius in perpetuum.

verses.textEn: The sons of Moses, the man of God, were also numbered in the tribe of Levi.
verses.textLa: Moysi quoque hominis Dei filii annumerati sunt in tribu Levi.

verses.textEn: The sons of Moses: Gershom and Eliezer.
verses.textLa: Filii Moysi: Gersom, et Eliezer.

verses.textEn: The sons of Gershom: Shebuel the first.
verses.textLa: Filii Gersom: Subuel primus.

verses.textEn: Now the sons of Eliezer were Rehabiah the first. And there were no other sons for Eliezer. But the sons of Rehabiah were multiplied exceedingly.
verses.textLa: Fuerunt autem filii Eliezer: Rohobia primus: et non erant Eliezer filii alii. Porro filii Rohobia multiplicati sunt nimis.

verses.textEn: The sons of Izhar: Shelomith the first.
verses.textLa: Filii Isaar: Salomith primus.

verses.textEn: The sons of Hebron: Jeriah the first, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, Jekameam the fourth.
verses.textLa: Filii Hebron: Ieriau primus, Amarias secundus, Iahaziel tertius, Iecmaam quartus.

verses.textEn: The sons of Uzziel: Micah the first, Isshiah the second.
verses.textLa: Filii Oziel: Micha primus, Iesia secundus.

verses.textEn: The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. The sons of Mahli: Eleazar and Kish.
verses.textLa: Filii Merari: Moholi, et Musi. Filii Moholi: Eleazar, et Cis.

verses.textEn: Then Eleazar died, and had no sons, but only daughters. And so the sons of Kish, their brothers, married them.
verses.textLa: Mortuus est autem Eleazar, et non habuit filios, sed filias: acceperuntque eas filii Cis fratres earum.

verses.textEn: The sons of Mushi: Mahli, and Eder, and Jeremoth, three.
verses.textLa: Filii Musi: Moholi, et Eder, et Ierimoth, tres.

verses.textEn: These are the sons of Levi, in their kindred and families, leaders in turns, and the number of each of the heads who were doing the works of the ministry of the house of the Lord, from twenty years of age and upward.
verses.textLa: Hi filii Levi in cognationibus, et familiis suis, principes per vices, et numerum capitum singulorum, qui faciebant opera ministerii domus Domini a viginti annis, et supra.

verses.textEn: For David said: “The Lord, the God of Israel, has given rest to his people, and a habitation in Jerusalem even unto eternity.
verses.textLa: Dixit enim David: Requiem dedit Dominus Deus Israel populo suo, et habitationem Ierusalem usque in æternum.

verses.textEn: Neither shall it be the office of the Levites any more to carry the tabernacle with all its equipment for use in the ministry.”
verses.textLa: Nec erit officii Levitarum ut ultra portent tabernaculum, et omnia vasa eius ad ministrandum.

verses.textEn: Also, according to the last precepts of David, the sons of Levi shall be counted by number from twenty years of age and upward.
verses.textLa: Iuxta præcepta quoque David novissima supputabitur numerus filiorum Levi a viginti annis et supra.

verses.textEn: And they shall be under the hand of the sons of Aaron, in the care of the house of the Lord, in the vestibule, and in the chambers, and in the place of purification, and in the sanctuary, and in all the works of the ministry of the temple of the Lord.
verses.textLa: Et erunt sub manu filiorum Aaron in cultum domus Domini, in vestibulis, et in exedris, et in loco purificationis, et in sanctuario, et in universis operibus ministerii templi Domini.

verses.textEn: But the priests shall be over the bread of the presence, and the sacrifice of fine wheat flour, and the unleavened cakes, and the frying pan, and the roasting, and over every weight and measure.
verses.textLa: Sacerdotes autem, super panes propositionis, et ad similæ sacrificium, et ad lagana azyma, et sartaginem, et ad torrendum, et super omne pondus atque mensuram.

verses.textEn: Yet truly, the Levites shall stand to confess and to sing to the Lord, in the morning, and similarly in the evening,
verses.textLa: Levitæ vero ut stent mane ad confitendum, et canendum Domino: similiterque ad vesperam

verses.textEn: as much in the oblation of the holocausts of the Lord, as in the Sabbaths and new moons and other solemnities, according to the number and ceremonies for each and every matter, perpetually before the Lord.
verses.textLa: tam in oblatione holocaustorum Domini, quam in Sabbatis et Calendis et sollemnitatibus reliquis iuxta numerum, et ceremonias uniuscuiusque rei, iugiter coram Domino.

verses.textEn: And let them keep the observances of the tabernacle of the covenant, and the rituals of the sanctuary, and the observance of the sons of Aaron, their brothers, so that they may minister in the house of the Lord.
verses.textLa: Et custodiant observationes tabernaculi fœderis, et ritum sanctuarii, et observationem filiorum Aaron fratrum suorum, ut ministrent in domo Domini.

verses.textEn: Now these were the divisions of the sons of Aaron. The sons of Aaron: Nadab, and Abihu, and Eleazar, and Ithamar.
verses.textLa: Porro filiis Aaron hæ partitiones erant: Filii Aaron: Nadab, et Abiu, et Eleazar, et Ithamar.

verses.textEn: But Nadab and Abihu died before their father, and without children. And so Eleazar and Ithamar exercised the priestly office.
verses.textLa: Mortui sunt autem Nadab, et Abiu ante patrem suum absque liberis: sacerdotioque functus est Eleazar, et Ithamar.

verses.textEn: And David distributed them, that is, Zadok of the sons of Eleazar, and Ahimelech of the sons of Ithamar, according to their courses and ministry.
verses.textLa: Et divisit eos David, id est, Sadoc de filiis Eleazari, et Ahimelech de filiis Ithamar, secundum vices suas et ministerium.

verses.textEn: And there were found many more of the sons of Eleazar among the leading men, than of the sons of Ithamar. Therefore, he divided them so that there were, of the sons of Eleazar, sixteen leaders by their families, and of the sons of Ithamar eight by their families and houses.
verses.textLa: Inventique sunt multo plures filii Eleazar in principibus viris, quam filii Ithamar. Divisit autem eis, hoc est filiis Eleazar principes per familias sedecim: et filiis Ithamar per familias et domos suas octo.

verses.textEn: Then he divided among them, in both families, by lot. For there were leaders of the sanctuary and leaders of God, as much from the sons of Eleazar as from the sons of Ithamar.
verses.textLa: Porro divisit utrasque inter se familias sortibus: erant enim principes sanctuarii, et principes Dei, tam de filiis Eleazar, quam de filiis Ithamar.

verses.textEn: And the scribe Shemaiah, the son of Nethanel, a Levite, wrote these down before the king and the leaders, with Zadok, the priest, and Ahimelech, the son of Abiathar, and also the leaders of the priestly and Levitical families. And there was one house, which was preeminent over the others, that of Eleazar; and there was another house, which had the others under it, that of Ithamar.
verses.textLa: Descripsitque eos Semeias filius Nathanael scriba Levites, coram rege et principibus, et Sadoc sacerdote, et Ahimelech filio Abiathar, principibus quoque familiarum sacerdotalium et Leviticarum: unam domum, quæ ceteris præerat, Eleazar: et alteram domum, quæ sub se habebat ceteros, Ithamar.

verses.textEn: Now the first lot went forth to Jehoiarib, the second to Jedaiah,
verses.textLa: Exivit autem sors prima Ioiarib, secunda Iedei,

verses.textEn: the third to Harim, the fourth to Seorim,
verses.textLa: tertia Harim, quarta Seorim,

verses.textEn: the fifth to Malchijah, the sixth to Mijamin,
verses.textLa: quinta Melchia, sexta Maiman,

verses.textEn: the seventh to Hakkoz, the eighth to Abijah,
verses.textLa: septima Accos, octava Abia,

verses.textEn: the ninth to Jeshua, the tenth to Shecaniah,
verses.textLa: nona Iesua, decima Sechenia,

verses.textEn: the eleventh to Eliashib, the twelfth to Jakim,
verses.textLa: undecima Eliasib, duodecima Iacim,

verses.textEn: the thirteenth to Huppah, the fourteenth to Jeshebeab,
verses.textLa: tertiadecima Hoppha, decimaquarta Isbaab,

verses.textEn: the fifteenth to Bilgah, the sixteenth to Immer,
verses.textLa: decimaquinta Belga, decimasexta Emmer,

verses.textEn: the seventeenth to Hezir, the eighteenth to Happizzez,
verses.textLa: decimaseptima Hezir, decimaoctava Aphses,

verses.textEn: the nineteenth to Pethahiah, the twentieth to Jehezkel,
verses.textLa: decimanona Pheteia, vigesima Hezechiel,

verses.textEn: the twenty-first to Jachin, the twenty-second to Gamul,
verses.textLa: vigesima prima Iachin, vigesima secunda Gamul,

verses.textEn: the twenty-third to Delaiah, the twenty-fourth to Maaziah.
verses.textLa: vigesima tertia Dalaiau, vigesima quarta Maaziau.

verses.textEn: These were their courses according to their ministries, so that they would enter into the house of the Lord in accord with their practice, under the hand of Aaron, their father, just as the Lord, the God of Israel, had instructed.
verses.textLa: Hæ vices eorum secundum ministeria sua, ut ingrediantur domum Domini, et iuxta ritum suum sub manu Aaron patris eorum: sicut præceperat Dominus Deus Israel.

verses.textEn: Now of the sons of Levi who were remaining, there were Shubael, from the sons of Amram, and Jehdeiah, from the sons of Shubael.
verses.textLa: Porro filiorum Levi, qui reliqui fuerant, de filiis Amram erat Subael, et de filiis Subael, Iehedeia.

verses.textEn: Also, there were Isshiah, the leader from the sons of Rehabiah,
verses.textLa: De filiis quoque Rohobiæ princeps Iesias.

verses.textEn: and truly Shelomoth, the son of Izhar, and Jahath, the son of Shelomoth,
verses.textLa: Isaari vero filius Salemoth, filiusque Salemoth Iahath:

verses.textEn: and his son, Jeriah the first, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, Jekameam the fourth.
verses.textLa: filiusque eius Ieriau primus, Amarias secundus, Iahaziel tertius, Iecmaan quartus.

verses.textEn: The son of Uzziel was Micah. The son of Micah was Shamir.
verses.textLa: Filius Oziel, Micha: filius Micha, Samir.

verses.textEn: The brother of Micah was Isshiah. And the son of Isshiah was Zechariah.
verses.textLa: Frater Micha, Iesia: filiusque Iesiæ, Zacharias.

verses.textEn: The sons of Merari were Mahli and Mushi. The son of Uzziah was Beno.
verses.textLa: Filii Merari: Moholi et Musi. Filius Oziau: Benno.

verses.textEn: Also, the son of Merari: Uzziah, and Shoham, and Zaccur, and Hebri.
verses.textLa: Filius quoque Merari: Oziau et Soam et Zachur et Hebri.

verses.textEn: In addition, the son of Mahli was Eleazar, who had no children.
verses.textLa: Porro Moholi filius: Eleazar, qui non habebat liberos.

verses.textEn: Truly, the son of Kish was Jerahmeel.
verses.textLa: Filius vero Cis, Ierameel.

verses.textEn: The sons of Mushi were Mahli, Eder, and Jerimoth. These were the sons of Levi according to the houses of their families.
verses.textLa: Filii Musi: Moholi, Eder, et Ierimoth. Isti filii Levi secundum domos familiarum suarum.

verses.textEn: And they also cast lots concerning their brothers, the sons of Aaron, before David the king, and Zadok, and Ahimelech, and the leaders of the priestly and Levitical families, as much concerning the elder as the younger. The lot divided all things equitably.
verses.textLa: Miseruntque et ipsi sortes contra fratres suos filios Aaron coram David rege, et Sadoc, et Ahimelech, et principibus familiarum Sacerdotalium et Leviticarum, tam maiores, quam minores. Omnes sors æqualiter dividebat.

verses.textEn: Then David and the magistrates of the army set apart, for the ministry, the sons of Asaph, and of Heman, and of Jeduthun, who were to prophesy with harps and psalteries and cymbals, in accord with their number, having been dedicated to their appointed office.
verses.textLa: Igitur David, et magistratus exercitus segregaverunt in ministerium filios Asaph, et Heman, et Idithun: qui prophetarent in citharis, et psalteriis, et cymbalis secundum numerum suum dedicato sibi officio servientes.

verses.textEn: From the sons of Asaph: Zaccur, and Joseph, and Nethaniah, and Asharelah, the sons of Asaph, under the hand of Asaph, prophesying beside the king.
verses.textLa: De filiis Asaph: Zachur, et Ioseph, et Nathania, et Asarela, filii Asaph: sub manu Asaph prophetantis iuxta regem.

verses.textEn: Then of Jeduthun, the sons of Jeduthun: Gedaliah, Zeri, Jeshaiah, and Hashabiah, and Mattithiah, six, under the hand of their father Jeduthun, who was prophesying with stringed instruments, while confessing and praising the Lord.
verses.textLa: Porro Idithun, filii Idithun: Godolias, Sori, Ieseias, et Hasabias, et Mathathias, sex, sub manu patris sui Idithun, qui in cithara prophetabat super confitentes et laudantes Dominum.

verses.textEn: Also, of Heman, the sons of Heman: Bukkiah, Mattaniah, Uzziel, Shebuel, and Jerimoth, Hananiah, Hanani, Eliathah, Giddalti, and Romamtiezer, and Joshbekashah, Mallothi, Hothir, Mahazioth.
verses.textLa: Heman quoque, filii Heman: Bocciau, Mathaniau, Oziel, Subuel, et Ierimoth, Hananias, Hanani, Eliatha, Geddelthi, et Romemthiezer, et Iesbacassa, Mellothi, Othir, Mahazioth:

verses.textEn: All these were the sons of Heman, the seer of the king in the words of God, in order to lift up the horn. And God gave to Heman fourteen sons and three daughters.
verses.textLa: Omnes isti filii Heman Videntis regis in sermonibus Dei, ut exaltaret cornu: deditque Deus Heman filios quattuordecim, et filias tres.

verses.textEn: All these, under their father’s hand, were distributed in order to sing in the temple of the Lord, with cymbals and psalteries and harps, in the ministry of the house of the Lord beside the king, specifically, Asaph, and Jeduthun, and Heman.
verses.textLa: Universi sub manu patris sui ad cantandum in templo Domini distributi erant, in cymbalis, et psalteriis, et citharis, in ministeria domus Domini iuxta regem: Asaph videlicet, et Idithun, et Heman.

verses.textEn: Now the number of these, with their brothers, who were instructing in the song of the Lord, all the teachers, were two hundred eighty-eight.
verses.textLa: Fuit autem numerus eorum cum fratribus suis, qui erudiebant canticum Domini, cuncti doctores, ducenti octogintaocto.

verses.textEn: And they cast lots in their turns, the elder equally with the younger, the learned together with the unlearned.
verses.textLa: Miseruntque sortes per vices suas, ex æquo tam maior quam minor, doctus pariter et indoctus.

verses.textEn: And the first lot went forth to Joseph, who was of Asaph; the second went forth to Gedaliah, to him and his sons and his brothers, twelve.
verses.textLa: Egressaque est sors prima Ioseph, qui erat de Asaph. Secunda Godoliæ, ipsi et filiis eius, et fratribus eius duodecim.

verses.textEn: The third went to Zaccur, to his sons and brothers, twelve.
verses.textLa: Tertia Zachur, filiis et fratribus eius duodecim.

verses.textEn: The fourth went to Izri, to his sons and brothers, twelve.
verses.textLa: Quarta Isari, filiis et fratribus eius duodecim.

verses.textEn: The fifth went to Nethaniah, to his sons and brothers, twelve.
verses.textLa: Quinta Nathaniæ, filiis et fratribus eius duodecim.

verses.textEn: The sixth went to Bukkiah, to his sons and brothers, twelve.
verses.textLa: Sexta Bocciau, filiis et fratribus eius duodecim.

verses.textEn: The seventh went to Jesharelah, to his sons and brothers, twelve.
verses.textLa: Septima Isreela, filiis et fratribus eius duodecim.

verses.textEn: The eighth went to Jeshaiah, to his sons and brothers, twelve.
verses.textLa: Octava Iesaiæ, filiis et fratribus eius duodecim.

verses.textEn: The ninth went to Mattaniah, to his sons and brothers, twelve.
verses.textLa: Nona Mathaniæ, filiis et fratribus eius duodecim.

verses.textEn: The tenth went to Shimei, to his sons and brothers, twelve.
verses.textLa: Decima Semeiæ, filiis et fratribus eius duodecim.

verses.textEn: The eleventh went to Azarel, to his sons and brothers, twelve.
verses.textLa: Undecima Azareel, filiis et fratribus eius duodecim.

verses.textEn: The twelfth went to Hashabiah, to his sons and brothers, twelve.
verses.textLa: Duodecima Hasabiæ, filiis et fratribus eius duodecim.

verses.textEn: The thirteenth went to Shubael, to his sons and brothers, twelve.
verses.textLa: Tertiadecima Subael, filiis et fratribus eius duodecim.

verses.textEn: The fourteenth went to Mattithiah, to his sons and brothers, twelve.
verses.textLa: Quartadecima Mathathiæ, filiis et fratribus eius duodecim.

verses.textEn: The fifteenth went to Jeremoth, to his sons and brothers, twelve.
verses.textLa: Quintadecima Ierimoth, filiis et fratribus eius duodecim.

verses.textEn: The sixteenth went to Hananiah, to his sons and brothers, twelve.
verses.textLa: Sextadecima Hananiæ, filiis et fratribus eius duodecim.

verses.textEn: The seventeenth went to Joshbekashah, to his sons and brothers, twelve.
verses.textLa: Septimadecima Iesbacassæ, filiis et fratribus eius duodecim.

verses.textEn: The eighteenth went to Hanani, to his sons and brothers, twelve.
verses.textLa: Octavadecima Hanani, filiis et fratribus eius duodecim.

verses.textEn: The nineteenth went to Mallothi, to his sons and his brothers, twelve.
verses.textLa: Nonadecima Mellothi, filiis et fratribus eius duodecim.

verses.textEn: The twentieth went to Eliathah, to his sons and brothers, twelve.
verses.textLa: Vigesima Eliatha, filiis et fratribus eius duodecim.

verses.textEn: The twenty-first went to Hothir, to his sons and brothers, twelve.
verses.textLa: Vigesima prima Othir, filiis et fratribus eius duodecim.

verses.textEn: The twenty-second went to Giddalti, to his sons and brothers, twelve.
verses.textLa: Vigesima secunda Geddelthi, filiis et fratribus eius duodecim.

verses.textEn: The twenty-third went to Mahazioth, to his sons and brothers, twelve.
verses.textLa: Vigesima tertia Mahazioth, filiis et fratribus eius duodecim.

verses.textEn: The twenty-fourth went to Romamtiezer, to his sons and brothers, twelve.
verses.textLa: Vigesima quarta Romemthiezer, filiis et fratribus eius duodecim.

verses.textEn: Now the divisions of the porters were, from the Korahites: Meshelemiah, the son of Kore, of the sons of Asaph.
verses.textLa: Divisiones autem ianitorum: de Coritis Meselemia, filius Core, de filiis Asaph.

verses.textEn: The sons of Meshelemiah: Zechariah the firstborn, Jediael the second, Zebadiah the third, Jathniel the fourth,
verses.textLa: Filii Meselemiæ: Zacharias primogenitus, Iadihel secundus, Zabadias tertius, Iathanael quartus,

verses.textEn: Elam the fifth, Jehohanan the sixth, Eliehoenai the seventh.
verses.textLa: Ælam quintus, Iohanan sextus, Elioenai septimus.

verses.textEn: Then the sons of Obededom: Shemaiah the firstborn, Jehozabad the second, Joah the third, Sachar the fourth, Nethanel the fifth,
verses.textLa: Filii autem Obededom: Semeias primogenitus, Iozabad secundus, Ioaha tertius, Sachar quartus, Nathanael quintus,

verses.textEn: Ammiel the sixth, Issachar the seventh, Peullethai the eighth. For the Lord had blessed him.
verses.textLa: Ammiel sextus, Issachar septimus, Phollathi octavus: quia benedixit illi Dominus.

verses.textEn: Now to his son Shemaiah, there were born sons, rulers of their families. For they were very strong men.
verses.textLa: Semei autem filio eius nati sunt filii, præfecti familiarum suarum: erant enim viri fortissimi.

verses.textEn: Then the sons of Shemaiah were Othni, and Rephael, and Obed, Elzabad and his brothers, very strong men, as well as Elihu and Semachiah.
verses.textLa: Filii ergo Semeiæ: Othni, et Raphael, et Obed, Elzabad, fratres eius viri fortissimi: Eliu quoque, et Samachias.

verses.textEn: All these were from the sons of Obededom: they and their sons and brothers, very fit for the ministry, sixty-two from Obededom.
verses.textLa: Omnes hi, de filiis Obededom: ipsi, et filii, et fratres eorum fortissimi ad ministrandum, sexaginta duo de Obededom.

verses.textEn: Then there were the sons of Meshelemiah and their brothers, very robust men, eighteen.
verses.textLa: Porro Meselemiæ filii, et fratres eorum robustissimi, decem et octo.

verses.textEn: Now, from Hosah, that is, from the sons of Merari: Shimri the leader, for he had not had a firstborn son, and so, because of this, his father had appointed him as the leader,
verses.textLa: De Hosa autem, id est, de filiis Merari: Semri princeps (non enim habuerat primogenitum, et idcirco posuerat eum pater eius in principem)

verses.textEn: Hilkiah the second, Tebaliah the third, Zechariah the fourth. All these, the sons and brothers of Hosah, were thirteen.
verses.textLa: Helcias secundus, Tabelias tertius, Zacharias quartus. Omnes hi filii, et fratres Hosa, tredecim.

verses.textEn: These were distributed as porters, so that the leaders of the posts, as well as their brothers, were ministering continually in the house of the Lord.
verses.textLa: Hi divisi sunt in ianitores, ut semper principes custodiarum, sicut et fratres eorum ministrarent in domo Domini.

verses.textEn: Then they cast lots equally, for both the small and the great, by their families, concerning each one of the gates.
verses.textLa: Missæ sunt ergo sortes ex æquo, et parvis, et magnis, per familias suas in unamquamque portarum.

verses.textEn: And the lot of the east fell out to Shelemiah. But to his son Zechariah, a very prudent and learned man, the northern section was obtained by lot.
verses.textLa: Cecidit ergo sors Orientalis, Selemiæ. Porro Zachariæ filio eius, viro prudentissimo, et erudito, sortito obtigit plaga Septentrionalis.

verses.textEn: Truly, Obededom and his sons obtained that to the south, in the part of the house where the council of elders was.
verses.textLa: Obededom vero et filiis eius ad Austrum: in qua parte domus erat seniorum concilium.

verses.textEn: Shuppim and Hosah obtained that toward the west, beside the gate that leads to the way of the ascent, one post facing the other.
verses.textLa: Sephim, et Hosa ad Occidentem, iuxta portam, quæ ducit ad viam ascensionis: custodia contra custodiam.

verses.textEn: Truly, toward the east there were six Levites, and toward the north there were four per day, and then toward the south similarly there were four each day. And where the council was, there were two and two.
verses.textLa: Ad Orientem vero Levitæ sex: et ad Aquilonem quattuor per diem: atque ad Meridiem similiter in die quattuor: et ubi erat concilium bini et bini.

verses.textEn: Also, in the cells of the porters toward the west, there were four along the way, and two at every cell.
verses.textLa: In cellulis quoque ianitorum ad Occidentem quattuor in via, binique per cellulas.

verses.textEn: These are the divisions of the porters of the sons of Kohath and of Merari.
verses.textLa: Hæ sunt divisiones ianitorum filiorum Core, et Merari.
verses.notes: This Kohath is the brother of Merari, and is not the same as Korah or Kore.

verses.textEn: Now Ahijah was over the treasuries of the house of God, and the holy vessels.
verses.textLa: Porro Achias erat super thesauros domus Dei, et vasa sanctorum.

verses.textEn: The sons of Ladan, sons of Gershon: from Ladan, leaders of the families of Ladan and of Gershon: Jehieli.
verses.textLa: Filii Ledan, filii Gersonni: de Ledan principes familiarum, Ledan, et Gersonni, Iehieli.

verses.textEn: The sons of Jehieli: Zetham and Joel; his brothers were over the treasuries of the house of the Lord,
verses.textLa: Filii Iehieli: Zathan, et Ioel fratres eius super thesauros domus Domini,

verses.textEn: with the Amramites, and Izharites, and Hebronites, and Uzzielites.
verses.textLa: Amramitis, et Isaaritis, et Hebronitis, et Ozihelitis.

verses.textEn: Now, Shebuel, the son of Gershom, the son of Moses, was in the first place over the treasuries,
verses.textLa: Subael autem filius Gersom, filii Moysi, præpositus thesauris.

verses.textEn: along with his brothers, Eliezer, and his son Rehabiah, and his son Jeshaiah, and his son Joram, and also his son Zichri, and his son Shelomoth.
verses.textLa: Fratres quoque eius Eliezer, cuius filius Rahabia, et huius filius Isaias, et huius filius Ioram, huius quoque filius Zechri. Et huius filius Selemith.

verses.textEn: The same Shelomoth and his brothers were over the treasuries of the holy things, which king David sanctified, with the leaders of the families, and the tribunes, and the centurions, and the commanders of the army.
verses.textLa: Ipse Selemith, et fratres eius super thesauros sanctorum, quæ sanctificavit David rex, et principes familiarum, et tribuni, et centuriones, et duces exercitus

verses.textEn: These things were from the wars and from the best spoils of the battles, which they had consecrated for the repair and the furnishing of the temple of the Lord.
verses.textLa: de bellis, et manubiis præliorum, quæ consecraverant ad instaurationem, et supellectilem templi Domini.

verses.textEn: Now all these things were sanctified by Samuel, the seer, and by Saul, the son of Kish, and by Abner, the son of Ner, and by Joab, the son of Zeruiah. All those who had sanctified these were under the hand of Shelomoth and his brothers.
verses.textLa: Hæc autem universa sanctificavit Samuel Videns, et Saul filius Cis, et Abner filius Ner, et Ioab filius Sarviæ: omnes, qui sanctificaverant ea per manum Selemith, et fratrum eius.

verses.textEn: Yet truly, Chenaniah and his sons were over the Izharites, for the exterior works concerning Israel, in order to teach and to judge them.
verses.textLa: Isaaritis vero præerat Chonenias, et filii eius ad opera forinsecus super Israel ad docendum et iudicandum eos.

verses.textEn: Now from the Hebronites, Hashabiah and his brothers, one thousand seven hundred very strong men, were in charge of Israel across the Jordan toward the west, in all the works of the Lord, and in the ministry of the king.
verses.textLa: Porro de Hebronitis Hasabias, et fratres eius viri fortissimi, mille septingenti præerant Israeli trans Iordanem contra Occidentem, in cunctis operibus Domini, et in ministerium regis.

verses.textEn: And the leader of the Hebronites was Jerijah, according to their families and kindred. In the fortieth year of the reign of David, they were numbered, and there were found very strong men in Jazer Gilead.
verses.textLa: Hebronitarum autem princeps fuit Ieria secundum familias et cognationes eorum. Quadragesimo anno regni David recensiti sunt, et inventi sunt viri fortissimi in Iazer Galaad,

verses.textEn: And his brothers of a mature age were two thousand seven hundred leaders of families. Then king David placed them in charge of the Reubenites, and the Gadites, and the one half tribe of Manasseh, in all of the ministries of God and of the king.
verses.textLa: fratresque eius robustioris ætatis, duo millia septingenti principes familiarum. Præposuit autem eos David rex Rubenitis, et Gadditis, et dimidiæ tribui Manasse, in omne ministerium Dei, et regis.

verses.textEn: Now the sons of Israel, according to their number, the leaders of the families, the tribunes, and the centurions, and the chiefs, who were ministering to the king by their companies, entering and departing in each month of the year as they were in charge, were twenty-four thousand.
verses.textLa: Filii autem Israel secundum numerum suum, principes familiarum, tribuni, et centuriones, et præfecti, qui ministrabant regi iuxta turmas suas, ingredientes et egredientes per singulos menses in anno, viginti quattuor millibus singuli præerant.
verses.notes: This phrase ‘singuli præerant’ refers to each group that was in charge for one month at a time. In other words, as the subsequent verses describe in detail, they took turns doing the work of the king.

verses.textEn: Jashobeam, the son of Zabdiel, was in charge of the first company in the first month; and under him were twenty-four thousand.
verses.textLa: Primæ turmæ in primo mense Iesboam præerat filius Zabdiel, et sub eo viginti quattuor millia.

verses.textEn: He was from the sons of Perez, and he was the leader of all the other leaders in the army, in the first month.
verses.textLa: De filiis Phares, princeps cunctorum principum in exercitu mense primo.

verses.textEn: The company of the second month had Dodai, an Ahohite; and after him there was another, named Mikloth, who ruled over a portion of the army of the twenty-four thousand.
verses.textLa: Secundi mensis habebat turmam Dudia Ahohites, et post se alter nomine Macelloth, qui regebat partem exercitus viginti quattuor millium.

verses.textEn: Also, the commander of the third company, in the third month, was Benaiah, the son of Jehoiada the priest; and in his division there were twenty-four thousand.
verses.textLa: Dux quoque turmæ tertiæ in mense tertio, erat Banaias filius Ioiadæ sacerdos: et in divisione sua viginti quattuor millia.

verses.textEn: The same is the Benaiah who was strongest among the thirty, and was above the thirty. But his son, Ammizabad, was in charge of his company.
verses.textLa: Ipse est Banaias fortissimus inter triginta, et super triginta. Præerat autem turmæ ipsius Amizabad filius eius.

verses.textEn: The fourth, for the fourth month, was Asahel, the brother of Joab, and his son Zebadiah after him; and in his company there were twenty-four thousand.
verses.textLa: Quartus, mense quarto, Asahel frater Ioab, et Zabadias filius eius post eum: et in turma eius viginti quattuor millia.

verses.textEn: The fifth leader, for the fifth month, was Shamhuth, an Izrahite; and in his company there were twenty-four thousand.
verses.textLa: Quintus, mense quinto, princeps Samaoth Iezerites: et in turma eius viginti quattuor millia.

verses.textEn: The sixth, for the sixth month, was Ira, the son of Ikkesh, a Tekoite; and in his company there were twenty-four thousand.
verses.textLa: Sextus, mense sexto, Hira filius Acces Thecuites: et in turma eius viginti quattuor millia.

verses.textEn: The seventh, for the seventh month, was Helez, a Pelonite from the sons of Ephraim; and in his company there were twenty-four thousand.
verses.textLa: Septimus, mense septimo, Helles Phallonites de filiis Ephraim: et in turma eius viginti quattuor millia.

verses.textEn: The eighth, for the eighth month, was Sibbecai, a Hushathite from the stock of the Zerahites; and in his company there were twenty-four thousand.
verses.textLa: Octavus, mense octavo, Sobochai Husathites de stirpe Zarahi: et in turma eius viginti quattuor millia.

verses.textEn: The ninth, for the ninth month, was Abiezer, an Anathothite from the sons of Benjamin; and in his company there were twenty-four thousand.
verses.textLa: Nonus, mense nono, Abiezer Anathothites de filiis Iemini: et in turma eius viginti quattuor millia.

verses.textEn: The tenth, for the tenth month, was Maharai, and he was a Netophathite from the stock of the Zerahites; and in his company there were twenty-four thousand.
verses.textLa: Decimus, mense decimo, Marai, et ipse Netophathites de stirpe Zarai: et in turma eius viginti quattuor millia.

verses.textEn: The eleventh, for the eleventh month, was Benaiah, a Pirathonite from the sons of Ephraim; and in his company there were twenty-four thousand.
verses.textLa: Undecimus, mense undecimo, Banaias Pharathonites de filiis Ephraim: et in turma eius viginti quattuor millia.

verses.textEn: The twelfth, for the twelfth month, was Heldai, a Netophathite from the stock of Othniel; and in his company there were twenty-four thousand.
verses.textLa: Duodecimus, mense duodecimo, Holdai Netophathites, de stirpe Gothoniel: et in turma eius viginti quattuor millia.

verses.textEn: Now those who were first over the tribes of Israel were these: over the Reubenites, Eliezer, the son of Zichri, was the ruler; over the Simeonites, Shephatiah, the son of Maacah, was the ruler;
verses.textLa: Porro tribubus præerant Israel, Rubenitis, dux Eliezer filius Zechri: Simeonitis, dux Saphatias filius Maacha:

verses.textEn: over the Levites, Hashabiah, the son of Kemuel; over the Aaronites, Zadok;
verses.textLa: Levitis, Hasabias filius Camuel: Aaronitis, Sadoc:

verses.textEn: over Judah, Elihu, the brother of David; over Issachar, Omri, the son of Michael;
verses.textLa: Iuda, Eliu, frater David: Issachar, Amri filius Michael.

verses.textEn: over the Zebulunites, Ishmaiah, the son of Obadiah; over the Naphtalites, Jeremoth, the son of Azriel;
verses.textLa: Zabulonitis, Iesmaias filius Abdiæ: Nephthalitibus, Ierimoth filius Ozriel:

verses.textEn: over the sons of Ephraim, Hoshea, the son of Azaziah; over the one half tribe of Manasseh, Joel, the son of Pedaiah;
verses.textLa: filiis Ephraim, Osee filius Ozaziu: dimidiæ tribui Manasse, Ioel filius Phadaiæ:

verses.textEn: and over the one half tribe of Manasseh in Gilead, Iddo, the son of Zechariah; then over Benjamin, Jaasiel, the son of Abner;
verses.textLa: et dimidiæ tribui Manasse in Galaad, Iaddo filius Zachariæ: Beniamin autem, Iasiel filius Abner.

verses.textEn: yet truly, Azarel, the son of Jeroham, was over Dan. These were the leaders of the sons of Israel.
verses.textLa: Dan vero, Ezrihel filius Ieroham: hi principes filiorum Israel.

verses.textEn: But David was not willing to number them from twenty years old and under. For the Lord had said that he would multiply Israel like the stars of heaven.
verses.textLa: Noluit autem David numerare eos a viginti annis inferius: quia dixerat Dominus ut multiplicaret Israel quasi stellas cæli.

verses.textEn: Joab, the son of Zeruiah, had begun to number, but he did not finish. For because of this, wrath had fallen upon Israel. And therefore the number of those who had been counted was not related in the official records of king David.
verses.textLa: Ioab filius Sarviæ cœperat numerare, nec complevit: quia super hoc ira irruerat in Israel: et idcirco numerus eorum qui fuerant recensiti, non est relatus in fastos regis David.

verses.textEn: Now over the storerooms of the king was Azmaveth, the son of Adiel. But Jonathan, the son of Uzziah, was over those storerooms that were in the cities, and in the villages, and in the towers.
verses.textLa: Super thesauros autem regis fuit Azmoth filius Adiel. His autem thesauris, qui erant in urbibus, et in vicis, et in turribus, præsidebat Ionathan filius Oziæ.

verses.textEn: And over the farmlands and the farmers, those who worked the ground, was Ezri, the son of Chelub.
verses.textLa: Operi autem rustico, et agricolis, qui exercebant terram, præerat Ezri filius Chelub:

verses.textEn: And over the cultivators of vineyards was Shimei, a Ramathite; then over the wine cellars was Zabdi, an Aphonite.
verses.textLa: vinearumque cultoribus, Semeias Romathites: cellis autem vinariis, Zabdias Aphonites.

verses.textEn: Now over the olive groves and the fig groves, which were in the plains, was Baal-hanan, a Gederite; and over the oil cellars was Joash.
verses.textLa: Nam super oliveta et ficeta, quæ erant in campestribus, Balanam Gederites: super apothecas autem olei, Ioas.

verses.textEn: Now over the herds that were pastured in Sharon, Shitrai, a Sharonite, was in the first place; and over the oxen in the valleys, there was Shaphat, the son of Adlai.
verses.textLa: Porro armentis, quæ pascebantur in Saron, præpositus fuit Setrai Saronites: et super boves in vallibus Saphat filius Adli:

verses.textEn: Truly, over the camels was Obil, an Ishmaelite; and over the donkeys was Jehdeiah, a Meronothite.
verses.textLa: super camelos vero, Ubil Ismahelites: et super asinos, Iadias Meronathites.

verses.textEn: And over the sheep was Jaziz, a Hagarene. All these were leaders over the substance of king David.
verses.textLa: Super oves quoque Iaziz Agareus. Omnes hi, principes substantiæ regis David.

verses.textEn: Now Jonathan, the uncle of David, was a counselor, a prudent and scholarly man; he and Jehiel, the son of Hachmoni, were with the sons of the king.
verses.textLa: Ionathan autem patruus David, consiliarius, vir prudens et litteratus: ipse et Iahiel filius Hachamoni erant cum filiis regis.

verses.textEn: Now Ahithophel was the counselor of the king; and Hushai, the Archite, was the king’s friend.
verses.textLa: Achitophel etiam consiliarius regis, et Chusai Arachites amicus regis.

verses.textEn: After Ahithophel was Jehoiada, the son of Benaiah, and Abiathar. But the leader of the army of the king was Joab.
verses.textLa: Post Achitophel fuit Ioiada filius Banaiæ, et Abiathar. Princeps autem exercitus regis erat Ioab.

verses.textEn: And so David called together all the leaders of Israel, the rulers of the tribes, and those in charge of the companies, who were ministering to the king, and also the tribunes and centurions, and those in charge of the substance and possessions of the king, and his sons, with the eunuchs and the powerful and those most experienced in the army, at Jerusalem.
verses.textLa: Convocavit igitur David omnes principes Israel, duces tribuum, et præpositos turmarum, qui ministrabant regi: tribunos quoque et centuriones, et qui præerant substantiæ et possessionibus regis, filiosque suos cum eunuchis, et potentes, et robustissimos quosque in exercitu Ierusalem.

verses.textEn: And when the king had risen up and was standing, he said: “Listen to me, my brothers and my people. I thought that I would build a house, in which the ark of the covenant of the Lord, the footstool of our God, might rest. And so I prepared everything for its building.
verses.textLa: Cumque surrexisset rex, et stetisset, ait: Audite me fratres mei, et populus meus: Cogitavi ut ædificarem domum, in qua requiesceret arca fœderis Domini, et scabellum pedum Dei nostri: et ad ædificandum, omnia præparavi.

verses.textEn: But God said to me: ‘You shall not build a house to my name, because you are a man of war, and have shed blood.’
verses.textLa: Deus autem dixit mihi: Non ædificabis domum nomini meo, eo quod sis vir bellator, et sanguinem fuderis.

verses.textEn: Now the Lord God of Israel chose me, out of the entire house of my father, so that I would be king over Israel forever. For from Judah he chose leaders; then from the house of Judah he chose the house of my father; and from the sons of my father, it pleased him to choose me as king over all of Israel.
verses.textLa: Sed elegit Dominus Deus Israel me de universa domo patris mei, ut essem rex super Israel in sempiternum: de Iuda enim elegit principes: porro de domo Iuda, domum patris mei: et de filiis patris mei, placuit ei ut me eligeret regem super cunctum Israel.

verses.textEn: Then too, among my sons (for the Lord has given me many sons) he chose Solomon my son, so that he would sit upon the throne of the kingdom of the Lord, over Israel.
verses.textLa: Sed et de filiis meis (filios enim mihi multos dedit Dominus) elegit Salomonem filium meum, ut sederet in throno regni Domini super Israel,

verses.textEn: And he said to me: ‘Solomon your son shall build my house and my courts. For I have chosen him to be to me as a son, and I will be to him as a father.
verses.textLa: dixitque mihi: Salomon filius tuus ædificabit domum meam, et atria mea: ipsum enim elegi mihi in filium, et ego ero ei in patrem.

verses.textEn: And I will make firm his kingdom, even unto eternity, if he will persevere in doing my precepts and judgments, as also today.’
verses.textLa: Et firmabo regnum eius usque in æternum, si perseveraverit facere præcepta mea, et iudicia, sicut et hodie.

verses.textEn: Now therefore, before the entire assembly of Israel, in the hearing of our God, keep and seek all the commandments of the Lord our God, so that you may possess the good land, and may bequeath it to your sons after you, even forever.
verses.textLa: Nunc ergo coram universo cœtu Israel audiente Deo nostro, custodite, et perquirite cuncta mandata Domini Dei nostri: ut possideatis Terram bonam, et relinquatis eam filiis vestris post vos usque in sempiternum.

verses.textEn: And as for you, my son Solomon, know the God of your father, and serve him with a perfect heart and a willing mind. For the Lord searches all hearts, and understands the thoughts of all minds. If you seek him, you will find him. But if you abandon him, he will cast you aside for eternity.
verses.textLa: Tu autem Salomon fili mi, scito Deum patris tui, et servito ei corde perfecto, animo voluntario: omnia enim corda scrutatur Dominus, et universas mentium cogitationes intelligit. Si quæsieris eum, invenies: si autem dereliqueris eum, proiiciet te in æternum.

verses.textEn: Now therefore, since the Lord has chosen you, so that you would build the house of the Sanctuary, be strengthened and accomplish it.”
verses.textLa: Nunc ergo quia elegit te Dominus ut ædificares domum Sanctuarii, confortare, et perfice.

verses.textEn: Then David gave to his son Solomon a description of the portico, and the temple, and the storerooms, and the upper floor, and the innermost rooms, and the house of propitiation,
verses.textLa: Dedit autem David Salomoni filio suo descriptionem porticus, et templi, et cellariorum, et cœnaculi, et cubiculorum in adytis, et domus propitiationis,

verses.textEn: and indeed also of all the courts that he had planned, and the outer rooms on all sides, for the treasuries of the house of the Lord, and for the treasuries of the holy things,
verses.textLa: necnon et omnium quæ cogitaverat atriorum, et exedrarum per circuitum in thesauros domus Domini, et in thesauros sanctorum,

verses.textEn: and for the divisions of the priests and the Levites: concerning all the works of the house of the Lord and all the items in the ministry of the temple of the Lord.
verses.textLa: divisionumque Sacerdotalium et Leviticarum, in omnia opera domus Domini, et in universa vasa ministerii templi Domini.

verses.textEn: There was gold by weight for every vessel of the ministry, and also silver by weight for the diversity of vessels and equipment.
verses.textLa: Aurum in pondere per singula vasa ministerii. Argenti quoque pondus pro vasorum et operum diversitate.

verses.textEn: Then too, he distributed gold for the lampstands and their lamps, according to the measure of each of the lampstands with their lamps. Similarly also, he distributed silver by weight for the silver lampstands with their lamps, according to the diversity of their measure.
verses.textLa: Sed et in candelabra aurea, et ad lucernas eorum, aurum pro mensura uniuscuiusque candelabri et lucernarum. Similiter et in candelabra argentea, et in lucernas eorum, pro diversitate mensuræ, pondus argenti tradidit.

verses.textEn: Also, he gave gold for the tables of the presence, according to the diversity of the tables; similarly too, he gave silver for the other tables of silver.
verses.textLa: Aurum quoque dedit in mensas propositionis pro diversitate mensarum: similiter et argentum in alias mensas argenteas.

verses.textEn: Also, he distributed from the purest gold for the small hooks and the bowls and the censors, as well as for the little lions of gold, in accord with the precise measure of the weight, for lion after lion. Similarly too, for the lions of silver, he set aside a different weight of silver.
verses.textLa: Ad fuscinulas quoque, et phialas, et thuribula ex auro purissimo, et leunculos aureos pro qualitate mensuræ pondus distribuit in leunculum, et leunculum. Similiter et in leones argenteos diversum argenti pondus separavit.

verses.textEn: Then, for the altar on which the incense was burned, he gave the purest gold. And from the same he made the likeness of the chariot of the Cherubim, with extended wings, which is veiling the ark of the covenant of the Lord.
verses.textLa: Altari autem, in quo adoletur incensum, aurum purissimum dedit: ut ex ipso fieret similitudo quadrigæ Cherubim extendentium alas, et velantium arcam fœderis Domini.

verses.textEn: “All these things,” he said, “came to me written by the hand of the Lord, so that I would understand all the works of the pattern.”
verses.textLa: Omnia, inquit, venerunt scripta manu Domini ad me, ut intelligerem universa opera exemplaris.

verses.textEn: David also said to his son Solomon: “Act manfully, and be strengthened, and carry it out. You should not be afraid, and you should not be dismayed. For the Lord my God will be with you, and he will not send you away, nor will he abandon you, until you have perfected the entire work of the ministry of the house of the Lord.
verses.textLa: Dixit quoque David Salomoni filio suo: Viriliter age, et confortare, et fac: ne timeas, et ne paveas: Dominus enim Deus meus tecum erit, et non dimittet te, nec derelinquet donec perficias omne opus ministerii domus Domini.

verses.textEn: Behold, the divisions of the priests and the Levites, for every ministry of the house of the Lord, are standing before you. And they have been prepared, and so they know, both the leaders and the people, how to carry out all your precepts.”
verses.textLa: Ecce divisiones Sacerdotum et Levitarum, in omne ministerium domus Domini assistunt tibi, et parati sunt, et noverunt tam principes quam populus facere omnia præcepta tua.

verses.textEn: And king David spoke to the entire assembly: “My son Solomon, the one God has chosen, is still a tender boy. And yet the work is great, for a habitation is being prepared, not for man, but for God.
verses.textLa: Locutusque est David rex ad omnem ecclesiam: Salomonem filium meum unum elegit Deus, adhuc puerum et tenellum: opus namque grande est, neque enim homini præparatur habitatio, sed Deo.

verses.textEn: Now with all my ability, I have prepared the expenses for the house of my God: gold for items of gold, and silver for those of silver, brass for those of brass, iron for those of iron, and wood for those of wood, and stones of onyx, and stones like alabaster, and stones of diverse colors, and every kind of precious stone, and marble from Paros in great abundance.
verses.textLa: Ego autem totis viribus meis præparavi impensas domus Dei mei, aurum ad vasa aurea, et argentum in argentea, æs in ænea, ferrum in ferrea, ligna ad lignea: et lapides onychinos, et quasi stibinos, et diversorum colorum, omnemque pretiosum lapidem, et marmor Parium abundantissime:
verses.notes: Onyx is black, and alabaster is white; so the text refers to black or white precious (or semi-precious) stones, and those of various colors. The island of Paros is famous for its abundance and quality of marble.

verses.textEn: And in addition to these things that I have offered into the house of my God, I give, from my own belongings, gold and silver for the temple of my God, aside from those things that I have prepared for the holy shrine:
verses.textLa: et super hæc, quæ obtuli in domum Dei mei, de peculio meo aurum et argentum, do in templum Dei mei, exceptis his, quæ præparavi in ædem sanctam.

verses.textEn: three thousand talents of gold, from the gold of Ophir, and seven thousand talents of highly-refined silver, for the gilding of the walls of the temple;
verses.textLa: Tria millia talenta auri de auro Ophir: et septem millia talentorum argenti probatissimi ad deaurandos parietes templi.

verses.textEn: and gold for wherever there is need of gold, and silver for wherever there is need of silver, for the works to be done by the hands of the artisans. And if anyone freely offers, let him fill his hand this day, and let him offer whatever he wishes to the Lord.”
verses.textLa: Et, ubicumque opus est aurum de auro, et ubicumque opus est argentum de argento, opera fiant per manus artificum: et si quis sponte offert, impleat manum suam hodie, et offerat quod voluerit Domino.

verses.textEn: And so the leaders of the families, and the nobles of the tribes of Israel, as well as the tribunes and the centurions and the overseers of the king’s possessions, promised
verses.textLa: Polliciti sunt itaque principes familiarum, et proceres tribuum Israel, tribuni quoque, et centuriones, et principes possessionum regis.

verses.textEn: and gave, for the works of the house of the Lord, five thousand talents and ten thousand pieces of gold, ten thousand talents of silver, and eighteen thousand talents of brass, and also one hundred thousand talents of iron.
verses.textLa: Dederuntque in opera domus Dei auri talenta quinque millia, et solidos decem millia: argenti talenta decem millia, et æris talenta decem et octo millia: ferri quoque centum millia talentorum.

verses.textEn: And whoever found precious stones among their belongings gave them to the treasuries of the house of the Lord, by the hand of Jehiel the Gershonite.
verses.textLa: Et apud quemcumque inventi sunt lapides, dederunt in thesauros domus Domini, per manum Iahiel Gersonitis.

verses.textEn: And the people rejoiced, since they were promising their votive offerings willingly. For they were offering these to the Lord with all their heart. And king David also rejoiced with great gladness.
verses.textLa: Lætatusque est populus, cum vota sponte promitterent: quia corde toto offerebant ea Domino: sed et David rex lætatus est gaudio magno.

verses.textEn: And he blessed the Lord before the entire multitude, and he said: “Blessed are you, O Lord God of Israel, our Father from eternity to eternity.
verses.textLa: Et benedixit Domino coram universa multitudine, et ait: Benedictus es Domine Deus Israel Patris nostri ab æterno in æternum.

verses.textEn: Yours, O Lord, is magnificence and power and glory, and also victory; and to you is praise. For all the things that are in heaven and on earth are yours. Yours is the kingdom, O Lord, and you are above all rulers.
verses.textLa: Tua est Domine magnificentia, et potentia, et gloria, atque victoria: et tibi laus: cuncta enim quæ in cælo sunt, et in terra, tua sunt: tuum Domine regnum, et tu es super omnes principes.

verses.textEn: Yours is wealth, and yours is glory. You have dominion over all things. In your hand is virtue and power. In your hand is greatness and authority over all things.
verses.textLa: Tuæ divitiæ, et tua est gloria: tu dominaris omnium, in manu tua virtus et potentia: in manu tua magnitudo, et imperium omnium.

verses.textEn: Now therefore, we confess to you, our God, and we praise your famous name.
verses.textLa: Nunc igitur Deus noster confitemur tibi, et laudamus nomen tuum inclytum.

verses.textEn: Who am I, and what is my people, that we should be able to promise all these things to you? All is yours. And so the things that we received from your hand, we have given to you.
verses.textLa: Quis ego, et quis populus meus, ut possimus hæc tibi universa promittere? Tua sunt omnia: et quæ de manu tua accepimus dedimus tibi.

verses.textEn: For we are sojourners and new arrivals before you, as all our fathers were. Our days upon the earth are like a shadow, and there is no delay.
verses.textLa: Peregrini enim sumus coram te, et advenæ, sicut omnes patres nostri. Dies nostri quasi umbra super terram, et nulla est mora.

verses.textEn: O Lord our God, all this abundance, which we have prepared so that a house may be built to your holy name, is from your hand, and all things are yours.
verses.textLa: Domine Deus noster, omnis hæc copia, quam paravimus ut ædificaretur domus nomini sancto tuo, de manu tua est, et tua sunt omnia.

verses.textEn: I know, my God, that you test hearts, and that you love simplicity. Therefore, in the simplicity of my heart, I also have offered all these things joyfully. And I have seen, with immense gladness, your people, who have been found here, offering their donations to you.
verses.textLa: Scio Deus meus quod probes corda, et simplicitatem diligas, unde et ego in simplicitate cordis mei lætus obtuli universa hæc: et populum tuum, qui hic repertus est, vidi cum ingenti gaudio tibi offerre donaria.

verses.textEn: O Lord, the God of our fathers Abraham and Isaac and Israel, preserve unto eternity this desire of their heart, and let this purpose remain forever, for the worship of you.
verses.textLa: Domine Deus Abraham, et Isaac, et Israel patrum nostrorum, custodi in æternum hanc voluntatem cordis eorum, et semper in venerationem tui mens ista permaneat.

verses.textEn: Also, I give to my son Solomon a perfect heart, so that he may keep your commandments, your testimonies, and your ceremonies, and so that he may accomplish all things, and may build the temple, for which I have prepared the expenses.”
verses.textLa: Salomoni quoque filio meo da cor perfectum, ut custodiat mandata tua, testimonia tua, et ceremonias tuas, et faciat universa: et ædificet ædem, cuius impensas paravi.

verses.textEn: Then David instructed the entire assembly: “Bless the Lord our God.” And the entire assembly blessed the Lord, the God of their fathers. And they bowed themselves, and they adored God, and next they reverenced the king.
verses.textLa: Præcepit autem David universæ ecclesiæ: Benedicite Domino Deo nostro. Et benedixit omnis ecclesia Domino Deo patrum suorum: et inclinaverunt se, et adoraverunt Deum, et deinde regem.
verses.notes: The word ‘adoraverunt’ has a different meaning when it is applied to God than when it is applied to the king. In the first case it means to adore or worship, in the second case it means to reverence.

verses.textEn: And they immolated victims to the Lord. And they offered holocausts on the following day: one thousand bulls, one thousand rams, one thousand lambs, with their libations and with every ritual, very abundantly, for all of Israel.
verses.textLa: Immolaveruntque victimas Domino: et obtulerunt holocausta die sequenti, tauros mille, arietes mille, agnos mille cum libaminibus suis, et universo ritu abundantissime in omnem Israel.

verses.textEn: And they ate and drank before the Lord on that day, with great rejoicing. And they anointed Solomon, the son of David, a second time. And they anointed him to the Lord as the ruler, and Zadok as the high priest.
verses.textLa: Et comederunt, et biberunt coram Domino in die illo cum grandi lætitia. Et unxerunt secundo Salomonem filium David. Unxerunt autem eum Domino in principem, et Sadoc in pontificem.

verses.textEn: And Solomon sat upon the throne of the Lord as king, in place of his father David, and it pleased everyone. And all of Israel obeyed him.
verses.textLa: Seditque Salomon super solium Domini in regem pro David patre suo, et cunctis placuit: et paruit illi omnis Israel.

verses.textEn: Moreover, all the leaders, and the powerful, and all the sons of king David pledged with their hand, and they became subject to king Solomon.
verses.textLa: Sed et universi principes, et potentes, et cuncti filii regis David dederunt manum, et subiecti fuerunt Salomoni regi.

verses.textEn: Then the Lord magnified Solomon over all of Israel. And he gave to him a glorious reign, of a kind such as no one has had before him, as king of Israel.
verses.textLa: Magnificavit ergo Dominus Salomonem super omnem Israel: et dedit illi gloriam regni, qualem nullus habuit ante eum, rex Israel.

verses.textEn: Now David, the son of Jesse, reigned over all of Israel.
verses.textLa: Igitur David filius Isai regnavit super universum Israel.

verses.textEn: And the days during which he reigned over Israel were forty years. He reigned seven years in Hebron, and thirty-three years in Jerusalem.
verses.textLa: Et dies, quibus regnavit super Israel, fuerunt quadraginta anni: in Hebron regnavit septem annis, et in Ierusalem annis triginta tribus.

verses.textEn: And he died at a good old age, full of days and wealth and glory. And his son Solomon reigned in his place.
verses.textLa: Et mortuus est in senectute bona, plenus dierum, et divitiis, et gloria. Et regnavit Salomon filius eius pro eo.

verses.textEn: Now the acts of king David, from the first to the last, have been written in the book of Samuel the seer, and in the book of Nathan the prophet, and in the book of Gad the seer,
verses.textLa: Gesta autem David regis priora, et novissima scripta sunt in Libro Samuelis Videntis, et in Libro Nathan prophetæ, atque in volumine Gad Videntis:
